Employees everywhere!!! In every section of trampolines there was an employee in a bright orange t shirts. Most of them were so interactive playing with all the kids, my daughter was having so much fun with them. 

Cons:
Some of the employees are not interactive at all. They just stand there... one little girl was having some trouble getting her beam onto the balance beam and the employee just stood there while she struggled. Another little kid ended up helping her. However, some employees are TOO interactive. I literally watched an employee hit a kid HARD in the face with a dodgeball. I understand it was an accident, but still. 

The girl I was helped by in the front desk needs some training. I went in during "Toddler Time" where kids under 6 are discounted and the parent jumps for only $2.... well the employee FIRST charged full price for 1 child and 1 adult. When I asked her about toddler time, she changed it. The SECOND time she charged the discount price for 1 child but still charged full price for 1 adult. I finally showed her THEIR menu and explained that I should only get charged $2 for me. She seemed surprised like she didn't know that was an option. Someone else came to help her and corrected everything but the lady should have been showing ME the deal, not the other way around. 

This isn't really negative or positive, but I didn't see a system in place to let people know when they are done jumping. Obviously if I paid for an hour I should stop jumping after an hour, but since I wasn't keeping track of time, my daughter kept jumping past our paid time. I did notice different colored wristbands. 

Overall, we will be back. This place is still new so I think the cons I'm talking about will get sorted out as time goes on. My daughter had fun and that's all that matters. It's a fun place that is still working on perfecting everything.
This is probably my favorite All you can eat Korean BBQ restaurant,Every meat has  high quality and we got awesome service from Jessica.Ill be back.

Came here today for the first time. I ordered half size of the Heart Healthy Salad with optional chicken.  Since I am trying to track my macros it is really great to order something fresh and you can see what you are eating to track. The salad was fresh and super tasty. The staff was friendly and gave me a water to go. Definitely will be back.

This company is awful. I just took a ride to airport and noticed about 2 miles in that the cab took the long way. Ugh this kind of stuff happens all the time in Vegas and pisses me off. Since uber came into town it seemed the cab companies were no longer playing these games. But my ride ended up being about twice as expensive as as it should have been. When i called to complain the supervisor told me he would talk to the driver. That's it. Talk to the driver. That's ur remedy. Please. I will never ride with them again. Stay away.

Excellent meal, great service, and very welcoming.  My wife and I were staying at NYNY and decided to have lunch here.  We found a coupon in one of the Vegas magazines for a free appetizer with the purchase of two meals.  We started with the Beer N' Cheese dip.  The dip comes with a few stick-type breadsticks, sliced fresh bread, and wheat crackers.  The dip was very cheesy and tasted like real cheese.  It was a little awkward to scoop the dip since it was so thick, but it was still a good choice.  For our meals, we had the Sloppy Pat and the Chicken and Brie Cheese Sandwich.  Both were great, I especially loved the chicken sandwich.  Both meals were served with steak fries (chips for you Irish folk)  They were very crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.  We ate them in traditional fashon with vinegar rather than catsup.  

We also had a few New Castles and a Harp.  Both were nice and cold and tasted great.

Overall, the $60-ish we spent on our meal and drinks were a pretty darn good deal in my opinion (we had spent $18 on two hotdog meals the prior day on the casino floor)  Great alternative to a buffet, food is much better quality and left me as much, if not more satisfied.

Needed to get a haircut for the new year, new me...had long scraggly hair and wanted it chopped off. I saw the great reviews for this place, walked in without an appt. and was seen right away by Tiffanie. She listened to me and looked at pictures I had, said no problem I can do that. Cut my hair the way I wanted and I am so happy with it, just what I needed! Thanks, see you in 3 months!!

I really like this place.  They have a good assortment of fish (halibut, haddock, cod and salmon).  I rarely see salmon fish and chips and I'm curious as to how that tastes. 

I've had the halibut and haddock fish here before.  What I like about is that the fish tastes very fresh and doesn't have a huge fishy flavour to it.  The batter is light and doesn't completely overwhelm the fish either so you are actually eating fish and chips, not batter and chips with a small slice of fish in the middle.  The fries here are average and the decor is also typical fast food. 

All in all, a good place for an unhealthy fish and chips fixing!

Best Burgers ever... hands down.... I always get carry out. I have ate in. Burgers always hot and fresh. My favorite is the fried pickle. Order is always right. never a mistake... Cannt wait to eat there... workers are friendly.

Not my first time here.  I came here years ago when I first moved into the area and they were one of the only places in town.  Have been here very occasionally.
One thing is certain, the menu hasn't changed - prices have but not the book itself.  It was tattered and torn and EW!
Ordered the Roti/Curry - still one of the better versions that I've had.  The roti isn't overly buttered but the curry could be a little thicker.  The Flat Noodle - Penang fried kuay teow - was overall tasteless and we couldn't finish it.  The Chicken Sambal - this I liked - lots of flavour and some heat!  And the Garlic Choy Sum - Kang Kong was out yet again - I don't think they ever had it.
Overall, a disappointing take it or leave it 2.5.  I guess I now remember why we came here so infrequently.
Maybe next time we come back, their menu's would be less EW!  Check out my pix on it and see if I am exaggerating!
Cheers!
I was very disappointed with the customer service here. I'm through with Mens Warehouse forever because of this store.

I actually don't come here for pizza, but for their tapas menu. While a tad on the pricey side (average cost is $10-13 per dish for tapas) they do have an interesting variety of appetizers to choose from.

Recommended: Labne (sour cream-like yogurt dip, served with flatbread) and duck tacos. Not really a fan of the hummus here, too oily and actually quite bitter.

Service could be better too, considering how uncrowded it actually is!

Went in to get vitamins for hair growth. They have a huge selection of stuff hence the 4 stars. But they're really expensive:/. Just how all GNCs are. I appreciate how the staff has a good attitude and customer service it's nice to get consults when ur deciding between things!

Terrible experience with this store! The staff is very unwelcoming and just wants your money. Cupcakes are stale and the sugar cookies are left on the shelf for at least a week. Helpful tip: stay far away from this trap of stale lies.
The food was really good however, our waitress Meghan (whom we've had before) was not very pleasant, and has been that way every time we've had her.

This place was ok--I found most of the clothes to be pretty wore and kind of grungy, and didn't opt to try anything on. I did sell some of my items, but the owner seemed kind of snooty at having to look at items while the store was open, but she just had "decided" to close early--about 2 hours early. Nevermind that I had driven an hour to get there, she said that I should have checked the facebook page for her latest comings and goings. Why have posted hours?

Was one of the breakfast joints I wanted to check out and see while I was in town for spring training. Was definitely a place to visit for good breakfast foods.  There was approximately a 15 minute wait which wasn't bad considering how many people were outside waiting to be seated.  I ended up ordering the California Scrambler which was really good but the pancakes are a must have!!!  My friend ended up ordering the buscuits and gravy which I wasn't a big fan of but while looking around to see what others got, everything looked amazing. Will definitely come back here.

Love Davidson's Firearms!! Called around town for an XDM .45 compact and found Davidson's to be almost 60 bucks cheaper than the nearest competitor. Went to Davidson's on my lunch break, paid for the gun, did the paperwork and had the gun in about 2 days (had to be ordered). Only one drawback is the size of his place, if you are claustrophobic you might want to wait outside because the place is tiny, but he did mention he is moving to a bigger place soon. I my self wouldn't care if he was selling out of a pantry, Paul the owner is a cool easy going down to earth guy and Davidson's has my business from here on out!!

I love pizza and stopping in at Pin-Up was kind of just for convenience because of the great location, but we enjoyed the slices we ordered from Karen. Prosciutto and arugula pizza slices and Bud Lights for each of us ($27.60 total). Pizza was pretty good - not a lot of sauce on it but the crust was semi-crunchy, which I like. 

They have a small patio area where you can eat standing outside, but no tables. Our wait wasn't very long to order so I think we got lucky!

Not a fan...  have tried this piano bar in past & always resorts to same old thing.  The twins spend more money trying to get in a bidding war to stop a song then actually sing the darn song... UGH.... Waitress are tired & overlooked our table several times.   Finally went up to bar to get our own drinks... ordered vodka/cranberry & it was so dark I think they forgot the vodka...  The two stars they received is for the fellas that actually sang a bit while we were there..

I've been looking forward to trying this place ever since I saw the signage go up during a stop at nearby Coco Donuts. After my first visit, I have to say I am very impressed and I will definitely be back to try more!

(+) Enjoyed the tri-tip sandwich with a side can of diet coke. The sandwich was outstanding! The sauce packed plenty of flavor and the meat was tender and juicy! Nothing like a sloppy, saucy BBQ meat sandwich!
(+) I am not thrilled that there are no fountain drinks. They do serve their drinks from cans you grab from the cooler, BUT at least the cans are fairly priced t 99 cents! I can rattle off plenty of places that only serve cans, but gouge the *&^% out of you at $2 or $3 a can! Not here.


The sandwich does come with a choice of a side and I chose Mac and cheese (of course). The mac and cheese was alright, if not spectacular. It was the creamy variety, but in a relatively modest portion.

The dining/ sitting area is deceptively large and spacious. Plus there  are a handful of TV's with CNN, ESPN, etc playing for your entertainment. 

Prices are competitive. Not cheap, but not too bad either.

I enjoyed my first experience here and will definitely be back. I am anxious to try some of their cold sandwich selections as well. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.


4 solid stars.

I will be back.

Damn. 

The huz found out about this place on the Las Vegas Beer & Brewery Facebook page. I'm super glad he did.

This place is fantastic. The chef is very creative and literally everything we had was so flavorful and unique.

Best dishes:

Culatello Ham
Butcher Wings 
Campfire Duck
Beef Skewer (my fav)

The manager kept coming over to give us details about the food, which was awesome. He also mentioned to follow their Facebook page for events they'll be doing. They all sounded like a ton of fun.

Guys, this might be one of my new favorite restaurants in town now. The service was impeccable. The food...wah lah. And the overall feel of this place is ridiculously delightful.

Can't wait to go back!

Quadz is always a stop for me when I'm hitting the club nearby, Quadz is a great atmosphere and always has good music playing sweet bartenders and cheap drinks ! The security are always cool to talk to. But most of all Quadz brings in all Friendly people !

Maybe all the good reviews are for the really detailed nails? I understand that there a few different kinds of nail places, you know, the spa-like ones or the in and out get the job done kind. This was definitely the latter but it just seemed a bit unkempt, not necessarily dirty but not really appealing in any way. One of the men that greeted us was very friendly bu the other that did my nails was a bit rude. I think he was annoyed because I couldn't pick a color. They didn't have a great selection of non-gel colors and I had a very specific color in mind. We were the first appointments and the only people there so it's not like a million people we waiting. This was one of the fastest manicures I've ever had!
They cut my cuticles well and lotioned/quickly massaged my hands. There was no scrub and the soaking was awkward, had to cross my arms over each other because the table was crowded.  He did a good job painting them and it helped that with a Yelp check in it only cost $12. 
I'd still go somewhere else for a quickie manicure and I'd absolutely go somewhere else if you're looking to relax - this is NOT the place for that. 
Maybe it's just good for the crazy nails?

They were on time and quick, however they neglected to mention there is a bedbug charge per item. I told them on the phone the reason they were taking my stuff was because of bedbugs. Since they didn't tell me about the charge on the phone I wasnt prepared to spend an extra 210 dollars and i couldn't afford to have all my big items taken. Now I have to fight with my landlord about being in the apartment longer than expected. I knew going into this that they couldn't give me an accurate estimate over the phone but they could have told me about the extra charge.

I loved this coffee shop. The space is so chill and well thought out with tons of different seating spots. Bar seating, couches, benches and tables. It's really well rounded. Plus they serve coffee, beer, and wine. 

I think the best part was the amazing barista. I can't recall her name but she had blue in her hair. She was SO Great! I knew I wanted coffee but not sure what exactly. She helped me pick and iced American with pistachio and rose water Syrup. IT WAS AMAZING. 

She also helped my fiancé decided. He really has no idea what to get and she asked cold or hot ? Coffee or not? Light or heavy? It was literally exactly what you need when you can't decide what to get. He ended up with an espresso and soda water drink that he loved! 

I really wish I lived in the area still because I would be here almost everyday. It's so great and there's so many choices. You must go try it!

Would be a five star but the service is not great and some guy proceeded to have full working conversation during our meal.  

The servers are too focused on their own tables and not helping others by getting the food out.  I saw my sandwich sit ready for 5 minutes.  While my server was busy and the other server just looked at it.  

That being said.  The food was amazing.  Pork Bao and short rib grilled cheese must have.    Pass on fries. Just ok.  

I will come back for food and can hope service is better and other diners work at their office instead of restaurant.

We had a company Amazing Race activity that led us to this lounge as one of our check-in places.  I was surprised at how lovely this place was.  Cozy fireplace and amazing view with balcony.  Just lovely.  I would give it 5 stars but it's a little small so I imagine it could fill up quickly.

Husband and I were walking around Fountain Hills and stopped in Sofrita. We weren't quite in the mood for Spanish style tapas, but still got an app and a few drinks. We enjoyed what we got and figured we'd come back.  Our bill was $22.88 and he left a $4.50 tip- total of $27.38. A week later he noticed we were charged $38.88. He called the restaurant several times and after finally talking to the manager, she said she would investigate what happened. She did confirm that the tip mysteriously got changed to $16.00 and claimed this was the first time this has ever happened. He asked to be informed if she discovered that their receipt was altered....but never found out. He did get a refund, so Sofrita earns "1 star" for that. I would highly recommend holding on to your receipts until charges clear your account. We will not be going back.
I love it here, I come here often and I have a few things sold, giving the good prices and everything is the same as in the show. I recommend everyone to come here at least look.

They played a huge game with me trying to up-sell the extra shampoo service that would have doubled the price. Made it seem like not using the extra service would be no better than not getting the carpets cleaned at all. He even called his supervisor to very loudly (so I could hear him) state how surprised he was that I wasn't going to do the extra service. If it's so important why don't you bring it up in the quote I asked for over the phone? Would not recommend.

It is impressive to have Thai food this bland.  I do not have any understanding of what other people on this page could possibly be experiencing.

Go to Thai Cuisine.  Or if it is Monday and they are closed, Smiling Banana Leaf.

We used King Catering for a few items for my moms wedding and their server/bartender. My mom was very indecisive in what she wanted and King catering was great at accommodating the many changes. When we requested sample dishes they dropped the samples off to us free of charge. The food was good. 
Their server was out of this world and I have never received better service. She was more then helpful and amazing. She offered to help in every aspect and cleaned up before leaving.

I was in the mood for some Portuguese chicken and decided to give this place a try. 
 
We had the food delivered and it was fairly quick.

We ordered chicken thighs, potatoes and 2 sandwiches( beef and chicken). 

The food smelled amazing and was hot, always pleasant when you order lol.

The seasoning of the chicken was good but I wouldn't call this authentic Portuguese chicken. However it tasted better than the other Portuguese restaurant in the neighborhood..

The sandwiches were...okay. The bread got all mushy from the sauce, expected with delivery so This will not affect my rating. The sauce was good but there was something missing.

Overall it was ok.
Sometimes I have dreams about their chocolate croissants. So crispy and the chocolate is melty and they are a little salty but perfectly balanced. Ahhhh.

I'm a veg so you'd think I'd love this place.  The thing is I do...well their food at least.  But their service is pretty crappy. Yet I keep coming back hoping that one day it changes, a year later...NO CHANGE. 
They take FOREVER to bring your food out. I'm talking AT LEAST 30 minutes but that's on a slow night. Up to an hour on a busy night. 
Tonight,  they "forgot to put my ticket up". Really? Yet you managed to bring out half my order before realizing my ticket went missing?? There were 2 parties here before me, how hard is it to put up a ticket on such a slow night. So I have been waiting now for 48 minutes! 
The review from Robert L. said it most perfectly! Please refer to his review as well.

The carne Assad burrito had no beans and no guacomole in it for some reason. It was just meat and pico de gallo and there was more pico de gallo than meat it was disgusting. I m not sure if the meat was rotten or the tomatoes were rotten I tried to eat it but for 9 dollars absolutely terrible. I will not be back.

A great place to get lost in for ages and an amazing place for cute finds!
As you first walk in, you're greeted by a smaller room but fear not! Through a small walkway there is so much more to see.
From soft furnishings, statement pieces, wall decor and floral, the furniture lady has a bit of everything! Most items are very reasonably priced and also not seen on your average furniture or decor website.
I'd just suggest exploring every corner, looking up and down but also in the cabinets because there are so many things you don't want to miss.
I'll always come back here when I'm looking for something to add some class, flair and interest to my space at home.

I was really looking forward to coming to this restaurant. Have been there before once but when I got there today, they were closed at 6pm even though they had advertised their Sunday hours to be opened 5pm to 10pm. Not only were they closed but there was no sign whatsoever to indicate why they were closed. Very inconvenient for their patrons!

Very nice clean place,  big screen tv's great, nice atmosphere, good prices, the asada taco salad was not good ( beans where too salty and too many ), I will go back to try them again, the place is great!!

In regards to the Encore- First of all, my family has been visiting Las Vegas two or three times a year for at least 30 years. We have stayed in almost all of the bigger hotels. But, Encore looked so pretty the last time we visited that we decided to stay there for part of our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Let's just say-I will never ever stay at the Encore again. 
   We had an ongoing problem in our room and it wasn't addressed until two days of complaining. We had been encouraged to pay extra for an upgrade and we took them up on the opportunity. 
  What we got? A smelly problem that turned out to be a SEWER back-up problem that was a frequent issue with a lot of the floors at this part of the Wynn/Encore Hotel. Our clothes smelled like this awful odor too. We tried to get them cleaned, but were refused. When we spoke to a hotel manager we were told that the person we needed to speak to wasn't available for two more days. A huge hotel and no one in customer service? Really? We were only offered a champagne fruit and cheese plate for our trouble and 
 we were moved, but the "new" room was not an-upgraded room and we were charged the same daily price. 
   I've told all of my friends to skip this hotel and never upgrade if they do go. The only difference I saw in the rooms were upper floor was supposed to be a better room. But, it was just the same as our friends' non-upgraded room. 
    
  Encore was very unprofessional about this smelly problem.

The occasion was a late night dinner before hitting a club. We was quite a big party with 11 strong contenders and we got service pretty fast since we were one of the few still at the restaurant.

We started off ordering some drinks and then the food of course. Not everybody was eating so it shouldnt have been such a big hassle to get it going. But the drinks were really slow and they ended up coming just before the food. 

Food was great, as you would expect here, but they didnt manage to keep the concept together. I would have some kind of understanding if the place was really crowded, but that was definitely not the case this time.

All-in-all food and drinks wont disappoint you, but the slow service can!

This is so far the best sushi burrito place i had tried recently around Las Vegas.

Food portion: fish cube is bigger but they have a bigger scoop for the bowl.

Went here with my wife and another couple to watch Star Wars on New Years Eve. We were going to eat dinner here and have some drinks, but after the iffy Yelp reviews, we went to a real restaurant instead. Glad we did - because after we took our seats, I ordered popcorn well before the start of the movie. It took 20 minutes to arrive; and it was cold, and way over-salted. I paid the tab at the end of the movie - over $8.00 for the bucket, and handed the waitress a $20 bill. Rather than making change on the spot, we all had to wait at least 10 minutes for her to come back. Altogether, the waitresses walking around the place during the movie was distracting; the seats, as others have commented, were not very comfortable; and if they can't get popcorn right, I can't see trusting them with anything more complex- like a burger. We won't be returning.

I believe some of the girls (or guys) on here who say they had bad experiences. this salon looks like it has a mix of stylists who are on very different levels of professionalism, but the times i did go, my two stylists were just fine. Rob seems to truly put his customers first and gives modest honest advice. I don't like taking advice about how i should do something for my own hair, but with him i really didn't mind.

Cracker Barrel has very good food, but the serving portions are a bit small. 
Also, the wait time is around 30 minutes and that was for a party of two. 
Overall, the food is good so I would go back

Came in for lunch yesterday and Tracy my server was amazing! She was funny and so attentive. I had the pulled chicken with coleslaw and fries. The spicy BBQ sauce and red sticky sauce were freaking phenomenal. The chicken was so juicy and so good! I live right up the street so this will be my new go to for a lunch spot.

Don't let the look of this restaurant fool you, this place is hidden gem in Mississauga. All dishes are Halal except the beef & chicken patties. My friends & I are regulars here & have tried the Jerk Chicken, Curry Goat, Oxtail, Goat Roti, Stew Chicken & even Jerk Chicken Wings! 

All I can say is, this place has good quality, quantity in servings & consistency in flavor. Try this place out you won't regret it.

We went in for lunch and there were only 3 other parties in the restaurant at the time.  The waitress seemed very nice....at first.  The food was good not great and the prices seem a bit high for how lax they are about customer service and food.  We ordered 2 pizzas and a salad.  We were told the salad would come out first. This restaurant has an open kitchen so you can see when orders are up.  We sat there and watched our salad sit there waiting for someone to serve it to us for 5 minutes.  Not so bad except for the fact that our waitress was sitting down eating in plain view of us while we waited for our food.  This happened all throughout our service.   Very unprofessional and I won't be going back.  I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates good service in a timely manner.

Hard to beat ramen and some of the best dumplings I've had in my life. Everything is awesome here from the music to the service (yes the bathrooms are clean and modern) but what really matters here is the food. The broth of the miso ramen was hearty and delicious. The broth in the dumpling soup tasted earthy and wasn't too salty which made it incredible. The general tso cauliflower was a meal I'd come back for again and again. The cauliflower was so perfect it tasted just like a protein. Perfect for the vegetarian.And last but not least the edamame which was a salty perfection of its own. Tavernakaya is doing some seriously delicious things and the cooks are executing perfectly!

This is my third visit here and every time I leave here feeling the same way about my experience. Let's start with the two cons: high prices and average tasting meals. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad but it doesn't "wow" you. It's just average; you would expect something amazing for a meal that's worth almost 2X compared to other places. Now the pros. From when you walk in the place has a nice ambience. It's dimmed lights, open area for walking and enough room between tables for socializing without feeling confined. The staff is kind and always promptly checking on you: filling your water and asking if there's anything else we need. With that said I only go here whenever my friends want to go for a gathering. This being my third time, i guess that means one of two things; either my friends haven't been here before and want to try out this place, or maybe I just haven't been ordering the right foods. Attached are what I ordered this time. I got the poke nachos(~$14) and the spicy jambalaya(~$18).

I love coming in town, but I love raising canes more.. I see that they are putting a few in Cali, they need to put one in the inland empire.. Hell you can put one right by my house neighbors it is.. 

Thank for the fresh hot food, and the excellent lemonade!! 

I couldn't take any pictures because I was too hungry!

Wow, I have never experienced such a level of indifference to customers and clients!  We were charged late fees for our assessment - which we had paid - and we provided the proof of payment, check number and evidence of the withdrawal from our account and they just continue to send us the same statement over and over despite all of our efforts to clear up the situation.  We have even contacted the manager of the accounting department to no avail.  I would not recommend this company to any HOA who is shopping for a management company.  Horrible experience!

Can't say enough good things about this company! Easy to book online, also has an option to add gratuity (helpful, bc I hardly carry cash!). Both drivers to and from airport were nice as can be. Our pick up from our hotel was way before scheduled time! Sign up for the mobile option so you get text messages about the status of your shuttle; there is also a link to a map to show their location!

I am a huge fan of Panera Bread. That place is an amazing way to start the day.
Friendly, down to earth staff. Delicious food. Cozy atmosphere. Just amazing.
I love eating the Sierra Turkey sandwich with a side of a house salad. Their bakery also has a wide and delicious variety of goods to treat yourself with!

This place is definitely worth another visit.  Went for lunch today right about noon, and there was a crowd, some who seem like they're regulars already even though the place has just been open for a short time.  I ordered black pepper beef with noodles, but was told they were out of a vital ingredient.  The server suggested the spicy beef noodle soup instead.  It was very tasty, big chunks of slow-cooked beef and bok choy with noodles in a dark, rich broth with a hint of five spice.  We also tried singapore noodles and steamed pork dumplings, which were both very good.  The food had that homemade/wholesome taste.  I will be going back to try the endless sushi bar, which at least looked delicious, and of course, the Bento boxes.  The atmosphere is fairly attractive for a quickie order-at-the-counter Asian place, too.  In the culinary wasteland of the University area, this place is likely to do well.
This place is AMAZING!!  The service is fabulous & the food is unreal.  Try the tuna lollipops & grilled corn. Great margaritas too.  So glad to actually have good food in this area of town!!!!

Watched drunk dude put two tall beer cans in his pockets and start to walk out. Told the clerk and she called for help twice and no one came to help her. He even paused briefly before just walking away. QT, legit question, why should I pay for my items when your store doesn't care enough to stop the worst, low energy, obvious shoplifting I've ever seen?  Apparently your store philosophy is to permit sluggish looting and hope some people bother to turn over their money for the same stuff.

I now have been married for 2 weeks! I just finished up my dream wedding here at Stonebridge Manor and it was truly beautiful. First off my husband and I met for our first consultation with Christy & knew right away this was the venue we wanted. We decided on telling them yes later that day and got a few additional perks for their "love at first sight" offer where if you set the date that same time you visit. We met with quite a few of their staff over the 9 months of planning. Toward the last few months prior to the wedding you get assigned to a coordinator for the day of. We asked Christy in private if she could be our coordinator. We ended up getting here which made it amazing! They work with a few vendors that you go through for the photography, disc jockey, florist and they work with one cake company. There are 3 different packages for weddings, each one differs in price and what that includes obviously. We decided on the Manhattan package which was the most expensive but we knew it made more sense with the additional things that would end up costing us equal if not more at the end. You will end up having a vendor night where you go and meet several djs. Oscar was the most amazing dj and kept out guests dancing all night and made our ceremony music sound beautiful. He has such a great personality and was a pleasure to work with. We also picked our florist Jan Dekker, we knew by her adding some greenery before our eyes with a simple arrangement at the open house that she has a good eye. She showed us her other floral events and she does beautiful work and it showed on our wedding day. Lastly we picked our photographer Troy which is such a cool guy. He ended up traveling to Sedona with us to take our engagement pictures (it came with our package ( not including travel) because we asked him if he could make the trip to Sedona.  He was a delight to work with during our big day and evening. Very cool and can go with the flow for a bride like me :) I had my big white tent I always saw for my wedding with the beautiful scenery I envisioned. It was a great memory I loved and wish could have gone by slower. Thank you to our team we were so happy with our choices and how hard they all worked. Christy was a great wedding coordinator!!!

2 stars for the movie.  Seriously, that was some overwrought made-for-TV movie melodramatic bullshit that hammered the simplistic message = 'Protest = patriotism'.  JGL nailed the performance but a documentary about Snowden would be been more apropos than a hammy dramatization.  Ollie Stone... one hot movie every 15 year average.

... however, I guess I got what I paid for?

5 stars for the event.  I had initially planned to watch this movie anyways.  Also, huge plus since it was in midtown and it was a short walk from our place.  Yay for the trivia and prompt start time with no ads.  Nay for the late-comers.

Thanks to Evelyn for organizing.  Not only has she been killing the events lately, but this was a pleasant change-up to the typical events.

Food is always fresh. I enjoyed their Tangra Chicken Sizzler, Sweet and Sour Chicken and Crispy Beef with Machurian Chow Mein and Veggie Fried Rice. We always go here. There is lots of seating. Do try their lollipop chicken. Staff is friendly and their extra spicy is not that spicy. :)

I was so pleased to hear this sweet family owned business opened a new location after closing a few years back.  

I received a gorgeous Valentine's bouquet from hubby and he assured me they are as nice and thoughtful as ever at the new spot.  

The dozen roses are stunning in a vase and must stand 3 1/2 feet tall.  They are lovely and smell great!  These are, of course, beautiful, high quality flowers so will cost more than some places.  However, I do believe their pricing in on par with competitors if not less.  

I can comment on their reputation, as I have received flowers many times throughout the years and they did the flowers for our wedding.  I have always been more than impressed with their product!

My husband and I love Nello's pizza! Not only is the pizza wonderful but well, I'm a big salad person. I love the fact that you can actually take home the salad dressing you had eatten that night on your salad. Everytime we go there I always pick up a bottle of their house salad dressing- it's so good! 

I just wish they would deliever- if they did deliever all the other pizza places we use would go to waysid and mind you, in this house we are very picky about pizza.

Came here 3x on Friday nights. Excellent food, $1/ounce wine, great location. The upstairs sky lounge has such a different vibe from the downstairs. My suggestion is if you're going with a bunch of friends and you're planning on staying for a while, get a table upstairs - it's worth the wait. Downstairs is nice too but it does feel dark, crowded and chaotic. If it's nice out, the small heated patio out front is also an option. Service is your typical King/Queen West hipster style - super casual but friendly. The hostesses are understandably overwhelmed, it must suck to tell 25 people waiting at the door that it'll be another 1.5 hours before they can get seated...and your full party must be here.

First time at Sushi Station.  Kids brought me here for Fathers Day and by the time we left at 5 (we came during happy hour) it was 3/4 full. 

The variety at SS is adequate, with a 100 foot long conveyor winding thru half of the restaurant. The sushi chefs constantly work to keep it stocked with everything from California rolls, spider rolls, Sexy rolls, edamame plates, jalapeño poppers and a couple dozen more types.

The value is not as top notch as you would experience at a traditional sushi bar: the rolls have more rice and less filling but they tasted fresh. 

I read a lot of reviews regarding poor service. Ours couldn't have been better. Our server brought wasabi, ginger and drinks plus she checked on us numerous times, kept our drinks full and kept our table clear of excess. 

Sushi Station is certainly a gimmick but it is a fun place to gather for fanciful sushi. The greatest advantage is that you get to see and try pieces you always wondered about but didn't want to spend $8 for a whole roll. It's only $1.25-$4.25 per four pieces here.

This store definitely gives off a bit of a stingy vibe.   
They turned off the lights in the lighting store.   I understand energy costs can be expensive, but it hinders the shopping experience and the customer's ability to effectively assess the lights.   Their self checkout today was annoying.   A couple of the stands were out of order.   When I tried to go to the regular line up, I was told that was out of order too...   After a bit of a wait, I reached my self check out stand.   I asked the attendant for help who was servicing a line up and when another attendant helped me she couldn't even scan the correct number of items.   

The store appears to be pretty well stocked with items though.   Hopefully today was an off day.

It's always a pleasure eating here! Staff is amazing and accommodating and the food is always fresh and hot. They always have great daily specials! It's a little pricey but the taste and quality is worth it!

This past Saturday we held  my cousins services at this location and they were so nice and compassionate and very helpful . We had not made any memorial pamphlets for the service , simply because it was forgotten , and they went out of their way  to make some for us in house and that was extremely thoughtful .All over very professional and caring.
I can't find a better sushi spot for all you can eat in Vegas than this and I've been everywhere! Don't skip the spicy Seafood Salad, the sauce is addicting!

I absolutely would NOT recommend 24/7 Pool Services. He started out fine, but then got rude and unprofessional when all we wanted was for him to send us a written estimate instead of a verbal one. I'm just glad we found out he's rude before we hired him.

What a Gem! Well you know those nights where you stumble upon a restaurant and just say why not because your just so dayummm HANGRY!!! ( I do know how to spell ;) Yes I mean HUNGRY and ANGRY at the same time!  Well this was one of those times! I have to say I absolutely enjoyed my whole experience here for sure!!! First of it was busy, right after the MMA Awards. I was surprised we were seated so promptly! Excellent customer service.  Our waitress had a strong accent and was a little older with short golden brown hair, she was absolutely a doll!! Had a Monte Christo sandwich with fries and 2 spicy Bloody Mary's. I basically just swallowed my sandwich whole and scarfed down my fries!  Loved the Bloody Mary's. Everyone (all 6 people ) loved their food! Love this place and will most definitely be back just for that sandwich alone!!

This show was alright. Me and my group had a decent spot in the middle. Some tricks were nice but some were boring. Half my group fell asleep. It just wasnt as entertaining as it is on TV which was understandable in certain lengths. But the charity idea of it was nice. Some people will have a hard time finding their spot but theres ushers that are happy to guide you. We bought our ticket for cheaper from the las vegas app and earned points to use credit for discounts. We didnt park near the area we had to travel from metro to metro from the venitian. I would rather try to watch other shows.

I want to give these guys like 8 stars. This is my favorite coffee spot in the city. They make an amazing americano, latte, flat white - you name it. They also have some really unique and seriously delicious menu items (lavender honey latte- like seriously common!). The treats are all phenomenal and are made in house - the hand pies are just little pieces of heaven you can hold with both hands. Lots of tea flavors too. I've never been disappointed with a coffee from this place, they are consistently great. The owner is always trying out new (local and canadian) roasts which is really lovely! Great vibe, good tunes and a huge window for people watching. Best coffee in the city, hands down.

We were going to dinner somewhere Saturday night and happen to see this place from the road. Quickly looked up Yelp and decided to give this place a try instead. A gastropub in Chandler. Intriguing! It's an interesting little place that seems nice. The crowd seems to be older for that night. Majority of the guests were in their 50-60s. 

We saw pork belly on the yelp reviews but alas there weren't any when we went. We ordered the claim chowder and the bruschetta as apps. The chowder was nice but didn't stand out. I guess I should say it was pleasant. For the bruschetta we chose the goat cheese, the wild mushrooms, and the olives. We both really liked the goat cheese with the carmelized onions. Although both of us felt that it would be even better if the goat cheese was warm. I liked the mushrooms and my gf liked the olives.

For entree we picked the beef short ribs, the elk o'bucco, and the crab cakes. The crab cakes were seasoned well and very yummy. The Elk was very dry. It's definitely missing a component of fat to address the dryness. The short rib was much better texture wise. My gf and I both felt that the elk and the beef were vastly under seasoned and needed salt. 

The service was pleasant and the place definitely has potential to be quite good. I'd say 3.5 stars but another half for potential.

Worth a visit if you've never been! The views are pretty phenomenal and on a clear day, you can see really far. The cable car comes pretty quickly so you never have to wait too long for a car. The cable car was a bit creaky but nothing that sounded concerning. 

You pay for tickets at the bottom station, and you can buy one way or round trip tickets (hang onto your round trip ticket, you have to return it when you go back). Note you need exact CASH change to buy tickets. They do have a coin exchanger, but no ATM as far as I could tell, so bring cash and be prepared.

Is this place expensive?  YES!  It is over-priced?  Perhaps.
However, when most bar clientele consists of morons in sweatshirts and stained baseball caps screaming at a TV and "ladies" who just "wanna parrrrrrrty" , going to VTR is such a breath of fresh air!  You are treated like an adult; you are surrounded by class and maturity!
My husband & I can't afford to visit VTR very often, but it a treat every time!
meh. i didnt really care for the sushi or the price.

Top notch supermarket with a corner neighborhood feel and service!  They still have people who bag groceries and courteous tip-free curbside drive up and load your vehicle... Huge fan of their salad bar which has lots of options to choose from and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg to load up on.  They also have a great bakery, deli ( with hot food), great selection of wines and beers, many hard to find brews as well.  Store is always clean and fully stocked!  Huge fan, they definately gave customer service in mind!  Oh yeah, you have to try their homemade Bavarian soft pretzel at the deli.... A newly found vice of mine!

Just wanted to update and say the work this dentists did just fell apart in my mouth. Remember the two crowns I mention and how it wasn't set incorrectly and I had pain... well the crown literally just broke while eating a soft baked, chocolate chip cookie. Don't you love how the most expensive thing you have done at the dentist falls apart on you just a few years later. Fun. What a jerk!

I'll only come back here if someone invents a time machine to travel back 10 years ago.  Just wasn't impressed with my entire meal.  The bread use to be amazing, the quality use to be great & service has lacked luster as well.  I tried

I've been to The Lady Silvia three times now.  I want to like it more and give out 5 stars, but 4 sits just perfect with my conscious.

The Lady Silvia probably has the coolest interior of any Vegas bar.  In fact they take it as far as they can without pushing over-the-top for trying way too hard.

The Lady Silvia is certainly not a hipster bar as some have suggested.  They do things too well here for the hipster to love on it.  The clientele is not comprised of hipsters.  The drinks & the prices do not speak  to the hipster.  Having said my peace  there I can now continue to review...

The drinks are one of the areas that prevent The Lady Silvia from attaining 5 stars.  There are several solid classic cocktails, as well as a few original creations that are enjoyable.  The drinks just fall a little short...lacking balance and proper execution generally speaking.  The prices have dropped from when I first came in though--the house crafted drinks going for $10 or $11 as opposed to $15.  

The bartenders also earn the 4 star mark...better than the average bar tender, but not the exceptional mixologist that I would expect upon entering into The Lady Silvia.

The Lady Silvia also has a wide array of events and weekly alterations to their normal business flow.  This is not good or bad in and of itself.  I am not into their attempt to be a sports bar during football nights, but others appreciate it I'm sure.

They also offer some CLASSIC Spanish style tapas for a couple of bucks.  They make for some nice snacks while you drink.

For me the hero is the ambiance and atmosphere.  And I will return again for that.  The Lady Silvia is a perfect place to come with a group of 4 - 6 friends who want to relax, enjoy some conversation on some uber cool couches, and have some good drinks....the pictures do not begin to do justice to the decor inside.

The Lady Silvia also lacks any sign.  I like this.  You have to find it to enjoy it though.  Enter on Hoover between the Globe Salon and the Gallery of Contemporary Art.

Based on the exterior and decor of this restaurant it doesn't look very appealing,  but I have to say it's one of those 'hole in the wall' places with surprisingly good food! 

I got a gyro dinner for about $12. The gyro pieces were huge, and it was fresh and delicious. Similar to Jimmy the Greek chains,  but the portions are even more generous,  including the tzatziki! 

Overall,  good service,  bang for your buck in terms of portions,  and great taste.

I'm sour, and will probably be finding another place. 
Been coming here faithfully for 18 months, and it seems they had an issue with the guy that ran the. 3rd chair. They have never found a replacement and now the waiting times and the number of people waiting has increased substantially. However ( not using names) the guy that now moved to the middle chair, constantly stops and talks to the people waiting, takes off to the room at the top of the stairs for 5-10min intervals in the middle and before calling the next person. The other guy doesn't. What I feel should be an in and out in 30-40 mins max is now 1 hr+. It's too bad because these guys really know their stuff.

Such a welcoming and comfortable salon ,cozy waiting space. I've been getting my haircut by jaime for about 5 years now and I love it every time. Jaime always listens exactly to what it is that I want and delivers. The quality of the products Jaime uses are wonderful leave your hair feeling great. Easy to find the salon and theres alot of parking space and very clean environment.  Definitely will be back and will recommend to anyone to trust their hair with Jaime.

Sooo good and fresh! I'm a sucker for plain glazed donuts and there's are so plump, doughy, and delicious. You can really tell their fresh. Nice selection of assorted donuts and I haven't had one that wasn't good. Their coffee isn't bad either, especially for a cheap donut spot. Drive thru and combo meals are convenient and service is always great.

I pass another local Ace Hardware to get to this one! Super friendly staff and have everything you need. They also have an amazing "bolt room" that has just about every kind of nut, bolt or screw that you can imagine.

I live a few doors down, and all of the food at FeelGoodGuru is fantastic.  Although the prices do seem a bit high, the quality of the food and the intricacies of each dish can be seen.  All time favourites = Avo & Cheese Sandwich (try 1/2 w/ salad); no bull buritto; hemp shake, juice cleanses (order in advance).

Best thing ever: cinnamon bun

Went here for lunch today. It was their grand opening. Quite busy as it was the lunch hour and right across the street from the Court house so a lot of county employees. Plus they offered a free taco for their grand opening which was an additional draw. The location is shared with the future Sultan's Grill, in a food court like open space. The tables appeared were mismatched and at least a few of them appeared to be purchased used, possibly from a shut down Italian cafe, as they had Italian pictures painted on them and the chairs had paint chipping off which again indicates, used furniture, neither here nor there just making observations. They were not completely ready as they are still painting the logo on the wall and making other adjustments including not having all the menu items there for purchase yet. 

So as to the rating, I went back and forth on what to rate them - I know I have high standards and am critical and I know I am especially critical of taco places. Just having eaten at Taco y Taco last week and being a fan of Tacos El Gordo and Los Antojos, I just expect or prefer a authentic experience. Cilantro (which does not appear to be affiilated with the Cilantro on Rainbow/Smoke Ranch) appears to be a chain, or at least have three other locations, in the Chicago area - and they state "A Taste of Chicago". Now, maybe I don't know much about Chicago but tacos are not the first thing that comes to mind when I think Chicago food. 

I ordered three tacos, barbacoa, al pastor and asada. The tacos were on corn tortillas and street taco style and size. I thought it was a bit pricey at $2 a pop. The meat did not have a lot of flavor and the barbacoa was quite fatty, and yes I know it is pork which is fatty but I bit into chunks of fat. That being sad the barbacoa was probably my favorite of the group - fat = flavor. Also ordered a tamale, I asked and they said it was house made. I ordered the pork, it was really really dry - so I doused it with hot sauce. The tamale was $2. I tried to order the chile relleno taco but they don't have chile relleno's yet. 

As to the service, maybe they are still working out the kinks as they just opened today but it was painfully, and I mean painfully slow - and 7 people working behind the counter. Plus, they need a microphone or a different way of calling out the numbers because they call the orders by number and it was really hard to hear them and in fact the customers were talking and relaying the numbers called amongst themselves. 

Also, I think that It would benefit them to provide a salsa bar to their patrons. They only provided salsa in bottles, likely house made but there was a green (tomatillo) salsa which was salty and did not have a lot of flavor, at least to me, and then a red spicier salsa. But the number of bottles were limited, I was lucky enough to snag a red one, but there were not enough for every table. Maybe they expect patrons to use the salsa bottles and leave them up there for others but I like to have ample salsa while I am dining.

After all this - I really do wish them well as they are a new business, and I am sure there is a segment of the population that will love and adore their food. Like I said before I am critical but wanted to not let the fact that this is their first review change how I would normally review things, and I would have given them three stars but for the service.

In business in Chandler and stopped by here. It's not as fancy as some of the other places but wanted good food and good drinks. Was not disappointed. Sapphire was my sever (yes she said it with a straight face and I bit my tongue) but she was very cool. Worth a Friday night outing. Music not too loud either so you could chat no problem.

Closest Koreatown without having to drive to LA. 

been here a few times now and what brings me back is my summertime favorite combo - mixed neng myun + galbi. their ban chan can used a little work but service and flavors for all the dishes ive tried are on point. most recent i tried the korean fried chicken and had a spicy hot (not that spicy but had a good red pepper paste aka ggochujang and sweet flavor) + garlic, both good flavors. 

nomnomnom!!

Second time being here and I love this place!  I always order the all you can eat sushi, 'cause hey, who doesn't love sushi? 

My two favorite rolls were the snow white and the burning your boom hole... absolutely amazing!!! 

Highly recommended... two thumbs up!!!

I had the opportunity to see the Goodness Gaycious show 4/25/15 and I have to say how impressed I was by the production and performers. It's fun and cheeky and sexy and all that stuff I kind of anticipated from a burlesque show, but it was also something entirely different. 

I liked the way Lucy put it, as the Master of Ceremonies for the evening, burlesque classes (and these performances) are more than dancing or taking off clothes, they are about coming to an expression and appreciation for who you are - regardless of how you think you look, your gender or sexual orientation. This is a beautiful sentiment - and one that most people might recite as some kind of Martin-Luther-King-esque-platitude - but Romantasy Cabaret lived it during this performance. 

There was a joy and an abandon to the performances that was inspiring. It was a celebration of all things and all people. It was a blast. Obviously - this is an adult oriented show of an erotic nature - but breasts and asses and beautiful women of all shapes and sizes aren't the point! It's just a wonderful side benefit to the celebration of life on display. 
 
I thoroughly enjoyed it and left inspired. I will definitely be attending another performance!

Is it too soon to refer to Body Blitz as my happy place having only visited once?  I hope not, because I'm already thinking about when I can make my next appointment!

I checked out Body Blitz East two weekends ago as a birthday treat to myself.  I booked my appointment about 1.5 weeks ahead of time.  They didn't have space available for me to have a scrub AND a massage, so I opted for just the scrub.  It was admittedly a bit disappointing because if you add a massage to your treatment, you get it at a reduced rate  That being said, I was bound and determined to enjoy a spa day for my birthday, so I settled for just a scrub.

I arrived early in the morning (9:30AM on a Saturday), and I'm glad I did.  When I entered the waters, there was only one other person present in the sea salt pool (and two in the sauna).  When I readying myself to leave (post treatment, around 12:00PM) there were a few large (and noisy) groups getting ready to start the circuit.  When I visit again, I will once again opt for a first-thing in the morning circuit.  The room is large and echo-y, and I can imagine my experience wouldn't have been as stellar if I found myself in the pool with a large bridal shower party.  There are signs everywhere asking patrons to respect other spa-goers, but I can imagine this isn't always the case with these larger groups.

I really enjoyed the water circuit.  I've done water treatments before at other spas, but I've never felt as relaxed as I did at Body Blitz.  When I first stepped into the pool, I was a bit worried I'd be bored without my phone or tablet (I know, I'm the worst).  Once I actually let myself relax, I relished being away from these distractions for 1.5 hours.  The time flew by.  I did the circuit as recommended the first time around and then adjusted based on my preferences the second time.  I loved getting an iced tea brought to me poolside.  I felt so pampered.  There was a spa attendent overseeing the waters and change rooms, but I never felt her presence to be intrusive.

As 11:00 neared, I rinsed off in the handy pool-side showers, and waited in the luxurious lounge chairs for my treatment.  Brittany showed up promptly at 11:00 and ushered me upstairs for my body scrub.

I will admit - if you're not comfortable with a perfect stranger seeing you in various states of undress, a body scrub is not for you.  The room I was brought to featured little more than a large, vinyl-cushioned table, a stool, a hose, a heat lamp, and a disposable thong for you to wear.  You CAN opt to have the scrub done in your bathing suit, but I'm not shy.  Disposable thong it is!

The treatment started with a full body wash down while I lay on the slab, face-down, followed by the salt scrub.  After that half was finished, I was flipped over for the same treatment on the front of my body.  My eyes were covered with a warm towel (protection from the bright light of the heat lamp), and I admit that there was a moment, as my mostly unclothed body was being hosed down, it felt a TEENSY bit like I was lying on a coroners slab.  Having not treated myself to many experiences like this before it took some getting used to, but I just reminded myself that I was being pampered, not prepped for autopsy.

After the scrubbing was completed, I was dried down (as was the table).  Looking at the clock, I was curious how the next 35 minutes of my 60 minute treatment would be spent.  I was delighted to learn that remainder of the time would be spent moisturizing my body from head to toe.

Once my treatment was over, I wasn't as upset that I didn't get my add-on massage, because Brittany massaged moisturizer into every part of me, with special attention paid to my disgusting runners feet, and my office-job forearms.  After 60 minutes I felt like a whole new person!  It may not have been RMT, but it was relaxing and rejuvenating!

I was so delighted with my first Body Blitz experience!  From being provided with a robe, towels, flip flops, and a locker (so I could pack light) to small touches like the fresh lilies in wall-mounted vases in the washrooms, Body Blitz was just what I needed to usher in a new year.

Some complain that Body Blitz is on the pricey side.  My scrub cost $140 (before tax), but that included access to the waters (which cost around $50 on a normal day, I believe).  As well, Body Blitz does not allow for tipping.  I didn't ask why.  So before tax, my 60-minute scrub could be said to cost around $90, and was worth every penny.  For me, I can definitely see myself earmarking $140 every couple months or so to enjoy this experience once again.

Great for kids. A bit overpriced given that you can do the whole thing in an hour however I came towards the end of the day and missed the last movie so can't comment on that but I think this was maybe 20 mins long.

I had the hongkong style lobster combo. It came with seafood soup, steamed bokchoy, grilled bass, and lobster mountain. I went with a group of four. We paid extra $10 to get king crab chilli instead of bass. The lobster mountain was delicious. The lobster was very meaty, spicy and tasty. 
I was not a fan of the soup, it tasted very fishy and I wish they gave us miso soup instead.
I am not generally a fan of crabs so I didn't like that as much.
In total the price was $238 and for the experience and really good lobster, I say it is a must try once in your lifetime.

Great service  despite 20 minute wait for  a table on an early Sunday evening. Server recommended Cobb salad, which turned out to be awesome, large and filling, Unfortunately no space left for cheesecake :(

Switch has been my favorite restaurant for every and any meal since 2008 when I moved to Phoenix. Always have the best service (LOVE YOU DUSTY!) and the food has never been anything less than exceedingly delicious. It also is not expensive. My  menu favorites include the jalapeno and bacon clams (the bread is unreal), BLT sandwich, turkey and brie gallette and pretty much any of their weekend brunch specials. My only suggestion is that they start serving brunch 7 days a week!

Napoleon knows his BBQ!!! His pulled pork was melt in your mouth tender, his ribs were perfect, and his sides were also perfect!!! I am from Memphis, but enjoy all styles of barbecue. His techniques will bring you exactly the barbecue that you'll enjoy for your event. I was not the one who hired him on this event, but he is in my go to list for any event I cater in the future!!!!

Horrible manager in this joint. Horrible!!! Can't run his staff so the wait time is extremely slow. When you place your order, oh they have the bagel you want, BUT by the time you get to the cashier to pay and wait for your grub(27min for a pretzel, and jalapeño cheese) they're coming back up to you and telling you, oh I'm sorry we are out of that bagel". Third strike I'm out for me at this location!!!!!

I'd heard about this place a few times and wanted to go during Glendale Glitters, but was under the impression that it was just a little bit closer to the rest of historic downtown Glendale and couldn't convince my foot-sore friends to make the venture down that way. Finally made a point to go check it out during the Glitter and Glow block Party and was very happy with the experience. 
They let you try one chocolate and I swear, after that you want to try them all. Friendly staff and a fun nostalgic atmosphere. During the Glendale Chocolate Affair we did the short walk-through tour and found it interesting. Watch them hand dip strawberries, coat almonds and decorate pretzels. I'm impressed by their efficient combination of machinery and human workings. 
I'm also impressed with their selection of sugar-free sweets and will be back soon to purchase some for my diabetic father. 
I think it's worth a visit any time you are in the area.

A bucket of crab partnered with corn on the cob results in a pretty happy self. Nothing outstanding, but everything you'd expect from a seafood chain. They even start the disco lights and do a little dance randomly during the meal. Left satisfied without hurting my wallet.

This store reminds me of growing up in CA...
I would always go into our local health food store and find any and everything I wanted.
I typically look for items I cannot find in big stores. What I love about Berry Brooks was the homely feeling and the fact that the cashier took her time to hear my needs and grab all the items she thought would benefit me..she was honest enough to let me know what I didn't need as well.
Left out of there with Acidic water (free) (for my face), alkaline water for me ($1.96/gallon), probiotics, African soap, facial lotion, vitamins and a PB& J smoothie 
Hadn't received customer service like that in a long time.
This is some of the most delicious ice cream!!! Such cool flavors like the guava and lychee that I got!

The menu is way too big, which is typically a bad sign for a restaurant.  After eating our meal at Chompie's Deli, we've decided to change our opinion on this stereotype.  Compie's has a 7+ page menu and serves breakfast/lunch/dinner all day long (some plate options aren't offered till after 11am), but we'd guess that everything is amazing.

All the food from our order was fresh, tasted amazing, and came in huge servings.  You don't need to order the Man vs Food challenge to leave here stuffed.  In fact, we wish that they offered half servings of some of their meals and sides.  My wife loved her Jackie's Dipper, but would have been fine with half the sandwich.  The menu says that the Awesome Crispy Onion Strings serves two, but we felt that, with a sandwich, the appetizer/side would be perfect for 4-5 people.  You know that a dining experience is almost perfect when one of the only complaints pertains to "way too big portions."

Establishment is immaculate, employees are professional and extremely friendly, and the location is very convenient.  The prices are little bit expensive, but are offset by the sheer quality of the ingredients.  Besides offering some smaller portion options for some of their items, the only other suggestion we have would be to add a pickle on the side with sandwich orders.  We will definitely eat at Chompie's again before we finish our visit in Phoenix.

Spontaneously planned a trip to Vegas with some family friends but the hotels near the strip was ridiculously high because of the weekend. Found this and booked three rooms during the memorial weekend and I'm so glad I chose this hotel! We got three king bed suite w/ sofabed and it was very spacious. Very clean as well, friendly staff, and ample amount of outdoor parking. The breakfast selection was pretty good (waffle maker, fruits, oatmeal, eggs, juices, etc). We felt really safe because even though the plaza where the hotel was located was surrounded by restaurants, no one can get access into the building or other amenities without swiping the key card. 

The location was convenient because it was close to major stores like target, subway, tommy's, DD. Another perk which I was so happy about was that a Nike factory store was close by so we didn't have to go to the outlet mall.

Oh! Btw, I booked through the hilton website and when you sign up to be a HHONORS member, you get the lowest prices and the staff greeted us with goodie bags. 

If you don't mind the drive to go to the strip, I highly recommend it here. I would stay here again. Our family friends really liked it as well and kept raving about how spacious and clean it was.

It was too humid inside for a place to sit and eat. The tables were sticky because the varnish was coming off and settling on the edges of the table. Service was slow for an occupancy of 2 tables. The Mongolian beef I ordered was tough and the flavor was gone in 2 bites. Took a bit of time to get servers' attention.

What a terrific local restaurant, tavern, local brews!  I had the Copper (amber) beer and pasta!  Good food reasonable prices nice ambience!

Special thanks to Kaylor, the bartender for her hospitality!

Ordered the don katsu curry and gyu curry!  Ive personally been to japan many times and have had many gyu don's.  This is not bad.  Good beef, curry can be improved and pork cutlet can be crispier.  good friendly service.  Still have some way to go to be comparable to ones in japan.

My Mother died early this year.  We hired West Coast Movers to pack and move her antique belonging from Scottsdale, AZ, to Sacramento, CA.  We received all sorts of oral guarantees.  The packers were nice enough although they arrived 8 hour late.  We paid extra to ship certain items as standalone (nothing stacked on them).  When the shipment arrived several weeks later (8 hours late again) over one-half of the items were damaged.  The items we paid extra to have nothing stacked on them were at the bottom of the pile and damaged.  They did not seem to care.  It was like they ignored the issue entirely.  They directed us to their claims department, which I am convinced is a sister company.  We submitted a claim for over $8,000 for replacement or repairs.  It took five months of chasing the claims company and re-sending photographs multiple time to finally receive a settlement offer of a grand total of $180.  Yep, they wore me down.  It was a take it or leave it offer.  I either needed to sue them or accept the office.  I accepted the offer just to settle my aggravated health issues caused by these yahoo's.  The check arrive three weeks later.  Yes, you guessed it the check was "unsigned"!  I am now nine months into the process and have received nothing.  Run from these people as fast as you can.

I always try to make it to the Dane County Farmers Market when I'm in Madison. With the abundance of quality produce, cheese, baked goods and people watching, you really can't go wrong. There are tons of samples and new things to try, prices are reasonable and a walk around the capital building is a lovely way to spend a beautiful afternoon. 

Love love love it here.
Good variety on the menu. The food is good like usual Udupi restaurants, just that the portion size for dosa is too big and service was slow.

Stumbled into Tilt Arcade Bar the other night and I truly had such a blast at their new location. 

Pretty decent selection of games from the old era of coin crunchin' video gaming, with enough drinks and snacks to boot. Best of all the games are free and the environment is pretty friendly considering it's a gaming free for all. 

What better way to get out some post-work aggression by bopin' crocodiles on the head or saving Aerosmith from the New World Order? 

Prices are fair considering that the video games are free - when we went it wasn't too crowded, but I can imagine on a weekend it being a bit of chaos. 

Would love to see the establishment open early so that families could enjoy playing some of these classic video games, such potential to be more of a family oriented place during the day before the mad rush of hipsters crash the joint. I can also see things being problematic with customers not wanting to get off machines, or the wait time being too long to play certain games. I know the establishment promotes a sharing is caring vibe, but perhaps they need to promote the culture a little further with a "one and done" turn... or perhaps, one life then offer the game up to anyone lingering before dropping an extra life. 

So close to giving this guy a 5 star review, I'll have to revisit to give it a fair second chance - I guess I'm looking for my socks to be blown off with something different, although my feet tapping the whole time. 

Regardless, this business is worth our patronage and in turn they will deliver some great times and quarters saved.

Like chinese food? Love spicy food? Must try Backyard Garden.  The food is simply tasty. Lot of flavour. They use alot of peppercorns in their dishes. I Love their eggplants and pineapple fish.  

The restaurant is simple and unassuming. Waiters don't speak english very well but enough to get by.

It's worth the drive to Markham from Downtown.

I really wish I had known how good this place was. How have I lived in Pittsburgh for two years without trying this place? Anyway...

I came here to meet a couple of my former nursing school now nursing friends who I haven't seen in much too long because of our different schedules at work. I came a bit early for dinner but I saw one of my friends already waiting outside. He apparently had an smartphone app that showed him how many people were ahead of our group, which I found pretty cool. In a few minutes, we were seated and more of our friends started arriving. The interior is fairly spacious, but was packed because of dinner and the hockey game on TV. Speaking of TVs, you will have little chance missing anything happening because they were placed all over the place!

Our hostess seated us in the small outdoor area that had two circular tables with umbrellas. It was a nice cool day outside, so we were pretty happy. Apparently we just missed happy hour, so we had to order drinks full price. No problem. I took a look at the drink menu, and wow, I couldn't decide. After several minutes, I finally ordered Fat Head's Trail Head pale ale. It tasted hoppy with citrus overtones, a refreshing choice for the night.

I then look at our menus. Considering it was the first time for a few of us, one of my friends persistently recommended the Chik'n Little headwich ("chicken Fingers dunked in our Original Wing Sauce topped with provolone, 2 fried eggs, American cheese, ham, bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion and hot pepper mayo"). I thought to myself, "Wow, as a nurse, I'd be crazy to order that!" Nevertheless, two of my nursing friends ordered it... -_- .

Well, considering I am vegetarian, I chose the Portly Fellow headwich ("Portobello, roasted red peppers, and fresh spinach topped with tomato sauce, basil pesto, Arrogant Onion Rings and mozzarella, goat cheese and Parmesan"). My other friends ordered garlic fries, which was amazing! When my headwich came out, I almost fell out of my seat because of how huge it was. Mushrooms, cheese, onions rings, and sauce were oozing out between a large burger bun with a huge steak knife impaling it right down the middle.

I thought to myself, "I shouldn't have gobbled down this fries..."

Several minutes later...

"That was delicious! Wow, did I just each all of it?"

Yes, it was that good.

After we paid our checks, we even decided to have some ice cream from a place right down the street. Well, why not?

Overall, food was excellent, drinks were excellent, and customer service was great. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Southside.

There are few things I dislike more than crowds and snowbirds. Cracker Barrel has both in force! The kids love this place. We cave every so often for their benefit.

Let's start with there always being a 20+ minute wait. Then you have to dodge snowbirds, children and merchandise in the hoarder-style, overfilled Country Store. I feel like I'm in Pac man trying to get to breakfast while being blocked by ghosts and Yankee candle displays. 

I get to my table, which have the hardest, wobbly wooden chairs ever. The tables have so much junk on top we can never fit the food (or beat the peg game). My drink is slow to get refilled, and I've rarely had a visit when something in the order is not missing. And for crying out loud, I want the breakfast menu. Does anyone in their right mind want the dinner menu here?

Then after your meal, you reverse your way through the maze to pay your bill. Holy moly people, take my money so I can get the rock out of here! The ghosts are chasing me again, this time out to the parking lot where a hundred snowbirds impatiently wait on the walk in rocking chairs with their oxygen tanks, playing checkers.
Amazingly delicious. The lady that helped us was so sweet. She let us try everything we wanted. Very pleased! Great gifts to bring back home from a Vegas trip!

This place was highly recommended by a couple of people. The place looked nice and the staff was friendly. They had a pretty decent sized menu and I was debating on a couple of things. I got the corned beef hash which was good, and my fiancé had the biscuits and gravy & really liked it. The down side was that they advertised they had the best bloody Mary's and it wasn't good at all. It said it had a fresh tomato pinwheel & bacon, and mine was only served with a green bean, olive, and lemon. And the mix wasn't good either, not very flavorful and  tasted watered down. And I'm sure this would be different if I was going back to my house or something, but the portions were monstrous! I'm one of those people who hates wasting food and there is absolutely no way I would be able to finish any of the plates they had there. I wish they would've told us how extremely big the portions were and we could have split something. And again if I would've been going home I could've taken leftovers, but we were walking the strip so that wasn't an option. Since I hate wasting food, we overstuffed a Togo box, which shows how much food we both had left, and gave it to a homeless group on the strip asking for food. So just a heads up from the staff to anyone that hasn't eaten there before would be nice.

Chris is really great & does great work - HONEST :) Chris has been cleaning our pool now for 5 months & I am grateful.
No more worry's going on.
Chris is punctual & quick & respects the APS Bill.
Thanks Chris for all you do.
Sincerely,
Janine (Regina)

I love this salon-especially the new owners because they're very friendly. They really treat you well when you walk in and make you feel welcome and the shop is CLEAN. I was offered water while I was waiting for my mani/pedi. I didn't have an appointment and they look booked up, but luckily Tina was available within five minutes. She was great, friendly and my nails turned out just how I like them. She cleaned up my nails (cuticles) up well and I love that. I've been back three times with Tina. This is definitely my go-to spot!

It's sad to see the negative reviews from the past because the new owners have changed the morale of this shop. Customer service is their priority. Thank you for caring about your patrons :)

Surprise, surprise- this experience was a bust. 

My first encounter with Greasy Spoon took place over a year ago. It was an extremely underwhelming meal, and I left thinking 'Pft, not comin' back here...'. 

Alas, a girlfriend of mine celebrated her birthday this weekend and wanted to dine at the high-end (read: overpriced) diner. So, I walked into the joint with a smile and hopeful expectations. Unfortunately, mediocrity literally greeted me at the door.  I was the first to arrive, and was seated by a bored gentleman who felt no need to show me the drinks list or menu while I waited. Once the other girls arrived, we were taken care of by a rushed waitress who immediately offered the disclaimer 'I don't speak English.' Good thing we weren't tourists from Connecticut. While I am relatively bilingual, I do expect that wait staff and other service professionals should be able to address me in English. However this is a tired Quebec argument that I don't have the patience to discuss further. 

Our service was very slow, and our food was a 6.5 at most. While I understand that Greasy Spoon offers small portions, the resto should at least offer good food to compensate for its pricing. I ordered the salmon tartar and octopus salad, and both left me cold (and hungry). My overly spicy tartar was gone after two bites, and I was then left with a mound of tasteless potato chips- certainly not worth $14. My next course consisted of heavily oiled and mushy potatoes, topped with a few nibbles of rubbery octopus. 

Our dirty dishes (though not entirely empty- we left behind the revolting tater tots) sat at the table for quite a while before our waitress cleared them. She didn't offer us a second round of drinks or dessert, so we decided it was time to cut our losses and bounce. Much to our dismay, we were held hostage for another 20 minutes waiting for her to return with card machines. I was seriously contemplating a dine and dash, but a random staff member swooped in at the last second. What had become of our waitress? Frankly, we didn't care...
