Recently visited this new location and We loved it! We have been waiting years for something to open in this space because we are regular theatre goers, and it is attached to the theatre( don't have to go outside in the winter). The food was tasty and the staff were wonderful! We will be back!!

Open concept. First time visiting. I am sure they have their good nights, but tonight was not it. Sat at main bar. 1 bartender who seemed overwhelmed with making table drinks and other customers. Took sometime to even say hi to me. And throughout the night it seemed to take forever to even refill my drink which I needed up switching from whisky to water cause of it. And I ate my entire dinner without a follow up visit. Asked about the noodle broth bowls and picked a suggestion. Assuming I would get a broth noodle bowl. But sadly I got a noddle bowl with very little broth. The pot belly gave the noodle an odd taste. Noodles seemed dry even with some broth. It actually felt like I was eating the less than $1 Ramon noodles. And for the price the the amount seems small. Now that could have been the style of bowl used. But it turned out to be just right. 

Sadly I was testing this place for a future visit for a date night. I suggest finding another place. For this reviewer will be going elsewhere.

Rode my bike from San Jose to Las Vegas. Unfortunately, it just died due to an electrical issue in Las Vegas. Faced with the prospect of having to ship it back to San Jose or getting it fixed on short order, I desperately called BBV Powersports.  They made it their top priority and did everything they could to help.  Bike was fixed the same day. I am not only satisfied, but I am grateful.  These guys are pros.  Everybody here is very pleasant, competent and trustworthy. Definitely recommend! I didn't get his name but one of the technicians has 30 of experience with motorcycles! Wow! Justin manages their service department. Such a great guy who goes the extra mile to take care of you.  Kind of guys you want to invite to your backyard barbecue. Thank you!

Great food, place is very nice and our server was a very pleasant lady. She was very good on recommending the food and drinks. The food was excellent as the service. Is in a great location in Las Vegas , will definitely visit again. We actually recommended the restaurant to the hosted at our hotel to advised guest that want to go outside the strip.

The juice standard is a great place to pick up cold pressed juice. They have just about every blend you could want. I do enjoy their nut milks as well. The staff is friendly and helpful, offering samples of the blend before you buy.
Eric is a master of his craft. Took my long, dull, lifeless hair and made it voluminous and bouncy while preserving my length.

Om nom nom.

Tellement pas bon pour la santé avec le sucre et tout, mais pour le bien que ça fait à mes papilles et à mon coeur, je me fou complètement du nombre de calories qu'un de leur cupcake risque d'ajouter à mes hanches. Je ferai le pire des pires workout du monde pour manger un de leur cupcake. Oui, ils sont si bons que ça!

Vous pouvez les acheter à l'unité, en double, en demi-douzaine ou en douzaine pleine, soit en format mini ou régulier. Le staff est super gentil et n'hésites pas à vous jaser pour expliquer ce qui fait de leurs cupcakes les plus extraordinaires en ville. Le triple chocolat, il est fait avec du cacao pur à 90% qui vient de Colombie et qui n'est disponible à aucune autre cupcakerie quelle celle-ci. Ça parait aussi que le soucis du détails pour chaque cupcake est important car ils sont tous excellents, et selon moi, il n'y en a pas un qui est meilleur qu'un autre.

Ma fête est dans 5 mois... Essayez dont de vous souvenir de cet avis si vous vous demander quoi me donner ;) (Je vous taquine! Mais sérieusement, c'est quand même une bonne place à considérer...)

My favourite movie theatre of all time. It is clean, neat, and the settings are very comfortable.

It is very close to Métro Atwater, so the transportation is very convenient. Also the boutiques and stores within the complex can keep you busy while waiting for the movie.

The service was super slow. The restaurant was not even half full so we assumed that we would be able to get in and out of there pretty quickly. Our waiter was not attentive at all. After we had to ask for our check we waited for a long time, so we had to ask him for it a second time. Then it took him forever to bring my credit card back to me so that we could leave. We will not go back.

Mike offers a very efficient service and completes the work in a manner that is both personable and professional. His rates are very reasonable and his most often repeated phrase is ''don't worry about it - it'll be two seconds.'' From start to finish, the painting that he did in my office (and his helpful advice on poster framing, cable managing, everything else!) made it a breeze to organize. I'll be calling him again!

**If you own a turbo N54 or N55 engine take it here!**  They are very knowledgeable on how they work and how to diagnose effectively.  Example, When the dealer tells you its bad gas get your keys immediately and take your car to AZ bimmer.  Zak is knowledgeable where he doesn't need to "check" he just knows exactly what needs to happen.  They proactively tested an intermittent issue or faults, and inspected brakes at no charge while the car was in to really make sure the car was good to go.  Communicates via phone, email, text exactly what the process is setting expectations and providing updates.  My experience was top notch, and recommend every BMW owner to visit this shop to get the job done right the FIRST time, and on budget.  Zak, the owners, and the staff are passionate about BMWs and providing the best customer experience!

They gave me Yesterday's soup and it was a delicious French onion! The Brussels sprouts were also great. And we enjoyed the goat cheese. Brittney was OUTSTANDING, friendly, professional, and knew the menu very well.

We showed up at maybe the worst possible time...6:00 on a Saturday when Ohio State was playing.   We had gone to our app and put ourselves on the waiting list, but still had to wait over a half hour once we arrived.  The bar here isn't set up well, because if you can't get a seat, there is no where to stand.   We all would have had a drink while waiting, but it wasn't possible.  

Once we were finally seated, we waited 22 minutes before a server came to take our drink order.   That's crazy to me.   I know they were busy, but at least stop by and say you will be back soon.   

We had received an email that offered a free appetizer so we ordered the lettuce wraps.    Our drinks finally arrived and the appetizer shortly after that.   These might be the worst lettuce wraps I have ever had.   The lettuce leaves were huge and crunchy, but we were given the smallest bowl of filling I have ever seen.   The 4 of us each had one, but maybe had 2 teaspoons of filling in them.   The sauces were both tasty, but the filling itself was bland.

The menu is extensive and some things are repeated, so it becomes confusing.  I opted for the half rack of ribs, mashed potatoes and asparagus.  Food came in a timely manner and was at least warm.   The ribs had a great flavor with a bit of spice, but there was hardly any meat on them, which was disappointing at the price they charged.  The mashed potatoes were good, but the asparagus was over cooked and over peppered.   

Others had the Parmesan crusted chicken and the jambalaya and were ok with their meals.  

When our bill arrived, she had not deducted the appetizer even though she had the information on the coupon, so we had to wait for that.

I want to like this place because it has a varied menu and we have had better experiences at other locations.  Will give it another try sometime.
Wonderful, creative dinners and small plates.  They are also gluten-free friendly, using gf soy sauce, and our waitress was extremely knowledgable. My only complaint is that it is way, way too noisy.

"I have a bad feeling about this..."

I first attempted to visit this place during their opening 2 weeks. When I went, the dining rooms were quite full, but all the diners looked unhappy.  The harried waiter said that we coudl eat there, but it would take 1.5 hours to get our food due to the kitchen and servers being too busy. It was not laziness on his part, but rather that there were 2 servers for 2 dining rooms. I saw diners who looked very unhappy with nothing in front of them. We quickly left.

I returned in 2014 for dinner and fortunately it was not the chaos we previously encountered. The layout of the restaurant is very odd--I get the feeling it would be more successful if they didn't have 2 dining rooms. At night, the curtains to the dining room are halfway  up; however, it doesn't block the headlights of cars that park directly in front of the building so you get big shining lights in the restaurant if someone's starting up their car.

When asked, we said that we were OK sitting anywhere in the restaurant, which was at less than 25% of capacity. Yet we were placed in a table in view of the restroom.  

I'm not sure our server checked on how we were doing 1x while we were eating.  The dishes were really expensive; you basically have 3 kinds of main entrees and a lamb tagine is $17 with no sides or appetizers.  As for the food, if you told me that the tagine was from any part of the world, I would have believed you. It did not have any distinctive flavor other than meat&veggie stew.  The b'stilla, a dish with cinnamon, sugar, eggs, pastry dough, and chicken, was all right but a little more quiche-like than being encrusted in pastry.

I am very glad we had a Bucky Book coupon as this was not worth the full price, and I don't really consider it to be worth the coupon price either.

Get a pie (pizza) with meatball, pepperoni and ricotta. It's awesome. The antipasto was great as well. Friendly staff and nice location inside the Palazzo.

No major complaints here.

u been warned, a waist of time, we try so hard to stay awake and like it. Ewey 

Le Reve "The Dream" at the Wynn, Las Vegas
Will blow all cirque soleil away, yes even O

I like to come to this restaurant because of their purple theme interior decoration.

The popcorn chicken and beef noodles are my favorites at this place.

I usually come during lunch hours or late afternoon.  This place was never busy.  I believe this is a family-run restaurant, service is warm but it needs to be more attentive. I usually have to wait for quite a while or just walk to the bar/counter area to ask for service or to place further orders.

However, this restaurant fulfills my need whenever I am craving for Taiwanese food.  Comparing with Pa Pa Cheng, this restaurant provides comfortable and classy seating.

We had 14 people in our party.  It's a small place.  They took our reservation anyways.  Kudos for this alone.  The wedding soup was phenomenal, and the pasta dishes were more than legit.  We made a lot of noise.  They just smiled and welcomed us to come back.  This is a pretty darn good Italian restaurant.

We got out!  It was fun.  The room held 10. Our group of 4 was the only ones.  We were worried that we would not be smart enough to get out and we would be there forever.  Not so. We got some help clues from the intercom and we got out with 3 min to spare.  Very fun. Even with only 4
For the price the place is i was very disappointed with the food. I rather go to sushi at the lake which is 5 min drive from there and eat cheaper and much better.

This place was absolutely beautiful.  Ive been here before to walk around and eat, but it was really nice staying here.  They have floor to ceiling windows that overlook the pool.  Stunning.  The room is a good size, not humongous but quite enough in white and cream decor with spices of andy warhol style bright art on the walls.  The bathroom was huge, 2 sinks and bathtub, separate toilet section, shower.  Automated curtains and your name on everything.  
Comfortable bed with a swivel flatscreen TV and your room key is an automatic players card.  Sweet. 
The pool was cute.  They have cabanas and two big pool sections with a canal connecting them.
It feels luxurious. =)

For around $30 a plate I was expecting to receive tiny tiny portions, but I was surprised that the portions were plentiful!

Service was wonderful. Water glasses were never left empty and the bread kept coming.  My sister and I both got the chicken entree and it was the most tastiest chicken I ever had- cooked to perfection. The mustard flavored potatoes were VERY finger-lickin good!

I would suggest coming here if you wanted a nice evening dinner/lunch/brunch, not if you're on the go, looking for a quick bite. 

I would come again! The waiter even offered us free tequila! =)

I came here with another fellow Carmen to try the famous paella de Carmen and we were so stuffed by the end of the meal. We ordered the paella as soon as we sat down since they warned it would take ~45 minutes to cook. 

They don't skimp on the seafood in this dish. We shared the fried artichoke for the appetizer as we waited for the paella. Between 2 people this was more than enough. We came on a work night in the middle of week, so the restaurant wasn't too busy either.

Since this is tapas, I would love to return with a larger group to try more dishes!

Gross! The steamed rice was mushy and watery. The chicken lo mein noodles were undercooked and not tasty at all. I I ordered a side of teriyaki sauce for the rice and it was tasteless. General Tso chicken was very chewy and not edible. The egg roll was suspicious. My kids enjoyed the spring roll but that was it. Waste of money!!!!
This is my first time n will be my last time, came here with my family. Pho taste very nasty n high price, the veggies is not fresh, prices is too high. Will not come back

This is one of my favorite places to eat, especially as someone with an intolerance to gluten.  They have a whole gluten free menu with wonderful selections.  

The first time I went there was right before Thanksgiving so they had a gluten free pumpkin pie as well as their regular gluten free chocolate dessert.  Our server brought me a piece on the house.  I was so happy I almost cried.  Pumpkin pie is something I was really sad I couldn't have (my mother later found a great GF recipe for pie crust and whipped up one for me, but I didn't know this at the time) and he was so sweet to bring me some for free when I had a hard time deciding which dessert to try.  

I try to venture out on the menu, but I always end up with the babyback ribs because they're SO delicious.  The mashed potatoes have nutmeg in them and are to die for.  The shoestring fries are really good too.  The honey glazed carrots are also tasty.  Everything I've had has been top notch.  They've got it all at WCG-great food, great drinks, great desserts, great atmosphere, and great service.  

The wait can be long but you may be able to make reservations; I'm not sure, as I've never tried.  

The patio is even nice in the Winter if it's not TOO cold (which, in this part of AZ, it typically isn't), because it's mostly walled in and has heat lamps.    

You can dress up or down and it's appropriate either way, but I guess if I had to pick, it's on the nicer side probably.  You won't feel out of place in jeans, however.

Delicious flavorful Thai food. Got the panang beef, yum nua, and pad prikh king. Everything was so yummy! Meat was good quality, curry flavorful. Got spicy level 4 and was warned it was spicy, they were right but it was the perfect level for me (I tend to like food on the spicier side). Will be back for sure :-)

Service sucks sooooooo bad. I waited 25 minutes for a bowl of chili? Really? Did they have to hunt a cow? I mean you scoop it in a bowl and you serve it. It should only take 5 minutes but 25 minutes???? I walked out.

So excited I found this place! We started a family tradition, when we found this pumpkin patch! Hay rides, searching for the perfect pumpkin, apple cider doughnuts, and pictures perfect moments that will last a lifetime. The apple cider doughnuts are the best thing I have ever eaten!

My husband and I come here as our go-to date place when everything else fails. The owner/manager - when he's in - gives everyone complementary spring rolls and he is very accommodating and also makes sure that his customers are happy and satisfied. The waiting staff could have a little more personality but the food makes up for that. My faves are the tomato based ramens. The reward system they have is good incentive to continually come back but with technology these days, they could upgrade from collecting stamps on business cards to some kind of app? Or permanent reward card. Parking can sometimes be a hassle, but nothing I can truly complain about. 

My only irk about this place is space. It gets busy and when it does, customers are left to wait in the tiniest foyer and sometimes even outside. A majority of the time, customers are waiting with the door open staring at you eating your food. And when it's cold, you don't want that damn door open with cold air on your hot ramen. I wish they could do something about that, but I know that is not possible. 

So for now, I give this place 4.5 stars out of 5. I'm going to come back regardless.

When I lived at NIagara and Adelaide, I'd go to Sadie's Diner pretty often with roommates, or friends. I love how kitschy the place is, and the servers are always friendly. That being said, the food isn't great - the breakfast options are usually just okay, although portions are huge. My favorite item on the menu? Chocolate, peanut butter, banana smoothie - BEST IN TOWN. I really like their coney fries too.

We ordered their pizza after watching a concert on the premises. We were starving and wanted something quick. They closed at 10pm on a Sunday night, so we actually rushed out ahead of time to make it there before closing. We ordered a whole 18" pepperoni and sausage pizza. There were two workers; a young guy and girl. The guy originally told us that it would be 30 minutes for the pizza, but the girl told us 15 minutes, which it actually was. 

We were right about the crowd... As we waited for our pizza, more and more people showed up with the same idea. Some people ordered ahead with an app or online. Others just got slices or ordered whole pizzas like we did. If you order a slice, they pop it into the oven for a bit to warm it, even though ready-made pizzas sit under the heat lamps. 

Customer service was pretty good. No complaints, there. This was our first time eating here and the pizza was good. It was hot, the slices were big; when you order, you can choose if you want 6, 8, or 12 slices. It wasn't the best pizza in the world, but it was good and it definitely hit the spot late at night.

I went in to order some wings the bartender MJ immediately started being condescending and rude to. The guy next to me turned to me without me saying a word to him and said she's rude to everybody. I ordered some wings she said it would take 14 minutes 33 minutes later I got them and they were overcooked crispy Critters. I asked her her name and she ignored me. So I asked her again and she said MJ honey sarcastically. I said did you answer me the first time and I just didn't hear you. Then she said to me in front of other customers why are you  yelling at me? All I did is  ask her a question. If I had called her honey it would have been sexist. 

 I told her that I haven't not tipped anyone in over 3 years and that I was not going to tip her. I asked her if she wanted to know why and, she said I know, sarcastically. Then  she said I'm going to start treating everybody else in the bar differently right now. Not me, just everybody else. Another sarcastic comment.

I gave her the chance to apologize but she chose not to. Is she just apologized for her rude Behavior would have tipped her but she didn't care. So I don't care if I go back there.

What can I say. It was quite simply just an amazing culinary experience, the best Japanese dishes I have ever tasted.

Small restaurant space but cozy, cultural and unique. (It's what I would expect in Tokyo) The staff are extremely friendly and the chefs work at god speed. The dishes are not expensive at all for both the quantity and especially the quality, the usual individual bowls and dishes are about $15-20 each. We decided to try just about everything we were interested in on the menu, and ended up spending about $40-$50 per person. The uniqueness of the dishes is hard to find elsewhere in North America. The 1 hour of waiting on hungry stomach while blocking sidewalk traffic on the street? WELL worth it. I would have waited for another 2 hours if need be.

The ambiance of this place may not be ideal for a date who expects the sophistication of fine dining. But have been raised in China, I love this tiny place where people can sit side by side and watch the chefs work their magic and truly experience the amazing dishes with the culture. Doodles of the menu items are scattered across the walls of the restaurant, quite sweet and special. 

Tuna Belly - This is got to be the best fish I have ever tasted. With a price tag of $35, you get a gigantic dish that's cooked to beyond perfection. The meat is tender and the texture is so soft that it melts in your mouth, the fresh taste of the tuna meat is not lost in this perfectly flavored dish. We found ourselves flipping the fish over and over many times to try to find anything that's left to eat.

Shrimp Burger - I ordered this for my main dish. It's definitely the most unique thing I have tasted, chunks of shrimp is pressed into a burger patty, lightly seasoned, sitting in between two lightly grilled buns topped with fresh lettuce leafs and tomato slices, as well as an extra hint of crispy from rice crispies. Light and fresh, without the usual greasiness associated with burgers, special and excellent.

Tuna Tartare and Salmon Tuna Bowl - Both dishes contain raw fish, high grade salmon and tuna sliced into small chunks, paired with seasoned sticky rice and veggies. There was no extra taste of 'seafood' in the dish at all for those who doesn't fancy raw fish for that reason.

Grilled Shrimp - This is probably among one of the heaviest thing we ordered - flavor wise, and it didn't taste heavy or greasy at all. Three extra large shrimps plated with tomato, sesame seeds, sitting in a special grill marinate. The shrimp's flavor is so intense and concentrated it's quite amazing, the grilling is done to a perfect level - you could taste the extra flavor coming from the grilling alone.

Gyoza - 4 gyozas pan fried and plated carefully as an appetizer, with the perfect proportion of meat (inside) to dough (outside). The grilled bottom thin and crispy, the sides thin and soft, and the inside juicy and tender. 

Matcha Ice Cream - Homemade ice cream with matcha powder on top. Heavenly! The bitter taste of matcha combined with the slightly sweet ice cream. Almost make you want to lick the little ice cream teacup.

We ordered various other dishes and it's not an exaggeration to say that everything was cooked to exact perfection.

Kazu really gets it, the true meaning of perfection and has earned its special place in this food-enthusiast's heart.

Great spot for the whole family. I loved the environment and the healthy food options for all. 

This plate is called the "Mean Bean" with sweet potatoes & it was oh so good! Small spicy kick to it, nothing their NONE-fructose corn syrup soda with refills couldn't wash down. They are Vegan and Gluten free friendly. I will go again!

Remember that line in the film Liar Liar, "I've had better"? That was my exact sentiments after eating here. My husband and I split the burger and fries with Swiss cheese and I ordered two glasses of wine and a mango drink my husband wanted, $50 later we were like why it's happy hour? Didn't know the mango drink was almost $20, worse yet, my husband couldn't even drink it because it had too much sugar! Little noisy for my age and taste since I used to live in college town while getting my first Masters degree at Arizona State, other than that we won't be back. We did go to Lucille's BBQ to pop in for a drink afterwards, now that was AWESOME and will be another story for later.

I have eaten here for dinner twice and Sunday Brunch once.  Came back because we really enjoyed the food.  Service could be slow but it wasn't awful.  I invited 2 friends to join me here for lunch.  I got there first, waited at the front desk, and waited, and waited.  No one ever acknowledged my existence.  It was not crowded at all.  There were 2 customers at the bar and 2 men sitting at a table eating.  When my friends arrived, the three of us stood there for a few more minutes and then gave up.  Before leaving, I walked over to the bar where an employee was joking around with someone and I told her we were leaving because no one seemed to want to seat us.  She acted surprised that we were there and offered to seat us then.  Too late.  We crossed the patio and went to King's where we had a great meal and super attentive service.  I'm sorry because I really liked the place but they just don't seem to care if they have customers or not.  No wonder it was so empty.

pretty cool production, out of this world stage, awesome creativity, a definite must-see in vegas! can get at least 30% off tickets from www.tix4tonight.com. probably can find a better deal than that but that's where we got our tix from. definitely have to see the rotating stage!

This place has really gone down hill.

I had eaten here a few times and thought it was pretty good. Then we went for lunch and it was  incredibly busy one time we went for lunch with a 40 min wait so we decided to leave.   We went back a week or so later for dinner.  We had an incredibly long wait in the bar that seemed  to last forever even though there seemed to be plenty of tables on the patio.

They sat us inside in a very small room sandwiched in-between the kitchen and 3 large groups of very loud annoying people. There was only 2 of us not sure why were were relegated to such a terrible table.  Our food tasted terrible, oily, and the vegetables in my burrito were undercooked.  We didn't finish our dinner, paid and left.
I have a pretty strong stomach, but both of us got extremely sick from the food after we left. 

If you have to go here make sure you sit outside so you don;t get stuck in one the terrible side room.

Great decor and vibe! Finally something different for Calgary! The pineapple chandelier at the entrance is fabulous. The drinks were tasty and reasonable. We had a few bar snacks and they were all great. Service was good too! We will be back. Thank you for not opening yet another tv sports bar with waitresses in black dresses. Calgary needed you, Ricardo's.

AWESOME!!! Great atmosphere! The food is wonderful!!!! Fresh oysters shucked right in front of you. We had the best time and it's always a treat to have a really good fresh seafood bar in your city! Concord needed a Full Moon Oyster Bar! Highly Recommended

Came here for an early lunch and really couldn't have been happier. Excellent, refreshing cocktails and cool, shareable foods. I had the garbage fries and fish tacos and both were excellent. Fries have a lighter cheese based sauce on them and are topped with the kitchen sink (fresh jalapeños, bacon and more), very good. Tacos came as 3 smaller tacos, very well made on corn tortillas and bursting with flavor. Indoor/outdoor seating make this place a gem.
We love this place!! Best custard ever great after a meal or movie outing with the family. Chocolate with wet walnuts .

The experience and the food was excellent. 

I loved the fact that you could see Lynn Crawford working away checking everything that went out of the kitchen. 

I'll definitely go back.

We visited Cleveland to see the Art Museum.  Little Italy is just around the corner.  We ate at Etna the first night there and went back for the second.  Little disappointed.  An amazing wine list for a place this small, including a huge number of bottles by the glass.  Not to mention the food was extravagantly good.  The other places seemed to have menus that specialized in deep-fat fried or lots of cheese.  This one appeared lighter.  Still, I'd have approved of less olive oil in, well, everything, given my fat restricted diet.  Nevertheless, I ate it all both nights.  Three hours for our meal at the bar the first night, an hour and a half for a lighter meal at a reserved table the second.  The second night I asked for less dressing and they accommodated.  Free desert (not that I could eat it, but my wife enjoyed it.)

If you can get a table, go.  If they'll reserve a place at the bar, go.  Otherwise, be fair, and try the others.  I can't see how they'd be able to beat this place, not with the heavy cheese on their menus.

Awesomely efficient. We were in Vegas for a convention and noticed a liquid leak after being parked just as we were going to head home. Found Dave's through yelp. Conveniently open on Saturday. He diagnosed the problem quickly and even went to the dealer 20 minutes away to get the part for us. He had us road worthy in under 2 hours and didn't charge us an arm and a leg. Definitely gonna use him on any future visits to Vegas.

Service was nice enough to switch my drink for something else after I didn't like the first one they made. I had the mistake of ordering a hot matcha latte instead of a cold frappuccino. Warm matcha is an acquired taste

I enjoyed my lunch here, it was good. We had the 4 piece fish basket, chili cheese fries, fried mushrooms, and my husband ordered the cheesy cheese burger. Fish plate was good ...it came with coleslaw, homemade fries or homemade potato chips. I have to say the French fries were some of the best homemade fries I have had, I think ever! The chili fries had homemade chili and was OK I wasn't a fan of that chilli on those fries. Fried mushrooms were good. My husband ate the entire burger which is huge so I guess you can say he really liked it. The theme is 60's and very cute and relaxed. Service was great and server was friendly!

Great Pizza. Easily one of the best in Montreal. (Tried the cadanese)

Disgusting Pasta. It tasted cheap and the sauce tasted as if it was out of a can. 
(Tried the fetuccini with tomato sauce and Italian sausage)

I recommend avoiding the pasta and simply going for the pizza.
I've actually not once had a bad experience at this location. Bacon cheddar wedges for the win!
All I gotta say is Wow! Hidden gem of Vegas! Garbage Fries are delicious, Montecristo is like woah! Beers on tap and music matches the atmosphere!

Having spent three decades living and travelling in areas of heavy Chinese populations in both Asia and along the West Coast, I have never been a fan of the Chinese Restaurants here in Cleveland (in fact, typically avoid them).  Hunan in Solon is clearly the dramatic exception!

The food at Hunan is authentic - not just "close".   Full of marvelous flavor and character, I particularly enjoy their barbecue spare ribs (appetizer, $7.00), Cantonese-style roast duck ($15.00), and choy sum with oyster sauce (requested, off the menu).  Of course their menu offers the complete "standard fare" known at area Chinese restaurants but at a far better quality.  For the more adventurous, some of Hunan's more flairful entrées include Singaporean Chow Ho Fun ($10.00), Tangerine Beef ($12.00), Lamb Scallion ($12.00), and Beef Yau Tsoi Portabella Mushroom ($13.00).

The interesting thing is Hunan incorporates other Asian palates into their menu, including Korean (like the spare ribs appetizer I mentioned) and Thai, such as fresh spring wraps and a complete line-up of Thai curries available in 9 meat/seafood/vegetarian selections.  I would estimate their offerings weigh in between 75% Chinese and 25% other Asian.  Typically this is a dangerous premise for a restaurant to attempt - but Hunan's execution of this diversity is flawless and spot on!

The cost ranges from average to a shade under pricey for the less mainstream, more exotic items in regard to the price-to-portion ratio.  However, once you sample the cuisine you will quickly discover you are clearly getting what you pay for.

The restaurant is located on the industrial side of Solon, easily accessible south of 422, across the complex of small hotels.  Use caution: it's relatively small and insignificant-looking in the small strip mall it's situated in and can easily be overlooked.

Some may criticize that Hunan is still Americanized or Anglo-Chinese.  True.  It is important to keep in mind this is the best Chinese Restaurant in the area but it must still cater to the NEO palate.  Personally, it is not 100% what I'm used to in Singapore, Honolulu, or San Francisco but for Hunan to mimic that level of authenticity and expect to stay in business in NEO would be unwise.  On the positive side, Hunan Solon has successfully bridged that crossover well enough that Chinese dignitaries we host have made repeated requests to dine here. (An alternate menu is available for Chinese readers.)

Best Chinese Restaurant in Northeast Ohio?  Hunan Solon is without doubt a prime contender for that title.

I loved me some BBQ, so when I saw some scrumptious posts on Instagram, I added Ohio City BBQ to my foodie to do list. 
The restaurant is the traditional BBQ joint set-up: order at the counter to eat in or take out. The menu options are somewhat limited, but it's to be expected. It would be nice to have slightly more flexibility, such as making your own combo of meats, etc. But since it was my first time, I wanted to try almost everything, so I did by ordering the Ohio City Platter. In retrospect, I should have gone whole hog and gotten the Ultimate because then I could have also tried the sausage. Next time.
The Ohio City Platter comes with pulled pork, beef brisket, and ribs, baked beans, cornbread, and your choice of macaroni salad or cole slaw - I went slaw. The meats are extremely tender and good quality. I chose sauce on and it was sweet and tasty. The ribs were great, but the bark is real - word to the wise with any dental work/concerns, as I chose to pick and tear versus sinking my teeth in.  The portion are huge - I had a ton of leftovers - enough for 2-3 additional meals.
I'd have to agree with other reviewers who said that what is keeping this place from being spectacular is the sides. I appreciated the sweeter take on cornbread, but it was most likely a box mix. The slaw was basic, also not homemade (I fancy myself a slaw connoisseur). The baked beans were okay - my companion immediately identified them as Bush's, and I don't doubt that they are also not house-made.  The sides are the reason for the 3-star rating. Beverages are all prepackaged from what I recall. House lemonade or iced tea would be a nice option.
BUT, I truly cannot say how attentive and friendly the staff is! Seriously awesome and lovely. The decor is also great - kinda dark, but in a good way. 
Tons of photos and info, which I liked - nothing wrong with getting your BBQ on and gathering some knowledge at the same time.
They are located right next to The Grocery and we didn't have any trouble finding parking on one of the side streets.

Very good burgers.  Perfect size. Bun was light and tasty.  I had the Shawn Burger, very good. The egg and bacon was cooked perfectly. My wife had the Mikey Burger and she enjoyed it. Good beer selection.  Gets crowded quickly.  Bartender was very pleasant. We ate at the bar and our only complaint we had is where they collect the dirty dishes. Well in sight of those at the bar and  the loud clanging when tossing dishes in the bin

Wow ... what a great place! It was crowded! I'm from LA and wanted to get away from The Strip. My friend recommended this local spot and it definitely hit the spot. It was really busy.  Kind of strange that there are no pagers/buzzers for this place, but the Hostess said she would come find us at the bar area.  I was skeptical, but okay.

Started the evening with a pitcher of white sangria. YUM! It could have had more fruit, but it was refreshing nonetheless.  About 30 minutes later and 2 couples who got there after us were seated before us, I asked the hostess how much longer it would be. It was clear that she forgot. Intuition correct! As a result, minus 1 star.

Delicious: The bacon wrapped dates are great, as well as, the apple manchanga salad. However, I would do the salad at the end of the service, instead of the beginning. It's a great palate cleanser. Only okay: The lamb skewers with lentils were good but the lamb was a bit charred. The eggplant cannoli was also good but the goat cheese overpowered the dish. Beef empanada was okay. YUM: Dessert: banana nutella sandwhich and pistachio gelato. All that for under $40. Great pricing. 

Definitely worth checking out.

This was my first time ever coming here. I have to admit... For what they charge to stay here, I expected so much more. It was an hour-long wait standing in line to Simply get checked it. This was completely unacceptable. While one of the two adults were in the lobby in line and the other adults at in the car with the three children, valet came and hopped in our car and moved it. It was quite awkward. We finally got to our room, without much customer service from the girl at the front desk I might add. The room was nice and clean. Because of the long wait, we only had about 45 minutes down at the pool before they closed for the day. We were walking back to our room from the pool area, in a few doors down from our room was an extremely strong smell of marijuana. We got in our room hung out for a few minutes, went out on our balcony... And there was the smell again! We called down to the lobby to complain about the smell of pot stating that we had children here, and did not need them hi on our vacation and to please look into it.  They never followed up with us nor did we see any staff come around our room. We only stayed one night at the resort, so can only say how things went on this day. I can tell you that at checkout, that was another 40 minute Excursion. I don't know why the lines run the way they do, but they really need to get to handle on things. It was very discouraging and not much fun of a process to check-in or check-out.

This is not my first choice, (I'm a fan of 808 Mixed Plate, Island Style, and Island flavor) but after a long day and craving local grindz, L&L will do in a hurry as its the closest spot near us, like 5-10 minutes from home.

Their Mini Katsu Curry hits the spot ( It ain't ZEN but it'll do in a jiffy) and will hold me over until my next craving hits for some quick and cheap local grindz....ALOHA!!!

Hotel is off the strip which is one reason I choose it. It's not so crazy to get in and out of. They also have a bus that runs every half hour and goes to the strip so you don't have to worry about parking. Rooms are clean but they lack enough outlets.  Staff is really nice. I will definitely stay here again.

Can you say "crooked"?  I contacted Camelback Kia yesterday regarding an advertised car, a 2014 Kia Soul.  I have had contact with 4 salesmen so far.  Once they got my number, they seemed to swarm in like pirhanas.  One salesman, Mike Kimbrell, sent me an email confirming the "ePrice", which was the stated advertised price.  Salesman Blake Walker called me and talked in circles when I asked about the $3819 discount.  Another salesman named Ron K. called and left a general voicemail, but I haven't spoken with him.  I then texted Mike, since I wanted to clarify if there really WAS a car for the advertised price.  I got a rather rude text back.  He responded as if I were interrupting him.  I told him never mind, I'll contact someone else.  A little while later, another salesman named Robert called me.  After asking him pointed questions, he did acknowledge that the "discount" is only a discount if you qualify for THREE different incentives, such as, being a recent college graduate (nope, 20 years ago doesn't count ;) military service, and some type of financing discount (IF you're applying for a loan.)  I don't qualify for any of those incentives.  The advertised "discount" is the combined total of all the possible discounts.  I think that Camelback Kia is a very crooked business.  I would suggest that you look elsewhere for your new vehicle, if you can find a dealer that is actually truthful with their advertised prices and discounts.

Oh my goodness! The adobada taco is a must!! It's so delicious I regretted only getting one! 

Be careful when you wait in line at this place. The lines can get really long and you have to know exactly what you want beforehand. You wait in line for the type of meat you want. For example, if you want asada fries you have to wait in the asada line. If you want asada tacos too you need to tell them when you order the fries otherwise you'll have to go to the back of the line! There are pretty much two different lines. One line is for asada, mules, sopes, and chorizo whereas the other one is for adobada and al pastor. Plan ahead! 

The carne asada fries are not that great here. It's not hot enough and the sauces added on top are cold which makes for a weird combination. Maybe the adobada fries are better.

The hype is real ladies and gents. The cupcakes from Urban Cookies are amazing. I bought a box of 12 for a dinner party last night, and I was lucky enough to get half off for them as I came during happy hour. I bought a variety of their cupcakes such as their most popular one, brown velvet, and peanut butter and birthday cake. They were so delicious. The frosting was just the right amount of sweetness and totally addicting! The cake itself was so moist and tasted like it just came right out of the oven. Definitely better than sprinkles cupcakes. I have yet to try their cookies and their donuts.

I was excited to try these cheesesteaks so I stopped by for lunch and got a large to go, I figured for $11 and change for the sandwich it had to be good. I'm sorry to say it wasn't, very bland taste and smaller than I would think for the price. I'm glad I got it to go and ate it in my vehicle to hide my tears.

This mall has it all! Hey, I'm a poet and don't know it! Haha! Anyway, in all seriousness, this mall has THE BEST stores and shops and the food court is pretty exceptional! The Macy's and Dillard's here are the best in overall greatness ( customer service, selection, prices) and I love all the other stores such as Hollister and Sees Candy; they are classy and amazing! The food court is so much fun to work in( I worked in the Subway there a few times) and the Dairy Queen taste so good! People that shop and work in this mall have class and are fun to talk to!! I highly recommend this mall!

The place wasn't the cleanest to start with.  The dentist said I needed more work than I needed. I got a second opinion & found this out. 

I would defiantly NOT recommend this place. Bad ora about it.

Had a pretty bad experience here. I'm not sure if this is normal or if my party experienced an uncharacteristically bad time.

I've only heard good things about Thomas Keller so I was pretty excited to try this place out. The first thing that bothered me was how inattentive the service was. It took quite a while before our drink orders were taken and it was ages later that we received our appetizers, which were okay. 

The entrees were the real let down. My meal was just okay and a little on the cold side. My brother's meal was plain cold and flavorless. My friends steak was also cold and very tough. My other friend's croque madame was okay, but nothing special. 

My brother ended up sending his meal back, for which the table was given a free desert of profiteroles. They were okay. 

Overall, the restaurant was quite a let down. Maybe the cold food was the fault of an inattentive waitstaff and not the kitchen, but that doesn't help the fact that our meal was poor.

Définitivement le roi des dumpings!

Excellent choix de raviolis chinois, farcis à la viande, aux fruits de mer ou aux légumes et tofu, donc de tout pour tous les goûts. Ma préférence va à ceux à l'agneau et coriandre. De tendres petites bouchées cuites à la vapeur avec un liquide que l'on boit comme une soupe, miam! 

Ce restaurant est très populaire, donc attendez-vous à faire la file, surtout les soirs de fin de semaine. Fait intéressant, on peut acheter les dumpling surgelés et les faire cuire à la maison. Sûrement meilleurs que ceux fabriqués de façon industrielle!

I went to Tasty Joe's for the first time today, and this will be my last trip.  We were there after the lunch rush and there were 5-6 dirty tables left over from lunch, but we were the only people in the restaurant. The food portions were good, but I felt the prices were too high given the quality of the food. They also used too much oil, as my broccoli tasted like old grease.  I also agree with previous reviews stating the place has an overwhelming stench of wok oil. Overall it was just disappointing.

I have extensive back problems, a spinal fusion and now neck problems, so instead of going to my previous orthopedic surgeon - who always wants to do surgery - I thought I'd talk with these folks. I opened an online chat session with one of their reps and spoke at length with her for about  1/2 hour via chat - she told me I would need to speak with another customer service rep and if it would be okay to call me back after we spoke - I told her I was tied up following our chat and gave her a specific time when I was available - as soon as the chat session ended, they called - and as I had explained, i was unavailable so told that rep when i would be available, to which they assured me they would call at that time - they never called back....in the meantime, I spoke with a co-worker who recounted his experience with these people and it was not good - not good at all. I began researching reviews online and came to believe that they likely have some of their own people creating fake reviews because some of the others were of a predatory organization that forced people to make a financial commitment up front with many left holding an empty bag of false promises.....and that has caused me to be very cautious about any further involvement with these guys - sure, there are positive reviews, but they read like their commercials and basically, don't seem credible to me...I can't speak to any experience with these people other than what transpired using the online chat and lack of a callback, but from what I've heard from those who actually have dealt with these people, and reading other negative reviews, I'm staying away and will not have further dealings with these people - they seem predatory and extremely money hungry - not consistent with the patient focused care they promote in their adds - if you deal with these folks, all I can really say is proceed with caution and buyer beware.

I am looking for breakfast this morning, this place
 Is not pricy
, I ordered a spicy chicken , delicious，fantastic music, reasonable price, around 5 dollar.
On hold for 15 mins and then disconnected. Horrible customer service if you want yo downgrade any service.   Cant wait to change to another provider.

Honestly, the staff is unbelievably rude and will not go here again. After buying 5 rounds of six drinks, spending over $300 and tipping 10% each time, when I went to pay for the last round one of the drinks spilled. I finished paying and told the bartender and she said "there's nothing I can do"..Everyone was waiting for me to get my drink and were all wondering why the lady was being so rude after we just spent so much money. I explained the the lady I just bought 5 rounds and was asking just to top off one of them. The bartender said "listen lady, you tipped me 10% each time I have to tip out 7% to the club, if you want the drink you have to buy another one". I left and went somewhere else and will not be returning.

The food was awesome!  I had the three tacos:  chorizo, chicken and ground beef.  The taco shells were super fresh and I love that they provided the lime wedges to give everything that extra fresh taste.  The torillas were excellent as well.  They worked very hard to revamp this place it looks totally different and the decor is very nice.  Small and like a previous reviewer stated, if they stay consistent with this quality, it will be hard to find a seat.  Much like It is hard to get a set at Black Dog.  We will be taking the kids very soon.
Good food and decent drinks but expensive so it is a rare trip for us.  Worth a try though if you haven't.

I can't say enough good things! The service was exceptional! The food was delicious! Everything we got was fresh and so yummy. We ate way too much, but it was too good. We shared guacamole, Trash Can Nachos, Chipotle Pork & Roasted Corn Tacos, and finished off with an order of Churros. Carolina was a fantastic server. You won't be disappointed here!!
Company did not show up to the scheduled appointment, nor did they even call to reschedule.

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  Had a service animal and they almost did not let us in!  They delivered my meal, which was awful, to me before my friend's meal...which still hadn't arrived after 20 minutes.  I'm not exaggerating.  We ended up leaving because of the customer service and they still made us pay for my meal.  (Their excuse for the 'tardiness' of the meal was that there were too many 'to-go' orders that were apparently made first.  
There are too many Pho restaurants to waste your time on this one.  Good luck.
This place is a total JOKE..promised 2 weeks to clean my UGH slippers than promised next day for 4 more days.. NEVER EVER again, I wish I read the reviews b4 ever giving this place my business!!

Went to Baskin-Robins with a friend to order a birthday cake shaped as a pumpkin.  The staff was very nice at this point, and took the order and repeated the info back.

2 days later when the cake was picked up, the lady at the counter disappeared into the back for some time.  Eventually emerging with a cake - the worker was asked to make sure the cake flavors were correct? - check!  Is the name on the cake correct? - she said yes; and after double checking the spelling, she said yes.

...then after getting to Boulder City, opened the box and guess what???? The Name Was WRONG!!!  It's someone else's cake.  (Again after I had the employee double check before I left the store)

Okay, so then the call to the store to complain.  They explained that 2 of the same cakes were ordered this week, and they must have giving us the wrong one.  They told us to drive back to the store - from Boulder City, and they would fix the spelling.  After explaining I couldn't drive back they didn't offer any other options.  No discount for the error, no refund, no sympathy for the error.  

So no future business from me and my friends to this location!

Spectrum is the worst. If you have the option to go with someone else, anyone else, do. My Wi-Fi stopped working I contacted them, get transfered multiple times. Some people saying my issue is technical, some people saying I don't have Wi-Fi on my account and did I want to add it? I think I would know if I have had Wi-Fi on my account for 2 years. Finally they say my timewarner account was just merged with spectrum and that it would be a 10 dollar fee, and then 5 additional dollars a month. Of course I was furious that I was going to have to pay more for the same slow crap internet that goes out constantly, but I figured it was only five dollars and I didnt want to deal with having someone come out and everything. I get my bill and apparently I was fed a bunch of bull because my bill went up 15 dollars a month. So now they expect me to pay 70 dollars a month for the exact same service I was paying 55 dollars a month for. Which by the way, sucks and goes out constantly and is SLOW. If you have the choice go with at&t. I would switch but they do not serve my area.

***UPDATE

We switched to Windstream!! We exclusively use streaming services on our tv. With spectrum we had to hardwire the tv to the modem, otherwise it would buffer the entire time. With windstream we are able to wirelessly stream with zero buffering, including 4k programs. We got their 100mbps internet, with free installation, a 100 dollar credit on our account, and will be paying 45 a month for 12 months.
Alexis has done my hair for 2 years. I always do something fun at the end of the school year. This is her amazing work!
One of my most favorite buffets in LV. it was mine and my husbands first time visiting and we were not disappointed. Great selections for everything and appropriately priced.

Service..... this place should be a training camp for every server in Toronto. Terrific service with a perfect mix of recommendations and choice.  AMAZING bar and barrister. The food was equally good. The Bombas were the BOMB BOMB great!!!!

The caramellas desert was great too. We came expecting to be there for maybe 90 mins and before we knew it, four hours had passed. Sweet experience. Cannot wait to return. Eight thumbs-up for the four - star experience.

It was our first visit to Ice Cream Sammies and I must say, it will NOT be our last!!
I really hope they survive, because the ice cream and the cookies were delish! Fresh, rich and DELISH! I had snicker doodle cookies with cake batter ice cream and a chocolate chip edge. My husband opted for Chocolate Chocolate Chip cookies with mint chip ice cream and chocolate chip edge. Both choices were excellent!

Totally did not realize there are reviews on yelp for LV shows.  Wish I knew this and looked at Chris Angel's show before purchasing tickets.  The negative reviews all hold true...

Really disappointing, like others have pointed out.    Would give zero stars if I could.  As my first Cirque du Soleil show in LV, I don't even know Why the hell the show is called that.  No Cirque du Soleil of any kind.   

In addition, Chris was awful at getting the audience excited.  He was boring and seems snored himself.  Also, the show hardly had magic.  He rambled on about himself, showed us clips from his TV show (why the hell did I come to see him live to watch his show clips?), and did only a couple tricks.  I used a my vegas reward for this and got a buy one get one deal for the premiere tickets but I am so mad I didn't read these terrible reviews first.

Biggest waste of time.  The tricks he did were the same old tricks and he didn't try to show different types of illusion.

Not Cirque du Soleil at all so not sure why it is advertised as such.

Just don't go...

The burgers were very good, juicy and flavourful. The fries were crisp and tasty and the staff were super friendly. We were there at the lunch time rush and after a short 10 minute wait ordered and had a table. The milkshakes are very good also.

My five star review is for the wonderful staff of the pharmacy at this Fry's location.  Today they stayed open a couple minutes later despite holiday hours, to help me get my prescription.  On several occasions I have noted a genuine sense of caring and willingness to go the extra mile for their patients, especially on the part of their pharmacist. They are well organized,  pay close attention to detail, and are willing to work with you, your insurance, and your prescribers to ensure your needs are met. Thanks to all the staff for your excellent service.

So glad I came to this location when looking for new beds for my kids. We had recently moved into a new home and it was time to upgrade their bedroom sets! Dennis was so helpful and gave me a great deal. I had called to see if the beds were in Stock and he promptly called me back, gave me prices, inventory details and took time to listen to my needs. When I came in, he made sure the sets we were getting matched our needs!!
The delivery guys were friendly fast and efficient. They took the time to make sure they knew exactly where we wanted everything and made the stairs look like a breeze carrying everything up, alall while careful not to damage anything. They were in and out on no time and had everything completely set up!! Now that the kids both have new mattress sets, I sure know where I'll be going to get the next set for my room!!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE my poke bowl from here! I'm usually so picky about pokebowls its ridiculous, but this place met my expectation and BEYOND! They literally pack the bowl to the top and they aren't skimpy with your bowls at all unlike other places!! They have fresh ahi tuna which is amazing and i appreciate how they tossed the tuna in sauces before adding them into the bowls! You get a lot of protein in the medium bowl and the toppings is AMAZING. This place is my all time favorite place to go for all my poke needs. The drive is a bit far from my house but it's so worth it. They have a big bar and you can pick and choose what you want in your bowls. Typically i get half and half but i got a full rice bowl here. This is my fave hawaiian poke joint!! They also have so many amazing toppings that other places don't offer as well. The place is fairly big and is always clean! They have a kid area and a drinking station while you wait as well! There's also a princess parking sign outside which is adorable!

My "must place to go"!
We're from NC and visit our son and daughter-in-law in Mesa, AZ. 
We always go to Organ Stop and have a great time. Love it especially at Christmas. Looking forward to going Aug. 11th. Can't wait! 
Jan Peterman 
NC
Outstanding service!  Food was delicious, and the sweet tea just right!  Wish we lived in the area so we could go weekly! =)

Yes, it's a chain, but because it's freshly prepared, as they claim, it is noticeably better than say, Chipotle. I wasn't too impressed with the pricing (gourmet tacos coming to about $4 each), but I did enjoy them. The salsa bar is a nice touch, and I do dig the Mexican beach theme.

Great, great, great service. The chicken and shrimp jambalaya was very well seasoned and the mai tai that Will prepared was on point. I can't say enough about this place. I definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.

We've tried a lot of places in Vegas, and we keep going back to Jerry's.  Don't be put off by the kind of seedy neighborhood. The menu is extensive and diverse. In addition to American stand-by's, it also includes a full page of Chinese and Greek dishes.  The side dishes taste like they were prepared fresh (my daughter and boyfriend rave about the potato salad). I love the prime rib dip. And the deserts - oy vey like you wouldn't believe. Two full cases of cakes and pies, all fresh and delicious. The wait staff is always friendly ( we like William and Danny) and the service is fast. We've never had to wait to be seated.  Very reasonable prices. Love this place.

Try something else first. This company does not let you return the item if you have assembled it. Fair enough. Where's the 2 cent brightly colored sticker that warns the customer of this policy? I didn't get burned, but it truly bothers me that they capitalize on this and is likely a de facto marketing strategy. The customer is stuck with the base, and must buy the correct holder. 

And they do not offer compatibility for popular cases. Like they do for cars. Any excuse they have for this would be anemic at best. I regret patronizing this company, they're no friend of the customer. Their return policies make it obvious that their own efficiency in operations eclipses customer convenience. In the age of Amazon I have no idea how this company succeeds. The product seems good enough, for some applications, not all. But they don't make it. Brodit does. The marketing approach of this company moved me to write this review, and I not surprised by how poorly people perceive them. A quality consumer product should not have this many dissatisfied customers.
Frankie was great! Gave us great tips of the city! Ordered the beef curry and watermelon mimosas! Wonderful!

Was attending an event at the convention center which is only a couple blocks away. Several other attendees went in separate groups. More of a sports bar than a restaurant. The food quality says sports bar as well. Service was excellent. I didn't have any drinks so I couldn't tell you anything about it. Overall it was ok but not a "I must do again".

When I learned that PHX Burrito House was owned by the same folks that own El Sol Bakery and El Zocalo in Chandler I had to get over there to see if the breakfast burritos were as good. They are. We were frequent customers when we lived in the East Valley. Looking forward to trying the fish tacos at lunch.

My go to restaurant for many reasons: 
Food is consistent and delicious. I have tried almost everything on the menu and recommend the burrata, any pizza w/gorgonzola, the rocco salad and the calamari. Drinks, especially wine, are reasonable priced. 
I used to be a fairly regular (several times a month) customer at Terroni but I have not gone back there for years. Not only is the pizza at Libretto tastier, you won't find any snootiness about the menu. They are extremely accommodating about allergies and preferences. The front of house service is fantastic. The staff always remember us from previous visits and they are super friendly and helpful. It gets busy sometimes, I just go have a drink at the Crooked Star across the street and Libretto calls when the table is ready. I always feel like they appreciate our business.
It is a little pricey. The crepe will not get you full and I feel it is more of a dessert. However, it was very flavorable and delicious. Will be coming back for more :)

OK...So I'm pretty much a regular at Ivy League Hot Dogs....  I eat here 1-2 times per month on average...  This is not because I'm a friend or relative... I am a Foodie that loves a delicious meal as much as I love a fantastic eating experience... Ivy League Dogs has both.
I feel in love with this place on my first visit....  I mean the food (pretty much only hot dogs and fries along with desserts at that time) was delicious, and the service was FANTASTIC!
They are small business owners that strive for repeat business... The service on my first visit was as good as my most recent (13th per Yelp) visit...
Their menu has expanded and now serves hearty hamburgers (try a double...or triple..or maybe even Quadzilla if you have the guts...or stomach capacity), Cheesesteaks, Fish and Chips, Italian Beef sandwiches and Fair style desserts.
I'm telling you, if they have it, you can get it... There are over 30 topping you can customize your hot dogs, burgers or even you cheesesteak with to "make it your own"...
When I go out to eat with my family, every dollar counts and more important, the experience itself counts.... This place has delicious food, huge portions, very reasonable pricing and customer service that is 2nd to none!!!
I urge everyone close by, or passing by to try them.... Heck, even if your not close by, take the trip.
** Pay attention to their hours of operation as they are closed on Sundays and only open until 2pm on Saturdays **

Great buffet. Inside Caesar's Palace

It is a little pricey but the food is great. 
I love the all you can eat crab, although I do wish I requested them to heat it up. 

I also tasted their prime rib. Very good. 

I never waited to get into a buffet before, and this one had about a 15-20 minuet wait during brunch. It was definitely worth the wait.

I was excited about this new location as it is on my way to work. The past few times that I've pulled up to the drive-through, they always make me park and wait for my food and leave the drive-through. Even though there is nobody behind me. It is very inconvenient. Doesn't the whole point of the drive-through to be able to do what it's designed to do... Drive-through. If I have to leave the drive-through pull into the parking lot and park then there may as well not be a drive-through to begin with. Stupid concept to have people leave the drive-through and wait in the parking lot for their food. Also the last time I came for breakfast I ordered some breakfast items and was very clear in requesting the dollar hash brown. I pulled up to the window and my total was higher than expected. I was verifying with the worker that I had ordered two sandwiches at a dollar apiece. Value drink which was $1.39. And a small hashbrowns which is another dollar. My total with tax should not have been more than five but she quoted me almost 7. Halfway through my verification of the prices she said I'll just give you a receipt. So whatever I paid for it knowing it was too high she give me the receipt and she had included french fries. It was 7 AM in the morning... I did not order french fries. I was very clear that I wanted hash brown. And the entire time I've been writing this review I've been sitting in a parking spot waiting for hash browns and two sausage biscuits. What a joke!
Great Food and service! Our favorite neighborhood Asian food spot. We've come here twice this week already:)

Awful food and a 30+minute wait for 6 wings.  The cheese enchiladas were not even melted and had no flavor. My sons highchair was still filthy after the highschool girl sprayed it down with windex and a dirty rag- I went over it with a wet wipe and it was brown.  Don't waste your time or money- totally sub par all the way around!
Very VERY good fish tacos!!!! Good atmosphere, great service. Flavors are yum yum yum!!! Will totally come back.

Dont think. Just order the develed eggs. Omg. This is one of the best breakfasts in downtown vegas. Not cheap prices but food will blow u away. I got the develed eggs and a egg and bacon and potato dish.  Also will mention the very good coffee and this is the first and only restaurant i have found stevia. Go here. Cool joint and amazing food. Breakfast for 2 was $35. Worth it.

I did not like this place.
It priced out cheaper than the low end choices, off strip, but I soon found out why.
The line to check in took longer than the flight from Denver.
The room was small & cheap (think pre-Tropicana renovation).
The clientele was ghetto and trashy. Loud talking people in the halls. Just trashy.
I went to eat at the Japanese/ Korean sushi restaurant on site and the staff was rude.
That said, the staff at the Imperial was awesome. Super nice. Very friendly and accommodating - I suppose because by the time you reach them you are sweating and pissed off - there should be a drink and a massage at the check in desk... by the time you get there.
Oh, and there seems to be a maze to get from the main level to the tower elevators in the back. I stepped out of the elevator and could not find my way back to my room to save my life. I ended up at a bus stop in the rear of the hotel. WTF! I have no idea how I got there, and after making 3 circles through the lobby finally went to the main elevator and tried again. No doubt security watched me walk around lost, wondering where the hell I was going and if I was on drugs. I wasn't. But, I wasted 45 minutes trying to get back to my room.
Totally insane - the Imperial Bermuda Triangle.
I won't go back - I'd rather pay the 10 extra for Super 8 - sad day.
The location is cool. mid-strip, but damn. I'd rather walk 2 blocks...in 113 degree weather.

transportation note: there is a bus that goes directly from the hotel to the airport which costs $7 
(opposed to a taxi which costs about $20 large)

Food good service is HORRIFIC.  I had the chicken and grits which were very good but the service geez.  Never got water, never got silverware. The hostess had too take my order.  The food came out before the drinks and as of now I've been waiting 20 minutes for my bill.  I can't give this place more than 2 stars until the service gets better.  And the guy next to me has been waiting just to place his order totally ridiculous

This is a pretty small lounge in the D (American Airlines) terminal.  There are two rooms with comfortable sitting (not lounging) chairs around circular tables.  They have a full bar, a coffee machine, jelly beans, little snacks like Oreos, shortbread, and Milano cookies, and a variety of specialty popcorn.  Wifi is provided by the LAS airport.  Overall, it's clean and they stock what you'd expect of a lounge.
Many chain smokers and "idlers" hanging around the parking lot and entrances, some in highly provocative attire.   People smoking in rooms could be smelled in halls.
Scallops are so delicious- amazing! Food is so good here. Everything is wonderful, atmosphere is on point

We were met at the counter by a hostess saying she was new and that the other hostess was fired. It wouldn't have been a big deal but we heard this the whole time we were their.... the service was not bad but far from what would be called stellar.
Our wait staff seemed in a hurry but was polite. I like the atmosphere here but often service is lacking. I don't understand why table staff is in a hurry the restaurant was empty...?
The food was not the best we have had, not hot, bread tasted stale?not sure what was going on it was probably the hostess that got fired.....

This is the Sonic closest to my home so this is the location I'm at most frequently. 

Personally, I love Sonic. Great selection of sodas and other drinks (definitely try a strawberry limeade!). Full menu is served all day. 

Their burgers are simple but delicious. I've been pleasantly surprised by their breakfast choices.  My favorite thing to order here, by far, is the chicken club toaster. I ask for it with honey mustard instead of mayo and they are always happy to comply!

The fries are so-so, they never seem salty or crunchy enough for my taste. I do like the tater tots, and their onion rings are delish!  I'm also a fan of their mozzarella sticks with marinara.

The drive-thru can get slow, but parking in a stall isn't that big of a deal. Sometimes, at peak times, it's faster to park in a stall than attempt the drive-thru!

They have westvleteren. It was 22$... if you are anything of a beer enthusiast that's enough to go, in my opinion. 

Great feel, very much like you're in London, or more generally a real pub. Service was pretty good, and the beef on flatbread was very tasty. 

Also, location wise, great if you're heading to the AGO. A definite must - go place for Toronto. Will be back.

I took by small Sasha for a bath appt, as he was in between the next grooming appt.  Something I have been doing at this store for years.  This time was a nightmare.  When I walked in and asked about how long for his bath, Jaime advised me 2-3 hrs as she was overwhelmed with appts (it was a Friday evening about 5pm).  Fifteen minutes after dropping Sasha off, I received a frantic call from Jaime that Sasha was hurt in the kennel. He was biting on the kennel bars and his mouth got stuck.  She took him over to Banfield and I need to come get him.  Of course, I turned around and went back to the store and straight back to Banfield, only to find out that they put Sasha in a kennel.  I asked for him to be brought to me immediately and called my own vet, who said he will keep the office open until I got there (about 545pm).  My vet said that Sasha was traumatized, he examined him and gave him a shot to calm him down.  To shorten this, Sasha lost a tooth and he has scrape marks on his side that I cannot account for with the story I was told.

Sasha has been in kennels all his life, my vet agrees with me, that something had to happen that made Sasha react that way, but no one at Petsmart is talking.  As of Banfield, putting Sasha in another kennel without trying to calm him first, just showed how much they did not care about Sasha at all. 

The response I received from Debra, the Store Manager is ".  I am sorry to hear that you weren't satisfied with your experience and, as the Store Leader, I apologize for the disappointment and inconvenience we caused when we were not able to complete Sasha's groom and we didn't meet your expectations. "  

Debra worked very hard not to admit that the grooming salon harmed my Sasha,  She did offer a new collar since it was never returned to me on Friday, but I declined the offer.  

I no longer trust Petsmart with my dog.  I have trusted them for years, but lies by omission and not taking responsibility for what happened to Sasha is just too much to overlook.
Fun view of the city, we had the whole thing to ourselves & the kids loved it- pretty much a private party 420 ft above the strip. Good locals pricing.

Sapphire nails and spa is definitely a place I recommend to go and check out! It is such a great atmosphere to be around and amazing people. When I went here I got my toes and nails done. Never have had my acrylic nails done so good before.

I was referred to Ryan from a work colleague sometime last year.  I knew how and where I was going to ask my then girlfriend now fiancé to marry me, I just didn't know with what ring. When I met with Ryan for the first time it was immediate that I knew I was in the right place and in good hands.  He was accommodating to my schedule, walked me through the whole process, showed me tons of options, and answered all questions I had.  I never felt pressured or uncomfortable and couldn't be happier with the ring we selected.  We also just finished up her custom made wedding band and it looks amazing! Ryan is now a great friend and I would highly recommend Ryan and The Jewelry Replacement Source to everyone! Thank you Ryan!!

Over Priced and over hyped
Stuffed with potatoes (in the butter chicken roti)
Medium was like a Spicy

The negative reviews here are kinda funny. I've been taking my teenage twin boys here for 3 years, since we moved to AZ. The particular barber being dissed here has worked there since we've been coming every 6 weeks or so. That guy is nicest of them all and practically lives there. I don't think he cares at all if someone who usually sees him sees another barber if the place is packed or people are waiting for him. He ALWAYS has a line of people waiting for him specifically and I think he understands when people aren't willing to wait an hour for a haircut. 

The only thing remotely close to being a downside here is the older lady that doesn't speak very good language. If you get her it's very hard to communicate with her. Usually one of the barbers have to tell her in Spanish what is being said. She does good work though. 

I only came on here to check and see what time they opened today and stumbled upon the bad reviews so I had to speak up and post to save the reputation of a good person at the establishment.

Postmates delivered but that has no bearing on taste & quality of food. The margarita pizza w pepperoni was greasy & rubbery. The meat balls were bland as well as their " famous house speciality " bolognese pasta. Plus my ER physician hubby is NOT picky & wouldn't eat it. ( he eats anything ). I dumped it all out. How they get good reviews or stay in biz is beyond me.

I will say this - if you are in the mood to shop for overpriced Hawaiian shirts at a store while getting terrible service at their restaurant, then this is your place.  

I went there with a very large group and the service was terrible.  We sat at the bar for 10 minutes before I asked the guy behind it if I could order a drink.  He actually said, "Well sometimes".

The problem was not the wait staff, but the manager.  Don't put your employees in a situation where they are short staffed.  We called ahead of time to advise them of a large group and you just chose not to staff it accordingly.  Also try to teach your employees to smile at least once in their shift.  They looked annoyed that we were bothering them.

I'm sure this is a good place when they are not so busy, but my review is to skip it.  They really don't care if you are there or not.

I recently moved into my brand new house in Gilbert. We have a smaller kitchen and so we wanted to enhance with tile. I searched for months while my house was being built, and found Clayton Family Tile on Yelp with a lot of really good reviews. I can be a little difficult to please as I have very high expectations. 

Let me say that I am astounded! The job far exceeded my expectations. Our tile artist was Lupe, an 18 year industry vet. Lupe was meticulously precise, showed care for our kitchen and appliances and kept the work area extremely clean. 

Our job was difficult because we had tight spaces behind cabinets but these perceived obstacles  were no match for Lupe. Everything was precise and perfect. The cuts around my cabinet crown moulding were perfectly done! 

If you are considering getting tile done in your home, you cannot go wrong with Clayton Family Tile.  You will get spectacular results like I did.

My fiancé and I have been here many times and we LOVE it! We've recommended to all of our family and friends! Its definitely our favorite breakfast joint to go to on our off days I've tried different things off the menu each time I've gone and not once have I been disappointed!

I have used The Poolman service for over 6-years at my home in NE Scottsdale.  They converted our chlorine over to their saltwater generator FREE about 5-years ago.  After a couple years it failed and they replaced it with an even better one - again Free. 

Our pool tech, Raul, has provided excellent service over the past two years.  He's very knowledgeable and has pointed out a couple maintenance issues for me to resolve sooner rather than later, which has saved us money again.  We count on him and this company.

I'm not sure what happened to the other folks in looking at their reviews, but after reading them, I wanted to share our experience.

We are bombarded daily with new pool companies and independents, but as long as we get this level of service, we will remain customers.

Give them a try.  Their FREE saltwater conversion is great start; hopefully you will get a pool tech like Raul to keep you happy.  I will say the price at $80 monthly is on par and reasonable for weekly service.

I'm so happy they have an El Pollo Loco nearby!! I've been saying for YEARS that they should open one in the southwest area! I love coming here because it's my healthy alternative. It's so easy to eat unhealthy around here because there's too many fast foods! By the end of the day, I just want to pick up food quickly and go home. El Pollo Loco offers that for me. Looks like they're brining the big cups back for salsa because they had these little dinky cups that only fit one bite. I guess I go at off times because it's not as busy as the other El Pollo Loco's can get. Going there tonight!! Can't wait :)

Very nice Thai restaurant with lots of dishes you won't find in most Thai places.  Pay attention to the specials on the boards.  They have several great dishes you won't find on the menu.  The food was very good and the waitress was very polite and helpful.  The food runner/water girl didn't speak English.   It would be nice to teach her something like "your welcome", etc.  The place was pretty empty on a Monday night.  I'll probably be back.  The fish cakes were a little over done and my drunken noodles had too many noodles...but both were very good and tasty otherwise.  They really know how to spice things up...so if you're use to ordering 10, go for 5 and use the spice tray on the side...I didn't need to and I always order 11 elsewhere.
