*Friendly check in staff
*No weird pillar blocking the TV from the bathtub!!

I really don't know what else to say other than this is the suite I referenced wanting to try in my previous review. :) Another lovely stay at Bally's!

**Note** If you want a true view book in the Jubilee tower. Although the Resort Tower was just renovated the rooms are darn near identical. I've heard the Resort Tower doesn't have the jetted tubs, which in my experience is accurate.

I used Martins for the 15 years I lived in the area and found them to be honest and reliable. They went above and beyond several times for me.While not the least expensive, you get what you pay for.  I'd rather pay a little more for what I do need then a lesser price for a lot of things I don't need.  I wish they were not so far from where I live now. Highly recommended!

Best lunch in Cleveland. I have enjoyed kebobs from literally around the world. Greek Express hangs with the best from Europe. I suggest picking a book up from the library running across the street to the arcade getting a kebob and taking it back to the librarys outside reading area. Enjoy the food while enjoying the shaded area and read a book for dessert!

We are new to this pediatrician but so far LOVE it. After 14 years at a prior pediatrician we decided to try someone new with our newest son and absolutely love it. Though we live in Southern Highlands and pass probably 100 different options for doctors on our way to Kid Fixers in Summerlin we totally don't mind and find it well worth it. Originally I was referred to doctor Lapore  a different doctor Dr Jerome was who saw my son after he was born at Summerlin Hospital then Dr Tamanji (hope I spelled that right ) and we liked both very much so will not have a preference of which doctor we see. The wait times are nearly nothing unlike My Kids Doctor where we used to visit. And when you get to a room your not waiting another 30 mins to see the doctor they are literally in the room within 10 mins. Very nice and explain things in detail and dot mind answering 1000 questions. So they have absolutely won our business.
The thin crust is fine, but the sauce is too sweet. It's the kind of pizza that teenagers will like, but grownups shouldn't settle for.
Kevin and his wife were wonderful. They did an excellent job with all my windows. I will definitely be giving them a call again for any of my window needs. Thank you guys for the great service.
Lux is one of my favorite places to meet with friends. There is diverse seating and the food and coffee is amazing! The staff there are great and unobtrusive without being totally absent.

SLOW SLOW SLOW. We waited almost 45 minutes for them to change the oil in two cars that were in progress before we ever arrived. Then it was another 30 minutes to change our oil. No "jiffiness" here. Always try to up sell you unnecessary services and products using fear tactics. We won't be back.

I've lived here for 3 years and have had zero major issues. Any time we had maintenance to be done, their staff was on it, even when our a/c broke over the weekend. Sherri at the office has been nothing but helpful. The grounds are well kept, we've never had noise or pest control issues. I really wish I didn't have to move to be closer to school, because I would be more than fine with staying here another 3 years. I'm not sure what other renters are complaining about in terms of fees - that IS part of apartment living, and why you read your lease before you sign. Our rent was more than fair for the space we got.

ASK FOR KEITH

So i've been in madison for 10 months now. I'm origionally from london & take pride in a good hair cut. There is nothing more annoying than getting a poor trim. Since I have been here I have tried 5 different barbers excluding keith & none of them come close to getting my approval (STOS certified). I showed him a picture of how I used to get cut in London & he copied it to perfection. He even somehow repaired my previous barber's errors. The fade get's STOS 10/10 approval. His beard shaping gets STOS 10/10 approval & also his charisma get's 10/10 STOS approval. He is officially STOS certified & I will not be going to anybody else anytime soon. Thanks Keith.

Extremely disappointed. 

To start off, I am a big fan of Le Gras Dur and frequently dine there. After hearing they were expanding into Vladimir Poutine I was extremely excited. However Vladimir Poutine does not live up to Gras Dur. My friend and I ordered two different types of poutine. We were both shocked at what we received. It almost looked like they ran out of ingredients to make the different types of poutine, but served them anyways. It was more a bowl of fries then poutine. Both poutines had little to no sauce, with no toppings. Even the fries tasted off. We only ended up eating 1/3rd and threw the rest in the garbage. 
However, the worst part of this experience was the service. The two gentleman working the tables were rude and unorganized. It almost felt like we were wasting their time by ordering and eating here. We spent more time trying to get their attention then we actually did eating. Upon asking for the bill, the one gentleman just handed me the bill by reaching from behind my back, without saying a word. After 15 minutes had gone by I decided to ask if we were supposed to go up to the counter to pay or something.. he replied by saying, "no... to be honest.. I just forgot you guys were even here".  

$45 dollars for this type of service and food is unacceptable.

My husband and I were strolling around Old Town Scottsdale the other day trying to pick a happy hour. The Pink Pony caught our attention because of the gorgeous tables they had set up in their open patio. After checking out a couple other spots we decided to give the Pink Pony a try. Upon walking in we were really excited about the decor. Nice modern clean feel. Really nice. We sat at one of the high tops near the bar. Happy Hour here is daily 3-6. It includes $2 off starters and some random drink specials. $6 wines. ect... The Happy Hour wines were actually really nice. I was happy with the choices. I ordered the Garnacha and my husband got the Pinot Noir. Both were good. And generous pours. They have a "Bar snacks" menu that you can order from anytime. I got the beef sliders and the prime rib sliders. Beef sliders were average. The prime rib sliders were very good. $6 for each one. My husband got the wings that were on the starters menu. $8 for happy hour. Fantastic flavor. We generally like them crispy and the server said next time just ask and they can make them crispier. Great sauces served with them.  Service was pretty slow considering it was not busy. But otherwise I would go back. Definitely worth trying.

We recently brought home our first puppy without any experience at all. We knew we needed a lot of help and Barb was recommended to us. She has helped us tremendously over the past few months , teaching us how to prevent the behaviors we don't like and how to start training the ones we want. It's amazing how our puppy is gradually gaining more calmness and impulse control with her help. Dog training can be very hard but Barb is there to offer tons of help and guidance for all of your problems.

This place is bomb. Fantastic, flavorful, juicy burgers but my favorite thing is their fries. They do regular and sweet potato fries (brought out in little shopping carts) and both are amazing - skinny, crispy, not at all greasy - they come with ketchup and another awesome dipping sauce. I've also had the fish sandwich and a salad here, and they were just as high quality and wonderful as their burgers and fries. Shakes are good here, too. They have a very small space, so expect to wait unless you want to sit at the communal table or outside (in which case you still might wait). However, it's a very nice atmosphere, with casual vibe and good music. I only deduct a point because service was so-so on my last visit, and the restaurant smelled like a nursing home for some reason.

With Kokyo the surprises never stop coming. And this is not necessarily a good thing. 

Each time I visit or get take-out I can never be sure if this is going to be a 1 star or a 4 star experience in terms of the quality of the fish, more evident if you are ordering sashimi.

The Pros:

- The size of their rolls are always huge
- The servers are nice and friendly
- When eating in or getting take-out the order is always ready in record time

The Cons:

- Huge variance in quality of fish
- They keep the tuna and salmon used for rolls chopped (a lot of places do), this reduces the taste/experience

Suggestions:

- When ordering any tuna or salmon roll ask them to put the seaweed on the outside, it makes it very difficult to use pre-chopped/shredded fish so you'll get  nice big chucks of fish in your rolls
- If ordering a meal, ask them to add seaweed salad to the normal house salad (a mix of the two), tastes pretty good and costs near nothing
- Ask for low sodium soy, in case you don't do so already. Does wonders for the sushi (apply to nearly all sushi joints)
- If you get take out, check if the order is correct, if they miss something and you call in, you are most likely going to be made to feel like its your mistake (the last time this happened I did not go there for over 6 month)

I came today to use a BOGO coupon, as well as a free drink coupon, using the app. The app does not work at all, but that is another review for another time. The fine print of the coupons say nothing about using multiple coupons on one order. When I tried to use both coupons on one order, the cashier was ready to apply both coupons because, as she said, she has done so in the past and knows that the fine print said nothing against it. The manager, with the gray beard, overheard and told her not to allow it. After telling him the coupons say nothing against it, he agreed and said he knew, but was going to deny it anyways, all with a smirk. I could tell the other employees were also tired of him and honestly, I feel bad for whoever works underneath him. After this interaction, I don't think this is a fair business that I want to continue spending my money at. The pizza was slightly below average and definitely not worth $10 for the small portion, nor the attitude I got from the manager, who is supposed to set the example for his employees. Overall, I would not recommend.

Happy Hal's (James Halford) fixed our electrical issue at a fair price! James is a pleasant young man with a ton of experience as he started helping his dad in the mobile RV business as a child.  We highly recommend him and if we have another problem traveling through Las Vegas he will be the first technician we call!

With the background of beautiful mountains, the drinks and dinner was perfect.  We had the Brussel Sprouts, which were crispy and flavorful.  The Osso Buco was so tender it fell off the bone.  We will be back to enjoy the view and food.

I bought some cat food from here about a while ago.  I ordered through the phone because I live downtown and don't have a car.  The person on the phone was very friendly and helpful and was able to deliver the order that very night!  I think there was supposed to be a delivery fee but they didn't charge me for that.  They even included free samples!  Great experience.  Would definitely buy from this store again.

Bonefish Grill had been recommended to us by our new apartment manager. She did not steer us wrong.

The food was impeccable. My wife had the grilled trout and I had the Sir Will Fish and Chips; both were of an excellent quality and served in an attractive manner. The chocolate creme brulee for dessert was to die-for. Bonefish also has an extensive Martini menu. I had the raspberry martini which was both light and flavorful.

Our seater, server, and manager were all highly professional, courteous, and friendly, and genuinely made us feel that they were happy we were there. I am definitely recommending Bonefish Grill to my company as a venue for entertaining our visiting RVP's and clients. Thank you Bonefish for being a fantastic restaurant!

This is by far the worst car wash I've ever used. My normal car wash was closed yesterday and I had a business meeting first thing today. I wanted my BMW nice and clean from the previous day's storms. I went in and requested a hand wash. They informed me it was an hour wait! I said ok and walked across the street to do some shopping. I was gone an hour n half. Wales back over to see that barely had just started it. It then was another 50 mins till it was complete. Now if it was perfect like the other car wash I use  (Charleston Car Wash) then I would still have been satisfied. However it was not. Still a lot of visible dirt on lower rockers, windows were all streaked. There was tire dressing on the tire treads which then got flung on down the sides of my car. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! Oh and did I mention a hand wash is almost $40!!! I get a hand wash and hand wax at Charleston Car Wash for that!!!! Never again! I will stick to my home car wash from now on! Fabulous Freddy you guys SUCK!!!!!!!

If  no stars were an option I would DEFINITELY choose that option! THE WORST customer service ever. I ordered pizza via delivery for my family, I paid online using the Pizza Hut app. 40 minutes later I get a voice mail from delivery driver stating that he attempted to deliver my pizza, he rang the doorbell and didn't get a response, which is extremely odd considering we are sitting in the living room WAITING for the pizza! I I call the delivery driver back and he hangs up on me! I then call the store and speak to Randy ( the store manager)   and he proceeds to take my order, I advised him that the order is already paid for, then he tells me that the order was cancelled and I'll be refunded in 1-3 business days! Now this all happened within a 15 minute window, the delivery attempt and the order cancellation. Smh if you're big on customer service, this particular location will fail you for sure.

I have never had East African or Ethiopian cuisine before. I was hesitant to try Buraka at first, but I was pleasantly surprised. 

The Samoosas and the fried plantain appetizers were delicious. Most of the main entrees at Buraka are curry dishes. I tried the Dorowot and the Siga Alicha and both were pretty tasty. The good thing is that for adventurous patrons, there's an option to try a combination of two dishes and do a half-and-half. I highly recommend that.

The service at Buraka is great, so ask for recommendations. You won't be disappointed in their food.

Great Italian food. Relaxed, kid friendly atmosphere. Set up very similar to Olive Garden or Maggianos. Tons of servers and busers keep things moving quickly. Water refilled fast. Courses come out timely. They offer a fixed price menu - $40 for 3 courses. All the food was delicious. Portions are huge.
What can I say. Mac and you know who, all the others!!  Long time listener.  I'm out!!!!!!!!  I think the station should look at all the reviews over the last year, not good. Back to 550 am
Awesome food and awesome service! I love the eclectic decor. I would not go anywhere else for Thai.

I purchased a Groupon after Yelping. I decided to leave my fate on the hands of taste god, for $10 worth.

Yogurt is yogurt. It's healthy for you. I like Yogurt at various ice cream parlors simply for the flavor. My ignorance obviously.

Nothing is wrong with the Yogurt. It's just limited in selection (about 10). You won't know about it till you got there. It didn't help when you could sample the flavors... I recall carrot cake, red velvet, mint, coffee, chocolate, orange sorbet, apple martini... and plain tart. One flavor ran out. These were not the flavors I go for usually.

I was not happy with the fruit toppings. There are only a few bits and pieces left for mango (a bit old) and kiwi around 10 PM on Saturday.

I'm happy to get rid of the Groupon. And there's free WiFi as expected.

So diners, it's not a good experience for me simply because of a lack of flavors mainly.

This review is for the downstairs areas and casino only as we did not stay here.

Very pretty hotel with a comfort level of sameness that has been here for what seems like, ever. We played a few table games here and checked out the poker room which was beautiful but did not play. We did end up playing blackjack in the "Pussycat Doll Casino" which is based right outside Pure Nightclub. The music was loud, the atmosphere fun and young and we had a great time. The man ended up leaving +$200 and I was +50.

Last year, my guy stayed here with a group of guys who were in town for a bachelor party. They dined at Bradley Ogden,played poker ( a lot) and really made use of this hotel. The room was just average from what he says, but since I didn't go, I cannot comment. They are in the process of building yet another tower planned to open in 2009, so if you are looking for something newer, this might be your best bet.

The worst Pizza Hut place, even the worst pizza place I've ever been. Terrible service, rude staff and horrible baking too. I went there a few times since it's close by. They see you but no one cares until you wait at least 5 minutes! The last time I got my pizza it was half burnt and 3 slices of it had no topping on it!

If you're going for something specific it's great. However, this isn't the sort of mall you go to wander through. It's got all sorts of stores and is vastly better than it used to be since it added on the 2nd row of shops and theatre and such a few years back.

I took my parents to LA Crab Shack for dinner today and it was great! Everything we had from the gumbo, hush puppies, crab, crawfish, and fresh oysters were wonderful! Prices are reasonable, the place is clean and decorated in the Louisiana flavor. Our server Nicole was the best with her friendly, outgoing nature and on-the-spot service. We will certainly be going back there again and again and we would all highly recommend that everyone try this seafood restaurant! Outstanding!
The music and ambiance amazing. Very professional crowd. Yet super guy heavy. View is super nice. Also in the other tower is mix similar view just different more casual layout.

Rice was stale, meat was not fresh, noodles were either too dry or not well done, WORSE OF ALL the portions do not match the price and did not make the food I wanted to or if they did they will charge me again which is not good customer service.. would not recommend at all...  it may look Appetizing but it does not taste good at all.

I came here with my friends and ordered the bbq eel on rice and the ferris wheel to share with the table. The food itself was pretty average, not too bad. The ferris wheel had the typical asian snacks like fries, popcorn chicken, wings, etc. I felt like the bbq eel dish came with too much rice but for $20 total (ferris wheel split between 3 people) it wasn't too bad. 

My main complaint is with the attitude that one of the waitresses gave my friend. She tipped $1 because she didn't know 10% was the normal amount and the waitress was super aggressive about it. She told us that if customers don't tip at least 10% then she would have to pay 10% of our bill back to the restaurant owners out of pocket. I told her I'm pretty sure that's illegal (especially since tipping is OPTIONAL) and she said "that sucks" and muttered something under her breath about having student loans to pay off... join the club lol. Sorry but I think harassing customers for tips is very inappropriate and frankly it's pretty rude. The waitress was really nice and made polite conversation with us at the beginning, but as soon as one of us didn't tip 10% suddenly the niceties went away hahaha. 

Anyways I just want to end by saying I know the waitress isn't fully to blame here; if the management really is deducting 10% from the staff's cheques if they don't get tipped that's the biggest issue here. It would be nice if the staff could be mature enough to not take their frustration out on the customers (who also have student debts too...). Either way I'm realizing that this restaurant creates a pretty toxic environment for the staff and customers so I won't be returning.

Was not thrilled! Service was fine, but this place is extremely American-ized.  The salsa is drab and flavorless.  The food is not my favorite. Just boring and disappointing! I had hoped for more spicy and flavorful dishes. I won't be back.

Went here for dinner during a snowstorm. It's a deli/diner. You come, sit, order food and go. I've tried the smoked meat sandwiches in Montreal and could not understand the hype. It just tastes buttery and whatever other flavors are from sauces like ketchup or mustard. So, I ordered their stew for dinner. It tasted just like any other stew, but a bit sweeter (Maple Syrup, maybe?) Portion was gigantic, though. So big that I have no room for desserts. Will I come here again? Probably, their Jewish menu seems interesting.

Beautiful place, beautiful art, beautiful people. Great cocktails and awesome food. I stumbled on this looking for the entrance to the Hotel Theodore. Glad I did. This place is so cool. Located right in Old Town Scottsdale where you can walk and enjoy the scenery. Love it!!

Great Thai food even if you are coming from outside Brunswick.  Green or red curry, you can't go wrong. This is my wife's favorite place to go and it's rates as one of Brunswick's best for a reason. The prices aren't astronomical but they are a little higher than most Thai restaurants.  Considering you are getting a bowl of Thai spices, with coconut milk and a side of shared rice you might be thinking closer to the $7.95 range but expect at least $12.95 a person plus drinks and such.  Is it worth it?  Yes.  But we would be there weekly rather than bi monthly if the costs were lower.   Friendly people and good food will have you returning.

Excellent food and reasonable prices, especially when apps are half off during happy hour.  The mac and cheese app was fantastic! The place is a little difficult to find (get good directions) but definitely worth it.

Pizza 4.5. Gyros 2 buzzillion. Seriously, you can't get a better gyro anywhere. They let the gyro meat soak for a minute in some sort of gyro juice which supercharges the flavor. I love the dumpyness  of the place. I hope they never modernize. It's like going back in time.

This spot is a hidden gem! Literally hidden off of the road, this cozy restaurant has an amazing atmosphere with string lights outside/ outdoor seating area. Their wine menu includes anything and everything and their menu has plenty of options from salad to pizza to nice entrees such as scallops. My boyfriend and I shared two appetizers, the pork meatballs and the chicken lettuce wraps. The wraps had a hearty amount of chicken in them and were pretty good! Wasn't too crazy about the hot sauce included, but the soy sauce to dip it in was good. The pork meatballs were bomb with a little baguette to eat them with! Additionally, we were still slightly hungry so we shared a four cheese flatbread with plenty left over! The pizza was amazing, I would definitely go back to this place in a heartbeat!

I have been dying to try this place for months now, and luckily yesterday I finally had the chance to go downtown and eat at Nobuo, and trust me it did not disappoint!!  My friend and I split the Short Rib Steamed Buns as an appetizer.  Let me tell you this, I could eat the shit out of this all day long!  From the first bite I was in love.  Succulent meat in a light steamed bun, hmmmm.

   Next my friend had the Soft Shell Crab Sandwich, which unfortunately I did not try but it looked grand, and he had no complaints about it whatsoever.  I went with the Okonomiyaki.  Wow, just wow.  I have had Chinese Scallion pancakes, but this Japanese pancake was out of this world good.  I have never had anything that has ever tasted like this before.  I guess it could be best compared to an up scale Egg Foo Young.  Same concept, but with much higher quality ingredients.  What I really cannot get over was the price.  Each dish was only $10 bucks, a bargain considering the quality of food that you get.  I will put it this way.  I live in Gold Canyon, and I am willing to make the commute for these dishes again.  That sentence tells it all right there!

Yesterday was my first time ever for a facial at Aveda. The salon is really nice and clean. The spa is on the top floor and it is very quiet and relaxing. The staff is super friendly, they offered me tea (and I dont even like tea but this one was really good). The girl who took care of me was Eva. She is super nice and friendly, and she did a fantastic job. She makes you feel very relaxed and comfortable and her massages are amazing. The facial was 70$+tip. My face is usually extremely red after a facial because I have very sensitive skin, but yesterday was not bad at all. The extractions doesn't hurt compared to other places. The only cons would be that the don't extract milia around the eyes, and I would have liked a deeper extraction. Very good experience overall. I will definitely be back!

*UPDATED:
All the skin products I bought (cleanser, moisturizer, toner and essential oil) gave me really bad allergic reactions. Be careful if you have sensitive skin as a big number of Aveda products contain lavender. Lavender is NOT good for sensntive skin EVER. I had a terrible rash all over my face for 3 weeks. I could return the products but they gave me a gift card, not cash back. Now I have 150$ in an Aveda card that most likely I'll give to someone because I am not going to use any of their products ever again. So be careful if you have sensitive skin. Try little samples before buying any skincare product.

We lived here for 15 months.  The property manager was great to work with.  We had to submit a couple of maintenance requests, but they were all taken care of within a day or two.  We only moved out because my wife gave birth to our second daughter and we needed more room.  I would definitely recommend the Arbors for a couple or small family.

As with any other airport, food and drinks may be fast food related but after a long flight of nuts and ginger ale, it's a feast. The weather as you may have suspected is hot and dry. If you don't have to leave the main area to go outside, don't. If it's your first time here and are from the northwest like I am, bring your humidifier (I didn't and wish I had). Have a safe trip!

I really liked how this restaurant is set up. All the booths are really nice. The servers also seem really nice even though not all of them know a lot about different sushi pieces off hand.

The sushi (negiri) it self was really good. I really liked the salmon and red snapper sushi. Their seaweed salad is also good. I really liked their spicy crab rolls. The Toronto roll was also really good for those who don't mind warm rolls.

The lunch price was 14.99 from what I remember and that is pretty good for an AYCE which serves quality food.

I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone I know.
I looove Loco Lime!! The guacamole is THE BEST in Charlotte!!!  I love this little place - great margaritas.  Great prices and service.

Came in on a Saturday night, the bartender was super hott and did great at managing all the people at the bar by herself. 

Do yourself a favor and order the macho nachos. Delicious.

ordered a large pizza and buffalo fries with cheese and bacon they delivered to the wrong house the people actually ate some of the food before they realized it wasnt theirs so they looked at reciept beat on my door and handed me my food !!!!!

My husband and I went to Bear and Bottle the Friday after they opened. It was a lovely day, we we wanted to space with a nice indoor/outdoor feel. The space is beautiful, but there are plenty of kinks that need to be worked out. 
1. They sat us at a large family style table. We were the only two people sitting at it, but the places us at the end that is about six inches from the ordering registers. Throughout our entire meal, I was being bumped into by wait staff inputting orders. Staff also used the narrow space to walk to the patio (instead of using the designated door). It made it hard for us to enjoy our meal. 
2. The food was very greasy. I ordered the salmon sandwich, and when I bit into it, oil went everywhere. The fries didn't appear to be shaken in the basket prior to delivery. They were almost inedible. My husband had the same issue with his chickpea sandwich. 
3. They changed wait staff in the middle of our meal. No one communicated that with us, it just happened. When I was out of water, I was unsure who to call on. 
I'm uncertain if we'll be back for a meal, but I may come to enjoy a beer on their patio.

I'm a huge fan of Upward Projects restaurants/concepts.  This is my local Postino, and I've been coming here since it opened a couple years ago.  The crowd is a good mix of Central Phoenicians--ranging from the young and hip, to the middle aged and upscale.  The staff and service are great.  Knowledgeable about the wines they serve, and excited about the menu items.  Check it out on Mon or Tues after 8pm for the $20 bottle and board special.

My gf and I found this place on groupon and purchased a groupon for a 90 min massage. I had Andrea and my gf had Noah. They were AMAZING!!! They worked on our problem areas and made sure the pressure was just right. I appreciated Andrea taking a few extra minutes to give me the full 90 minutes as she started a little late. We were also surprised when they told us to choose a free gift. Whaaaaaaaat?! FREE GIFT?!?! Yes!!!!!! Before we left Vegas (as we were on vacation) we were trying to see if we could fit in another massage but unfortunately couldn't. We will definitely be back

This is it.  This is the Friendly Neighborhood Local Eatery everyone is always looking for.  The place where the food is amazing, the staff is friendly, the prices are great, and you always feel welcome.  

I found TasteBuds when my lady had a late night craving for froyo.  She is the Queen of Froyo and is responsible for my current appreciation of it, as soon as I tried a sample I knew something was different, the flavors were much more vibrant then you usually get in froyo, and they had a flavors outside what has become the froyo norm.  Try the Irish Pistachio, really, go now, right now.  

They also have a fully stocked toppings bar, I'm a fresh fruit froyo person, and my lady is a sugar, chocolate fan and TasteBuds in one of the few places that we can both be happy.    

The best part, that that says a lot because their froyo is so good, is the people, the staff is awesome, and they pay attention and recognize their customers, you really feel like they care and they want you to come back.  That coupled with the relaxed atmosphere, and the amazing froyo is why there are always people there, no matter the time, no matter the day (yes weekedays!)  Do your self a favor, if your near it right now, go there and have good froyo and a good time.

went here for the first time while visiting Las Vegas.  ordered 7 different boba drinks.

+3 stars, four out of seven drinks were good, not great

-2 stars, three out of remaining boba drinks were bad, bad enough that after taking 4 tastes the person wanted to throw the rest away.

-1 star, drink selection is too large.  too many drinks for customers is confusing and many of the drinks are not good enough to be served to customers.  pick 6-10 drinks and do those well.  not offer 100 drinks and hope your customers find your 6-10 only good drinks.

Wonderful atmosphere especially on the patio on a warm, breezy, day in Vegas. Our waitress was great! She was new but very friendly, efficient and attentive even though we waited almost an hour for the 3rd person in our party. I ordered the special on the menu insert, salmon. The flavor was good, but unfortunately, it was on the cold side. The others in my party were very happy with the steak and pork chop.

I was on a show called Check Please? and this was one of the places someone picked. I really enjoyed it. Since it has been awhile, I went back this week and found it was under new ownership. The mushroom small samplers seemed more expensive. $4 a piece. I had 4 and it would be nice if they came with a side salad or crostini or something. They are the size of a large aspirin lol. I was hungry when I got there and hungrier when I left. Like someone giving a man dying of thirst a sip of water...

I came here because people spoke so highly of it in a class I was in. My experience is that the food is good. I've had way better out of food trucks but there was nothing wrong with the food what so ever. I took away a star because the team there has absolutely no personality. They are not mean or rude, they are just blah. I watched everyone as I ate and I saw three people smile once and that was only when they were talking to each other. The older guy with the gray hair which I would consider maybe the manager has a permanent frown. I won't go back but the food is good. 

Update:

I'm in Phoenix for another training class and everybody wanted to try backyard tacos again. I had to update to be fair so here goes. I leave it with 4 stars although the staff was much better, friendly, very observant. I still can't give 5 stars because although the food is good it's just not 5 stars. It's still a great place to eat and the prices are reasonable.

Much better...new manager I think?  I've been coming here forever and was about to give up...I am glad I didn't.  Lunch has been great lately, they give you a 10$ coupon every time for the next lunch. Just log in take a survey get a number.....so generous. Huge servings. Hot hot soup, excellent salad. Great sashimi....give them another try. One word to corporate, please remodel the disgusting women's  bathroom...it is dark.  Freezing, music is blaring. The stalls doors are broken, the hot water spigot is broken......I cannot stand this bathroom. It is raunchy.  The walls are a deep disgusting red with shitty shitty art decoupaged to the walls.  This bathroom is nasty....I think you could find the capital to do a redo....I bitch about it enough and will post photos next time I visit. Please inspect your properties.

Good pizza. Ordered delivery during a lunch rush but still got to me in a reasonable time and hot/fresh. I also ordered jojos which I thought were on the bland side, but not horrible. The associate I spoke with on the phone and the delivery person were both nice.

Absolutely flawless service! I wanted to surprise my family with a limo for our annual Christmas dinner together. We chose to eat at Bellagio and I didn't want everyone to have to deal with driving and parking on the strip. 

From the first phone call to being dropped off back home everything went exactly as planned. Presidential sent me an email confirmation for both the pick up and drop off as well as a confirmation email the day of the service and then another email when the driver was dispatched, including their name and cell phone #. Our first driver William was extremely friendly and professional, he also arrived 15 minutes early. We had requested ice and champagne glasses which were waiting for us in the limo. William even opened our champagne for us after we picked everyone else up. 

We finished dinner a little earlier than planned but that was no problem. I texted our driver bringing us home and she was at the Bellagio in under 5 minutes! Both chauffeurs drove very safely which my mom appreciated. Everyone was able to enjoy themselves without having to worry about driving home which is worth every penny. Thanks for making our Christmas dinner a night to remember.

Have not been to PFC for about 10 years. My son gave me a gift certificate for Christmas and yesterday l decided it was a nice day and l drove over to the East side to use it.  Arrived ~ 12:45 and was seated after a slight hiccup (2 men arrived after me and the waiter seated them before (perhaps) an older woman with white hair.  Another employee saw this and seated me.  The waiter who sat the men turned out to be my waiter.  He also turned out to be quite a nice fellow.  And an excellent waiter.  Therefore PFC stilled received my 5*.  The mixup at the beginning was properly handled. 
I ordered Hot/Sour soup, crab rangoon appetizer, and the Crispy Lobster and Shrimp Rice meal.  
The soup was entirely different then any l have had before, however very good. Crab app was excellent and the lobster/shrimp rice was absolutely delicious.  Although l am a west sider l would certainly get my passport stamped and return to the east side to eat at this fine restaurant again.

Another MedExpress update. Sad, but true. Probably won't be the last as well. I really don't know what people did before these places existed. I guess go and wait hours at the ER? 

I fell and hurt my ankle. Not my first rodeo with these injuries. So I hobbled in. I registered and was taken back fairly quickly. The doctor was super nice and explained what was wrong. THANK GOD just a sprain. But they hooked me up with an aircast and what I should do to heal. He even suggested what I should do to better my ankle strength in the future. 

I don't have anything bad to say about them and have only had good experiences with a kinda crummy situation!

Two minutes after I walked in, they told me I was standing wrong.  And seriously, how bad could I be?  I'd been standing for years and had very rarely fallen over.  

What was wrong with my standing? 

Well, as it turns out, the back pains I had were caused by that standing.  Which meant I wasn't sleeping as well at night.  Which meant I was drinking caffeine to try to stay awake, and it all cascaded to affect my overall health.

I was expecting, you know, massive weights and running 'til I puked.  But they gave me tiny weights, realigning my body, grueling workouts that strengthened muscles I didn't even know I'd had because I was so unaware of my body - which I viewed as a carrying case for my head - that I didn't realize what had atrophied.  

And Fitness Evolution worked with me and my wife to create customized exercises that always pushed us but never broke us - which was critical when my wife broke her hand ziplining, and they had to spend weeks jerry-rigging exercises that worked around her injury.  

I've been doing this for a year now.  And I'm not a skinny person, mainly because if you read my other Yelp reviews you'll see they're all about drinking and desserts, and honestly, I've cut that down but to be truly ripped I'd have to give all that up.  

But my back doesn't hurt on long airline flights.  I sleep well, for eight hours.  My body has strength in places I never knew it could have strength before. 

And now, when I look in the mirror, I see how I was standing wrong.  I see all the ways Fitness Evolution adjusted me, one session at a time, to give me better flexibility and health.  

They helped me.  It ain't cheap.  But when I consider all the doctors' bills I'm gonna save from my body not degrading down the line, I'm callin' this a bargain.

The best servers and bartenders in town!! They are always friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a great experience. We go at least once a week. Every time we are there we have fun and love the food.

This is the BEST donut shop we have tried in Gilbert 
The donuts are always fresh.  They also carry croissant breakfast sandwiches that are so flaky and warm.  I love the ham, cheese and jalapeño!
Donuts are light and fluffy.
Bonus:  the servers are very friendly.

Some things a diva should never share, but I can not keep this place a secret. I was in dire need of a mowing in the worse way. I was looking like Buck Wheat from the Lil' Rascals down below. I could not take it anymore. I found Pretty Kitty with the help of Yelp. It was a small commute from my neighborhood to the shop. They are soon opening a new spot in Summerlin. Yay! 

The waxing was quick as I doubted it could be done in 15 minutes as bad as my lawn looked. Well I be damn in 15 minutes I indeed had a very Pretty Kitty. I gave them kudos for a job well done. Did it hurt? Of course it did in some sensitive places, but it was so quick the pain quickly subsided. I purchased the recommended after care products, and left a nice tip for my sweet lady who made my first Brazillian a breeze.

This tattoo parlor is lovely, I concur with the reviewer that said it reminded her of an art studio. I visited Gypsy for my first tattoo experience, after looking up their wonderful art and seeing they were lgbtq friendly.  And I was not disappointed.  I was more than happy with my new tattoo, which Michelle created, modeling it in part on an 18th century image I chose.  But what really made it for me was how awesome, friendly, and comforting Michelle, without being invasive.    I am going back soon!
This is a pretty big bakery/cafe.  There's chairs.  I've only had coffee here.  I don't know if I'd dine here.  But it's a good place to meet up with people, as there's lots of space.
Best Chines in the area. Chicago had some of the best local Chinese I've eaten to date.

My experience with Dr. Philpott and his staff was amazing!

I am 21, and had recently lost about 35 pounds. With losing weight came deflated and not as perky breasts, however, I was still about a C cup. I did my research, and after reading reviews and looking at his before and after's, I decided to go with Dr. Philpott. After my consultation and pre-op, Dr. Philpott and I had decided that a keyhole lift and 600cc moderate profile implants under the muscle would be most desirable for the look I was hoping to achieve.

I COULDNT BE HAPPIER WITH MY RESULTS. Seriously, my breasts look AMAZING and are even more beautiful than what I had envisioned. I am so thankful that I put my trust in Dr. Philpott and his staff. They exceed my expectations and made everything so easy!
Went here at 8:00 on a Friday and they were closed, employees juststanding around. Sure, I'm hangry as hell as I write this, but it clearly said open till 9:00 on the door.

This place is top notch, especially for a hotel restaurant. On Sundays their bottles of wine are half price...all of them. They have several premium dinner dishes priced at $22 for the summer. I had the fried calamari appetizer which came with a peanut butter sauce that I didn't care for but our waiter brought out cocktail sauce for me. The portion was large enough that I had it as my meal. The finishing touch of cotton candy "compliments of the chef" was a little out of place but we enjoyed it. As did the people at the tables around us...it was actually hilarious to watch a neighboring group shoveling it into their mouthes and passing the batch around.

Jeff smoothed out the dent on the roof of my car for $200 and while he was there he took care of some other dents free of charge. He provides mobile service so he'll need a garage or shaded area to work under. Professional and efficient

Sushi Neko is a spectacular restaurant. It has delectable sushi. My top favorites consists of the lasagna roll, the popcorn lobster, etc.

definitely request for the waiter Carlos, he was really good. i will definitely come back!
I love Dr Browner! She's kind, gentle, and very caring of how you are feeling (pain/comfort). Also, the office is beautiful and the staff are friendly:)

What do you get when you mix tender braised beef, a tart baked with loads of real butter, and steaming veggies with jus? The ultimate comfort food
Lovely large salad on the side makes it a little less of a guilty pleasure
Kids gobbled it up too - along the crispy side order of fries 
Affordable, and love the recyclable paper packaging

Food was excellent but service sucked. Place was empty on a sunday night. We had a large party but were ignored most of the time.  Server didnt deserve the 18 percent gratuity.  What a bummer, I will be back for food not service.

I actually met Ros at a happy hour one night in Scottsdale. I told her I had been in PHX for a year and couldn't find a stylist who got what I needed. She took one look and said - you need volume - EXACTLY. I made an appointment with Ros and she does a great job of showing you how to style and ways to get the most of our hair. She recommended several products (which I did buy) but also said a cut costs less when you don't blow dry.  I didn't find her prices outrageous - I have been to Rolf's at Gainey Village and they charge even more. I was happy with my cut and have been using the products to achieve the look I want. I will be back!

Request Thomas! Worth the wait and the price (which wasn't too bad of an introductory offer). 

I reserved a couple's massage for my boyfriend and I on a Saturday. Quick tending to and no one is stealing minutes away from your massage like some other places. 

Thomas did great. I was very specific about my pain on the form: trapezius, scapula, neck, and a little foot rub just for fun. All my pain was gone! 
If you have a desk job and experience the same ailments, I would definitely recommend Thomas. 

My only complaint might have been the temperature of the room. While my table was warm and cozy, the A/C was a little too chilly for comfort. Considering there were 4 people in there, it didn't bug me so much. 

I can't speak for my boyfriend but I know his masseuse must have been working hard because his back ALWAYS hurts and he walked out of there a happy man.
The chicken was too over done and dried out. The green beans and biscuits  were cold. It was understaffed.

WORST BUFFET EVER!!!!

Seafood lovers beware! Oysters and clams on the half shell were dried out and tasted so bad that I had to spit it out. YUCK! Prime rib is dry that Au Jus did even moisten the meat which leads me to believe that they didn't allow the meat to rest before slicing allowing all the natural juices to run out.

Hot snowcrab legs were iffy at best, over steamed making the flesh mushy. 

Only the desserts were considered acceptable so that means the pastry chef is better at his/her craft than the head chef.

I am never EVER going back.

First timers, ordered 2 subs to go. Got home and had the wrong order. Drove back, gave the employee back the subs and reordered. She was very apologetic .... But then got home and it didn't have half the toppings I asked for. So We just ate them, was not about to drive back for a second time. But my big question is: aren't employees suppose to have their hair tied back or at least have a hat on? That turned me right off

24 hour tacos? Yes please.

This place is a modest spot in the middle of a strip mall, seats about 2 dozen, and has a little self serve (I think? I hope?) mini buffet nook for peppers and veggies and whatnot. 

The dude working here was nice enough, but the real point we care about is the food, huh? 

I got the shredded beef burrito, which was tasty, but wet/soggy and not exactly overly flavorful. We also got the chicken chimichanga, which was huge, stuffed with a ton of chicken and cheese. Lastly was the shredded beef enchilada plate, which had a ton of onions, despite being told otherwise. 

Overall, if you order a plate, the portions are huge. 3 stars because it's satisfying and a decent price, but not memorable.

This place is awesome! Over the top portions but great quality throughout. I don't think it's possible for one to finish their plate! The various hashes are always my go-to pick, but the pancake that dwarfs the plate it sits on (no exaggeration) is delicious. The chicken and waffle plate seems to be a huge hit, but beyond the presentation, I wasn't impressed. The chicken was dry. Might have been just bad luck when I ordered it, but I haven't given it another chance since. Always a good atmosphere. Expect a wait, but treat yourself at the bar while you do
Incredible service, great atmosphere and the food is delicious - unique and set to perfection.

This Pilot is a trashy truck stop run by trash. I am a trucker. I was parked in a handicapped truck space and i have a handicapped decal. Some manager woke me up at 4am and threatened to have me towed if i didnt leave the handicapped space i was in and told me to leave the truck stop. Stay away from there. It's nothing but MONKEY business in that place. So long MONKEYS, i wont be back. Dirty parking lot, dirty showers, rude nasty employees, nothing good about the MONKEYVILLE pilot in charlotte

Heirloom brings to the table all of the goodness of North Carolina farms and fishermen paired with many NC wines. The menu offers variety but a diner can choose the tasting menu and experience the creativity of an innovative chef. 

Our service team was attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable and able to explain the menagerie of flavors we enjoyed. 
On our table tonight was a salad of watermelon radish and asparagus, a buttermilk biscuit with black pepper butter, pumpkin soup, fresh sheepshead fish on a bed of risotto to die for, roasted goose on fresh mashed potatoes, a blonde brownie desert adorned with fresh cream and chocolate, finished with a cheese course. Portions are ample. 

Heirloom's atmosphere is eclectic and delightfully quiet. The people here are living the farm to fork experience. Jars of hand made vinegars and preserves line the walls. The chef keeps bee hives on the roof. It was my pleasure to lend my support to their venture; and, in turn, Heirloom repaid our party with a delicious dining experience.

Have gone here several times after work for the $4.95 steak and eggs. Well,  now it's $6.95. Went there last night.  I can live with the price increase, BUT, the service is abysmal! It was always a little slow there, but from when I sat down last night to when I was finally able to get my check took almost an hour and a half!  The place was maybe a third full so there should have been no reason for the delay in receiving our food and having to wait for the check . I work  in the service industry and know the the meaning of the word SERVICE!  Perhaps their management should look up the meaning.  It will be my last visit there.  There are plenty of other late night eateries here in Vegas

This place is a neighborhood gem. Located on Columbus Ave in historic Duck Island neighborhood near Tremont. 

Parking is readily available to "duck" in quick as a "rabbit" and get a coffee to go or stay and sip at the cute bar looking out onto Columbus Ave. Either way, the coffee is ground there and made several ways, pour over, cold brewed etc. 

The owner Cal is passionate and loves to share his coffee wisdom. You can't help but love everything about this little out of the ordinary place from location to coffee to the owner. 

If in the area, do yourself a favor and stop by. They also sell beans for you to brew at home.
I tried the Nutty Pig and thought it was great! The doughnut itself was delicious as it should be since it's the base. I will definitely be back for more!

Right on!!  A Dietitian's dream restaurant where everything is FRESH!  Who would have thought that this type of restaurant would fly in the Midwest --- more tempting to put it on the West Coast (where everyone thinks first).

Really hope this restaurant prospers and the word gets out to eat more healthy

Do not use this service! They have door to door salesmen who gave me a great spiel how they handle gnats. I was aware I was signing a contract but was totally unaware I would be charged 36 bucks EVERY month but to only receive the service every 90 days. The pest inspector told me it would be 36 dollars every other month. There were no instructions left for the first pest tech regarding the gnats and he told me I should put Drano down all my drains. I was still seeing a ton of gnats so I called to have them come out again and the CSR told me she would send someone else out and note the account with instructions on what to spray specifically. Second guy came out, or I guess I should say kid...looked like he was about 16. Told me there is nothing that they can do for gnats, he had no special instructions, didn't spray and gave me these 2 gnat trap cups. Their techs are not educated about any pests. They are just there to spray and they know nothing further past that point. Of course I only had the service for a month (maybe less) but was charged the $75 cancellation fee. So clearly they do not have a satisfaction guarantee.

I came here for Botox injections in my forehead area around the end of February 2017. Staff is friendly however I ended up with a headache for two weeks and the Botox ended up lasting only between two and three months. I do not recommend getting Botox here. Look for spas that are black diamond allergan partners. This was my first time trying botox and I will be going somewhere else that I found. If same results happen then I will update my review and maybe assume it's how my body reacts?

I love cake. I love desserts that come in cup sizes. Therefore, cupcakes are the perfect dessert for me. 

Venturing around town one night, my boyfriend and I came across Fuddruckers and ate ourselves silly. Then we went next door and saw there was a cupcake place and decided to cupcake ourselves silly since we were already here and we live at least 20 miles away.  We were pleasantly surprised to find out that Mad Hatter Cupcakes is like the equivalent to those "Choose Your Own Adventure" books I read as a kid. As someone of non-discriminating taste to a point where it drives my boyfriend nuts when I can't make a simple decision about food, this place was like decision overload for me.  First you choose your flavor cake, then flavor filling, then flavor of icing and how about a topping? Then rinse and repeat until you've ordered what you want to order. We've returned several times, and it seems that each time I walk in, I completely freeze and panic, and blurt out the weirdest combinations of cupcakes. Lemon cake with strawberry filling and... peanut butter icing?? D'oh. 

Surprisingly however, they always taste fantastic. Even in my panic-stricken flavor combinations, the cupcakes are always great. I know there's some subjection as to whether some people like their cake a little cripsy on the outside, or if crispy is a sin in the baking world, but I actually like the little bit of crunch you get from the top of the cake as you bite into it.  I'm assuming the cupcakes do this because they're left un-iced for some time due to the Mad Hatter setup, but if this may not be kosher in the baking world, it's definitely okay with me. 

The only thing I'd suggest for improvement is if they added a "cupcake of the week/month" flavor just so that their selection of choices doesn't get redundant. Maybe throw in a nutella icing?? Or perhaps a marble cake? Just something I'd like to see, but that's me and my curious non-discriminatory nature. Or something.
Music played was way too loud in an enclosed area, wasn't willing to swap us out to another table just caused we ordered our food. Piss poor service

I went to this place with my boyfriend today for my birthday on June 12. At first glance, the place seemed very nice and we got seated fairly quickly! 

I ended up getting the steak with fries and a mojito it tasted pretty good although I found the portions for the fries wasn't very uneven with the steak the steak was a little bit too small in my opinion but nevertheless it was pretty good regardless of the size! My boyfriend ended up getting shrimp pasta and he said it tasted pretty good as well! 

Both of the meals come with a caesar salad as well which also tasted pretty good although the sprinkled a little bit too much to cheese on my salad!

The service here was pretty good even though I was a little bit sceptical about some of the reviews prior to going to this place today honestly I didn't find the service to slow and I thought our waitress was pretty good my boyfriend even gave her $20 tip! 

I will definitely come back with some friends or my boyfriend again!

TCB baby. Highly recommend. The singer and performance harkens back to The King himself. Great vocals and energy - had flashback to the good old days. Whether you know all the words to the classic songs or not, this show is worth it. Go and enjoy.

We love coming here. The food is good and fish is fresh. I get their build your own bowl mixed greens and spicy tuna. My daughter gets a california roll with a tempera shrimp sushi burrito. The service is good and they are friendly. Price is reasonable.

We've been talking about trying this place for over a year and finally came for dinner.  We had pizza and pasta and shared.  The pizza was delicious.  The pasta (tortellini alfredo) was ok - too much sauce.  I ate the broccoli, my husband ate the pasta.  Would definitely go back for pizza.  The place has a great ambiance for us - we thoroughly enjoyed it.
Best looking reception area, very friendly offering all hair services. Angela was very knowledgeable about what color to use even though my color was a mess!

We had an amazing experience on motel 6 in Anaheim when we visit Disney land. So we got motel 6 , but it was horrible dirty and disgusting. We changed 3 room but finally we decided to not sleep there and we left and got another hotel. It was just disappointing.

I went to this place looking for a clean and breakfast joint near my appointment.  The people are friendly and service is great but the place is very outdated and horrible ventilation system.  One thing I hate the most, is to come out run errands after and smell like grease and fried food.
As for food, I ordered the typical breakfast: eggs and sausage, it was good but the PANCAKES taste funky and it cost $16!! and it wasn't good.  I only had one bite.  Will never come back here again. Overpriced, food is too greasy and not good, place looks so outdated and need maintenance especially their ventilation system.  
If you're a foodie like me, this is not a place to go.

Wisconsin is known for cheese, so it was a no-brainer to stop by and browse at Fromagination. Located right on the square downtown, they have cases and cases of cheese, including plenty of local Wisconsin cheese. I can't eat as much cheese as I used to due to my lactose intolerance, but it was still fun to look. What's also good is they don't just have cheese, but also sandwiches and salads and other snacks, so picking up a sandwich allowed me to try a little bit of the cheese without going overboard.

We got the chile ancho chicken sandwich, which had roasted chicken breast with a poblano pesto spread, salad greens, and Wisconsin provolone cheese, and sat outside the shop to eat. (They had a whole section of tables and chairs outside, very comfortable.) The bread was soft and soaked up all the flavors of the pesto, the chicken was great, and you could definitely taste the provolone, which was so good and tied it all together. Very glad we stopped by Fromagination.

This Spirit location lives in the skeleton of what used to be a Party City. It is a bit smaller than some of the other Spirit stores around the area but it still has plenty of standard tricks and treats. If you've wait too long to get into the Halloween spirit and are in a panic, this store would work to pull something together last minute. They also offer in-store coupons online.
Excellent food great fresh fish and fun environment ! Had the ceviche, pulled pork tacos,shrimp tacos and ahi tuna. Will Definetly come back

Take it from someone who experienced great tasting sushi as fresh as they come.

Stationed overseas for 4 years I've had the luxury of experiencing and enjoying varieties of sushi and Japanese cuisine from Tokyo to Osaka. With high expectations and standards I expected nothing, but quality and taste for the appropriate price for the right food. (Especially being in the main spotlight of Vegas.) Sushi is expensive and in all Vegas is expensive, but charging 9 dollars for an instant miso soup deluged in hot water is beyond overpriced, but rather senseless. As for the main course I would compare it to Japan's dollar conveyor belt sushi resturaunts were they serve two large sushi for a dollar and the miso soup is actually miso soup! It's not Japan (I know) and no, the world is not running out of fish either. I say this not for my own health, but for next wallet waiting to be dipped in soy sauce. 

But the resturaunt is kinda pretty.

The airport is enormous so if your mobility is compromised ask for help. Once you land remember you will be taxiing for another 8 to 10 minutes. Once in the airport there's a great selection of shops, restaurants, but unfortunately not a ton of art. There are miles of long corridors fill them up with amazing indigenous art. As for the restaurants they have a great selection of all different types of food from Asian to hamburgers to Mexican to you quick grab and go sandwiches. This is replicated in each of the terminal so not too bad a walk to get to something unique. Only downside is that the shops and restaurants know they have you as a captive audience and thus charge you accordingly.

Although much of the staff are very personable and engaging, I found a number of times I would come upon staff sitting around talking and failing to speak to customers. An example at gate A13 I had to ask three times for assistance, until they finally stopped the giggle fest to provide directions. 

Although this is my first check in and review of the airport I have been through on a number of times and they are consistently on time.

First of all, we eat out all the time, and we used to absolutely love First Watch. And we found that everything had been redecorated and the menu changed. The restaurant looks like a set that was put together for a play. 
Our problems started when the server came to the table. We were looking for items on the menu that are no longer offered. Our server gave us no help or suggestions, just stated to my husband 'no, don't have that anymore' and stood waiting for the order while he skimmed the menu as quickly as possible. His meal came out incorrect, asked for extra onions-didn't receive, asked for the avocado on the side-did not receive at all, no refill given. My daughter did not receive the toast that was supposed to come with her meal. My meal tasted bland and had burnt parts. 
Our server went out of her way to avoid eye contact throughout our meal so that we couldn't quickly remedy any issues. 
During our meal, we only heard yelling and banging noise coming from the kitchen. 
First Watch used to be awesome. Great food, kind staff, relaxing atmosphere...

Our dining experience was highly impersonal, from the decor, to the service to the staff, we were extremely dissatisfied and will never be eating at First Watch again.

Brought a client here for lunch, and it was so good! 

The portions are very generous, especially the side salads. That alone could be a meal. 

I have the manicotti, and it was perfect! 

Client had the salad, and she seemed to enjoy it.

Fairly good, however the fajitas for two serving size can be a bit on the small side and has varied from visit to visit. Watch for moneymailer coupons for $5 or $10 dine in visits! They also advertise kids eat free on Sunday's. Don't have kids so can't comment on how it works.
Ok is,it just me,or does anyone else have problems with getting the American Airlines  site ( eticket) at this airport,  happened to me twice.

Had a Groupon gifted to my husband and me for use on our trip to Vegas, so we made reservations and figured we'd give it a shot.  As parents of a third grader, it's not often we get to go out for meals that don't involve a kid's menu that comes with crayons or sing their own loud renditions of "Happy Birthday", so knowing we were going out for "a nice meal" was definitely a welcomed change of pace.

First of all, the only real bummer in all of this and the reason for four stars instead of five, was that they lost my reservation.  Of all the things I forgot to pack, it was the piece of paper with the confirmation number on it.  They managed to seat us fairly quickly, but it was certainly after all of the other walk-ins had been seated.  I'll remember next time to bring my confirmation.

The decor was definitely not current Vegas glitz, but that doesn't mean it's bad.  It was clean and classic - true "old" Vegas, but not in a tired and dated, "OMG I CAN SEE THROUGH THAT CARPET" kind of way.  Personally, I enjoyed it.  If you're not into anything except glitter and shiny lights, this might not be for you.

The service was amazing.  Our waiter and the rest of the staff were on par with their suggestions and we never wanted for much.  For starters, my husband had the lobster bisque and I had a Caesar salad - although you can get a Caesar salad just about anywhere, this one was by far the best I've had in a long time.  My husband couldn't stop raving about the bisque and, had we been at one of those paper kid's menu places, he might've licked the bowl clean.

For entrees, we skipped the steaks and had their pasta dishes.  I had the spaghetti carbonara - ironically, it was the cheapest item on the menu at $28, but I wasn't choosing it to be cheap.  I chose it because I really like carbonara and my low-carb diet was on hold for our trip to Vegas, so I was shoveling all the pasta into my gut that I could manage.  I wasn't let down, either - the noodles tasted like they'd been made in house, the sauce was perfectly creamy and OMG THE BACON.  Quite possibly, the best bacon I've ever had in all my 33 years.

My husband had some linguine dish.  It had shrimp the size of his fist.  Beyond that, I don't remember.  I was too busy having a bacon-related orgasm.  He enjoyed his dish as well and again, I think I saw him really contemplating licking the plate clean.

I could not finish my meal and my husband was equally stuffed, so we skipped dessert and chose instead to finish our drinks and enjoy each other's company.  The only thing that seemed out of place in the entire establishment was a loud wedding party seated behind us.  It kind of ruined the mojo a little bit, but that wasn't the establishment's fault.

All in all, this place is ace in my book.  A perfect example of how a Groupon can help you drum up repeat business - we'll definitely be back the next time we're in town.

My favourite Korean place. Always get the Bulgogi with a light and refreshing Hite. Tasty side dishes, and good service. I once left my hat there, and they were as cooperative as possible in making sure I could come and get it!

Get's packed easily, but I've always been lucky and haven't had to wait more than a few minutes. Some of the seating is easily cramped, so if you like wide open spaces it may not be the best choice.

According to their website these sandwiches were designed for hungry truckers who had to make quick late night deliveries so they could eat with one hand and drive with the other hand.
I'm not sure I really buy that story because even with two hands, it's nearly impossible to eat one successfully without everything falling out.

It's definitely something very authentic to Pittsburgh, and even if you don't enjoy the food, is worth dropping by just to say you've had one.

Primanti Brothers is definitely a Pittsburgh institution. If you are traveling through, you definitely have stop here, at least for the novelty factor. Overall, food is good for a... well, for a sandwich shop... But in the end, I didn't leave with a sense that I really had to come back. 

The real novelty at Primanti Brothers is that all of there sandwiches include french fries and cole slaw inside that sandwich. And to that I say... "who cares".  I personally didn't care for the fries and slaw inside my sandwich, but I am also not a huge french fry or cole slaw fan. (I like the good ones, but I can easily pass on average,) I will say that their cole slaw, which was vinegar rather than mayonnaise based, was quite good. And there fries were above average, but not as good as somewhere like say, Five Guys. 

The ingredients in the sandwich were all pretty good. I had the Pastrami and my friend had the Angus steak. The bread, meat, cheese, etc., were all good quality and were distinct when tasted individually. The sandwiches also seemed to work OK as a package, but for some reason for me--aside from the novelty factor--they didn't stand out. I think that maybe with the fries and slaw in there, there is just too much going on and those two tend to dominate the whole sandwich. It really takes over and you hardly taste the quality of the other ingredients. 

On the plus side, the sandwiches average about $7 each, and for that price, your get a pretty decent sandwich. In the end, Primanti Brothers is a definite must try if you are passing through, but I don't see myself craving these babies any time soon.

Too loud for lunch even though it's a bar type environment. Friendly staff but mediocre service. Food serving can be a little generous on the sides. Food is 5 star for me but i cannot give a 5 star on food quality alone. Ambiance is average and too loud for a steak house.
My kids love the spaghetti with meatballs here. They say, "it's the best!" I enjoy the Mac and Cheese. The baked pasta with various cheeses is my personal fave here. Not your ordinary Mac and cheese.

Great little place with a whole bunch of treats to choose from. I love the orange-vanilla twist. 

The only downside to this place is the owner woman who I've seen get rude with customers on a couple of visits. She's never been rude to me, but I've seen her near-berate customers who let her know she gave them the wrong thing. She goes on about "No, that's not what you ordered. I read it back to you!" She literally argues with them, telling them they didn't order what they say they ordered.

I can understand her frustration I suppose, but it seems like a really bad business practice to berate customers in front of a whole long line of other customers. The fact is, both her and the customer are to blame for not making sure the other understood the order. Either way, there is no excuse for a business owner to make a customer look stupid in front of a good twenty to thirty people in line. 

Good ice cream, but with an owner who seems clueless on customer service.

I love the ocean, I love scuba diving, I love fish... but I live in the desert.  So of course, I was beyond excited to hear that an aquarium was opening up in town!  The $18 ticket price kept me away until yesterday, when I scored a Groupon for $9 per ticket!  I'm glad I waited, because I don't feel as though it's worth the normal price.

Overall, it's a pretty good aquarium.  I've definitely seen better, but those have been in large cities or close to the ocean.  It's very small (located inside a mall), but they did the best they could with the space they had.  There is one large tank, which you can view from at least four different locations.  I'm not a big fan of the "line" you have to stand in pretty much through the entire thing, since the path is fairly narrow, and winds around from area to area.  But overall, there was a good variety of animals, and lots of facts and information to make it a great educational experience.  The decor reminds me of Disneyland - very clean, and lots of attention to detail, which I definitely appreciate.  

One of my favorite things was the little scratch-off "quiz card" that you get when you enter.  There are eight questions to answer, and it helps keep younger kids entertained while waiting for the line to move along.  At the end, they can redeem their card for a sticker at the gift shop.  This is a great way to avoid buying overpriced, unnecessary souvenirs!

We spent about an hour and a half walking through the aquarium, stopping at each exhibit.  Some of our favorites were the tidepool creatures (touch tank), sharks and rays (viewable from above the tank as well as the side), and seahorses.  They also had a very cool octopus!  The aquarium has "talks" scheduled for every hour or so in different areas, and if we had decided to stay for one or two of those, we probably would have been there for longer.  At the end of the aquarium, there is a large room with a play structure.  I'm not sure why they need this, although our little guy sure enjoyed it!  I wish they had used that space for another exhibit!

It was a fun experience, and worth the $9 discounted tickets.  I'd really like to check out the aquarium at Wildlife World Zoo next.

Came here on Prime Rib night and the prime rib was lacking. It was dry, overcooked and tough. The other selections on the buffet were below average and lacked flavor or was just too dry or mushy to eat. The desserts were okay though. 

If you eat at the cafe side, get the Oxtail Soup. It's delicious! I wish I chose to go back to the cafe instead of the buffet...

I would have never thought this restaurant would be this amazing, this outstanding!!!! We live near the area and being locals, my husband and I always go above and beyond for date nights. When my husband announced that we had reservations at Mrkt, I was a bit skeptical... thinking 'a local area??'  But i thought... oh well what the heck, let's save some gas. The minute we walked in we felt welcomed with a warm greeting, we were seated at a lovely booth (which we always enjoy) and greeted by our server (Michael) who helped us out with the menu AND our delicious Moscato  (we bought the bottle and finished it!) I ordered the shrimp scampi which is seasoned really well. My husband ordered the filet mignon, and the pound and a half Alaskan king crab legs (which we shared) and boy... was it mouth watering!! We are already talking about spending mothers day here with the family. I definitely recommend this restaurant to all locals, good price, great food, and the bonus... you don't have to dress up!! Ok, boutique to enjoy our dessert!!
I come here everytime I want pho. Service is good and the food comes out quick! Their Thai tea is really good too. Overall my son and I love coming here

wanted to get my windows tinted and got the name of this place from a co-worker, and i was not disappointed. i have a infatuation with my cars and its very rare i will give the keys to someone, but my friend gave them the keys to a $70k bmw, that instilled some confidence.

stephen gave rundown on the different tints they offer and why some of the cars running around town look like shit. (don't use a dyed window tint btw) no b.s. involved and i got a education on window tint. 

they took my car in right away since i was waiting for it thought that was cool as i had no appointment. they told me it would be 2 1/2 hours and it took less than two. lifetime warranty. and a fair price, plus the window tint is made in the USA. not gonna lie that rang my cowbell. they will be tinting the windows on all my cars as long as i live in the valley.

I was coming home from the airport and had originally planned on taking the RTA then walking the mile to my house from the RTA stop.  When we landed I saw that it was pouring rain, so as soon as the RTA left the airport I called for a cab and said I would be at the stop in 15-20 min.  I got there within the time frame and waited for 10 min - no cab.  I called, and the dispatcher said she would radio the driver.  I waited for 20 min - no cab.  I tried calling back twice, and no one picked up.  I have no clue if the caller number shows up, but if it does then that was seriously poor form to ignore my call.  I finally gave up and ended up walking home in the rain.  Will not use this company again.

I have been looking for a place for a massage for sometime. I recently received a gift card for SpaFinder. So I figured I would try this place because on their website it says the take SpaFinder. I went and had a 90 minute massage. It was fantastic. The girl that did it was awesome. She made sure I was comfortable and relaxed and she had great customer service. We talked about scheduling to come back in two-three weeks and I was totally up for it. Being a hair stylist standing on my feet, using my hands all day. It's necessary to get a Massage every month (I think). I get to the register to pay and I give the lady my SpaFinder gift cards and she tells me " oh we stopped taking these a month ago". I told her I had found their spa online and that on their website it said they take SpaFinder. She again said they stopped taking them a month ago. Then the other man that was working comes up and tells me that if I sign up for their monthly massages for 60 dollar " at the end he could give me a free massage bc they don't take them". Well I'm sorry but that doesn't help me now because on the website they say they take SpaFinder. I made the appointment with them to use the gift card and to come back frequently. Now I just spent over 100 dollars and still have the gift card. I will not be returning to this place. I will not recommend it to my friends, family or clients at my salon. I truly feel bad for the lady that did such a good job because she just lost a client because of their false advertising.

Just got off the phone to order our wedding cake. I did a lot of research because frankly I don't care what it looks like as long as it tastes good! I ended up going with Freeds honestly because the customer service over the phone was unbeatable. I spoke with both Nancy and Ellie and both treated me as if I were the only one ordering a cake. So very helpful and bent over backwards to make sure I had what I wanted. The price was unbeatable as well. I am positive I'll be just as impressed with the taste as I was the customer service!!

This haircut felt so good that I legitimately wrote a poem about what it feels like to be shampooed here.

'Warm milk kisses on my skull
Fijan breeze grazes the nakedness
Peeking from behind a golden robe.

A rainstorm on a hot July night.
Puddle stomping with my lover.
We wrap up in red, velvet reprieve.

A fleeting slumber. It's October.
Gaea is changing. The air is crisp
And comfortable. Autumn leaves

 Shower us and my lover 
Picks them tenderly from my hair. 
Crushes them with his boot.

Holds my face.
I refuse to open my eyes.'

Yeah I know it's dramatic but this shit felt good.
Only reason I deducted a star is because they asked for how much I wanted to tip in front of my hair stylist which just made me feel uncomfortable lol.

It was instant love for me with Beach Hut Deli. I've known about this spot for awhile, but wasn't in a rush to try "just" a sandwich place. I've been missing out as a result.

During my visit to the deli we were greeted by the friendly employees as soon as we walked in. When they brought our orders to the table they waited a minute to make sure we had everything we needed. At the end of our meal someone came out to make sure we enjoyed everything. Great service!

My second Beach Hut Deli experience was a take-out order at work. Ordering for an office was also easy. The menu was easy to find on their website. I called in the six orders and the woman that took my order repeated everything back at the end for accuracy. All of the orders were correct when we picked them up. We were quoted 15-20 minutes to prepare our order and it was indeed ready when we arrived in that amount of time.

The menu is very unique with sandwich and sub options that you won't find at other delis. Regular size subs are 6" and Large size subs are 9". I was happy to see that they have a Dude/Duddette option which is 3" for subs and half a sandwich for the gourmet sandwiches.
