The subs are all loaded with meat and toppings so for me a 3" sub is plenty with a side. 

The Hobie is their version of an Italian with salami, pastrami, provolone, and Italian dressing. It's loaded with meat and toppings for a delicious and filling sub. The Mahalo Taco (special) was one of the best subs I've ever tasted. It included taco seasoned roast beef and chips. Trying to describe the amazing flavor of this sub is impossible. The flavors all worked so well together. This sub was also packed with meat and toppings. The High Tide has pastrami, ham, bacon, pepper jack cheese, and thousand island dressing on cheese bread. It was very tasty, but I think the sub bread is better than the sandwich bread. The Potato Salad and Pasta Salad are both obviously made in house and are delicious. The Potato Salad has large pieces of potato with skin on and a delicious dressing. The Pasta Salad has orzo pasta, cheese, sundried tomatoes, and artichokes. The flavor is great.

If you are craving good Viet food with fast and friendly service come here. We were in Chinatown plaza area and wanted some pho.  Saw that we get 2 free egg rolls for checking in so why not?!  These egg rolls were bomb and so was the food.

Alright here is the deal, well at least my experience. Food was ok at best sent my burrito back because of the copious amount of cilantro on it. Btw order without unless u want a lot on there. So I got the new burrito and it was ok(shredded beef)
As for the atmosphere, I would rather sit in the play area of McDonald's than be here. So many families that either do not care how obnoxious their kids are or are simply oblivious to it. Wow! At one point I had a kid sitting on the wall next to us. Was not our kid. 
Positive note: no chipmunks found here

This place is amazing authentic tasting! its kinda in a hole in the wall strip mall but always busy so u know it must be good. I always get the same thing and am never disappointed a big bowl of tai pho (beef soup) with beef on the side, crispy eggrolls with dipping sauce, and their Vietnamese coffee. Everything tastes absolutely delicious and is served with fresh mints and greens and condiments! I crave their pho seriously. I never can finish what I get either b/c it is so big!!! Despite the huge portions it only ever costs me $12. What nice too is they are attached to Milk Run if you want to get a flavored drink afterwards for kids or urself.

The comedian we went to see was hilarious and vulgar which is how I like my comedians.  The drinks were to die for (I sampled many), the bathrooms were clean, the staff was hot enough to possibly make me a stalker and earn me a restraining order...I'm just saying.

Then again it could have been all the booze I was sampling.  I could return to act like a creeper and have one of those sober "OH MY DAMN" moments. And not a good "oh my damn you're so hot I'm gonna snatch you into the trunk of my car and keep you" moments, but an "oh my damn poor child I didn't know Quasimodo had a brother" moments.

Moving on...the food was delicious and I pretty much tried the whole menu almost.  I was a party of 12+ people and we all ordered something different and shared with each other.  Everything sampled was delicious and service was speedy.  I personally believed the prices to be reasonable and I think the food was even being served at happy hour prices.

Now the only down side to the place is a few things. First is they don't permit you to slap other customers, trust me I asked and they said no. Too bad because there were a few women in the audience getting on my nerves and it seemed like they went there with the intent to ruin everyone else's good time and the party I was with noticed it too.  Funny thing is they weren't even there together!  They just kept making comments like "omg that's ridiculous" and I had to listen to them on both sides of me bitching and whining the whole show about all 3 acts, about their drinks, about everything.  Well ladies it's a comedy club and most comedians push the boundaries and talk about uncomfortable things. What F**king rock were you both living under that you've never seen a comedy show do the same stuff? I've been to many comedy shows all over Phoenix, Scottsdale, Tempe, Las Vegas, and Boston and guess what it's all the same.

My suggestion if you're one of those people that needs your stick surgically removed from your ass, do the rest of the paying customers a favor and stay home and quit ruining our good vibes. And if you must show up might the Dr Recommend one shot of vodka every 10 mins until that stick just glides right out of your ass on its own.

Another down side is they are just not busy. I'm really afraid they'll close down which sucks because I like it there.  But I've tended to notice that ever since City North opened up it has never been that busy. I've witnessed so many places come and go in that plaza because they never advertise that entire area. I would never even know about it if it's wasn't for the fact my friend use to work in the City North plaza. Something has to be done to bring more people in.

I went into this facility to get treatment for the flu like symptoms I was experiencing. Vomiting, diarrhea, high fever, sinus pressure, sore throat, headaches, stomach pains, my whole body ached, I could barely walk, very lethargic, and coughing to the point where my rib cage hurts. I was hoping to be seen just for the symptoms I was having but instead the PA took it upon herself and thought since I have Celiac disease that it could be something going on inside my stomach causing the infection because I  had such a high fever. She did not give me the proper check up that was required for someone coming in for being sick. She did not listen to my lungs and I have asthma so you could hear rails as I breathed but she didn't check or ask, I even wrote it on my paperwork. Nor did she give my throat a proper exam because I knew I was having throat pain, as noted in my paperwork, but she said she didn't see any redness. Basically she was calling me a liar. So her recommendation was for me to go straight to the emergency room. She did not release me with any medication whatsoever and I even had a fever of 100. I was in dire pain but again this doctor released me, their patient, without the proper care I needed. My insurance is a little different, I would have to pay $2000 just to go to the emergency room and the PA did not care. Of course I couldn't go to the emergency room so I was in pain with no sleep for the entire night until the next day when I went to another urgent care extra. At this urgent care extra, I wasn't given the proper treatment nor the proper medications. Especially the proper medications!! I was given generic cough syrup that my insurance did not cover and ended up being $40. The pharmacist also informed me that this prescription is the same as Robitussin. So I basically paid $40 for Robitussin. Thank you very much PA! All of these urgent care extras are a joke. They will not prescribe medications that are NEEDED for one to feel better, not even a simple antibiotic for someone that is extremely sick with the flu. This is the second facility with this same name that has encouraged me to go to the emergency room to get treatment. It seems to me as though they do not want to treat their patients. They get rid of them by sending them to the emergency rooms instead of fixing them. That's how these emergency rooms get over crowded because PAs and Doctors don't want to treat certain patients and will send them straight to the emergency room. Shame on you! They also took my urine sample which I didn't mind. I know I'm clean and I do not do drugs so therefore they should prescribe me the medicine I need to feel better, to go back to work, to take care of my children, and to get rid of this flu that I have. Now I have to make another appointment with a different doctors office for a flu that has kept me away from work for a week! I will be going to the BBB about my two experiences I have had it with this facility, and being two different locations.

3.5 STARS due to the fact I came during the day and there was a concert going on at the same time.  I got in here for free courtesy of the Yelp Spring Break guide, although there's no cover here during the day...maybe later in the night, there may be.  The band playing was fronted by a lady who did a few songs decent until she got to Journey's "Don't Start Believing."  Gulp...I switched off after that...who can do that song justice besides the original Steve Perry?  Anyways, I got a drink and sat down to chill and watch the show while the show at the Carnaval bar area was in full effect.  The whistles, the wildness, the flair moves made this area very exciting and entertaining to watch up close and afar.  I can imagine that at night, this place must be even more jumping.  The whistles were a bit irritating because it did interfere with the concert performers but I guess that can't be helped, right?  Props though for them playing "Bad Girl" by Donna Summer in honor of her recent passing.

Will likely come back here if my group decides on it but no way am I sitting at the bar to have hard alcohol poured down my throat blindfolded!

The restaurant service was excellent.  Our dinner was excellent. I had the 10 ounce filet migeon and it was cooked exactly to order.  My date had the scallops and he enjoyed them.  The prices are a little higher than expected giving the atmosphere.  The only things I was very surprised about was the noise level and how it completely opened up to the casino.  They had music blasting as if you were in a night club.  The servers had to scream to talk to you and you couldn't even have a conversation with your date.  I personally would not return for the noise level alone.  There are too many other places in Las Vegas with great service, food, and a lot more quieter.

As soon as we arrived in Vegas our first stop was the Bachi Burger.  We came on a Friday night and it was busy but we only waited a couple of minutes to be seated. The restaurant is spacious and casual.  In the front, there is a leather couch, a table with menus, and a small chalkboard listing their specials.

::Drinks::
I got the Iced Matcha Green Tea. It was not sweet and I couldn't taste the green tea flavor; it was watered down.

::Food::
We got the Black and Green Burger which came with American Wagyu Grass Fed Beef, sautéed mushrooms, bacon, spinach, blue cheese, and roasted garlic.  I also requested to add Fried Egg.  What I liked most about this burger was the bun, it was fluffy, toasted, and sweet.  Next is the KiKi's Burger.  It had Angus Beef, caramelized bacon, cheese, sweet onion marmalade, garlic chili aioli, and three kinds of mushroom, Shiitake, Enoki, and Eryngii.  I prefer this burger than the Black and Green Burger.  If I come back, I will try something different and I also want to get the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries.

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=dKtDM8cf274VOvaKhnShKQ)

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=PhVklDSk2ngffBgmTlxYSg)

::Rating::
My review is based on the burgers we ordered.  

::M's Notes::
-Inside Seating
-Parking Lot

Dare I write this . . . this place is better than Starbucks, this place is a hidden gem!  I walked into this place  not expecting much and was pleasantly surprised.  Each time I've been here the staff has been warm and friendly. I've ordered from their breakfast menu, lunch menu and of course the coffees and everything has been delicious. I love how they have a private room where you can set up to write or read all day at your leisure. It's a very comfortable space, decorated to make you feel welcome. After coming here once I was so pleased that every chance I get, I stop by. They also have live music on the weekends. A great place to meet for just coffee or if you're hungry also for lunch and dinner!  In case you're wondering what's good, all items in the menu are delish!

Who knew there were so many different types of mustard?  

The shop upstairs offers samples of any mustard they sell.  (Don't bother resisting.  You will buy more than one kind - ask for Oprah's favorite.)  The museum downstairs hosts an impressive display of mustard (and mustard containers) from around the world.  Not so entertaining for young kids, but worth a walk around for adults and big kids.  It's worth a quick visit if you're in the Madison area.

I've driven by this place many times and though curious, I had convinced myself that I would emerge from this place with a black eye and a few missing teeth should I ever venture in. 

We popped in on a Sunday for a few drinks between brunch and dinner. The place was divey but clean, a mix of clientele but everyone kept to themselves. The bartender was friendly and attentive and they served 8 oz beers for $2.75 (or was it $1.75.......we'd been drinking at brunch). Anyway, it worked for me having smaller beers and at less $$.

Not that I'm complaining about price at all, as this place is CHEAP.....I think it just worked for me by having smaller beers. I'm curious how this place is a on Friday night......the neighbourhood is not the nicest.....so stay tuned!

My husband and I tried this place for the first time today. ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT! We had the Thai massage combination and we definitely walked out feeling brand new.

We've never had a Thai massage done but definitely recommend getting one from this spa! Friendly staff, fantastic massage, overall amazing experience!

Happy Wok is a family favorite! The staff is always fast and friendly. The food is delicious and the menu selection includes all of the usual favorites.  Amount of food and prices are both fair for a fresh, hot meal. Definitely recommended.

Ordered the Kiki Pizza (medium size) for $35. Yes it was quite pricey, but the ingredients are fresh and you can taste the difference, as cheesey as it sounds....

Their hot sauce drizzle was delicious and added a really nice kick to the pizza. Their crust is what stood out to me the most. It was perfectly crisp on the bottom, yet it maintained a really nice chewy texture that is hard to find with pizza joints in the GTA.

I will return to try their sandwiches next time :) Keep up the good work Pizza Nostra!
Quick and efficient, best way to describe this place. Extremely happy with the customer service and interaction with the customers!

I've eaten here a handful of times, and each time it's been good. Last night we stopped in for a quick bite to eat after work. I wanted something lighter than a burger so I went with the turkey wrap! Not too shabby! The wrap was a good size and had decent flavor. I substituted the regular fries/chips for sweet potato fries which were really tasty! 

Unfortunately I can't comment on the beer since I don't drink and drive when I am driving my daughter. 

As a group we shared the Brewer's Board and it was just okay. Each component is good. We love the mustard, jam, and corn nuts. But there isn't enough bread or meat to spread the condiments on. But it's a good size board for 4 people sharing. 

Overall it's a good place to eat, a nice place for a date, and if you're looking for a nice lunch or dinner on the way home it's a good stop in!
Yum. We met family members here and it was amazing. It's a small place to sit and enjoy your lunch. We even tried dessert and it was delicious.

If I could, I would give this place a solid three and a half. But, I can't- and hey, if you aren't expecting the absolute best Italian food out there but need something to lean on, then this place is for you. 

It was relatively busy when we walked in, but there were still some tables open and we were seated relatively quickly. Bread and olive oil came promptly. The service was good, and our server was very nice. We actually talked a little bit when dinner was over. His service alone made me round this review up to four stars.

Onto the food. I ordered the Gnocchi Sorrentina, which is gnocchi in a tomato basil sauce with pieces of fresh mozzarella. My mom originally ordered a salad, but the server was kind enough to let her change her order shortly thereafter to a pasta dish with penne, chicken, and broccoli in a light cream sauce. My dad got a salad with salmon, my brother a pasta dish with bolognese sauce. 

The food was good, typical Italian. The sauce on my gnocchi was exceptionally good, along with my mom's cream sauce. I didn't taste the other two dishes, but I heard good things. Portions were perfect- not too big, nor too small. We had Creme Brûlée for dessert, a perfectly sized Creme Brûlée that was tasty. Overall, it was a good experience. Would I come back? Yes.

I love Rock Star bootcamp! I have been going since November and everyday is a new exciting workout! Several of my friends and family members have now joined too! Every Wednesday is bring a friend day so let me know if you are up for the challenge!
Good goat cheese and spinach salad along with a half and half. Havarty/Turkey sandwich and a cup of Tomato Cous Cous soup. Great glass of Wheat beer!

The Labor Ready located in North Las Vegas, NV, Branch Number 8046, 365 W. Craig Road
Suite 118, 89032, had a posting for laborers on April 4, 2015 To report to work on April 5, 2015 (Easter Sunday).  At the Wal-Mart location on Boulder Highway at 7AM.  I replied to the text and reported to the assignment.  I have repeatedly contacted the Branch 8046 North Las Vegas by phone and even went to the location in-person, but I keep getting told, "they are working on it..." or they continue to have me on hold. I have tried on a number of occasions to try to obtain my payment since April 6, 2015 payment for my work.  When I arrived at my assignment on April 5, 2015, I signed in and out on the sign in sheet. I AM GETTING THE RUN AROUND FROM BRANCH 8046.  RUDE OFFICE EMPLOYEES AND SCATTERBRAINED!!! NO ONE KNOWS ANYTHING IN THAT OFFICE!!!!!  BEWARE, AND IF YOU WORK FOR LABOR READY, MAKE SURE THEY PAY YOU!!

Food taste was great but disappointed in the serving size and server.  Came here with three friends and sat outside.  At the same time we got our chips and salsa, another guy asked if wanted some guacamole.  We looked at each other and said sure.  We thought it was part of the chips and salsa.  When we got the bill they charged us $12.  We all thought they were a little deceptive in how that transaction worked.  Each of us ordered a different taco.  All tasted great BUT in my case the short rib taco had a tiny nugget of meat on it.  I guess when they smoked it for 12 hours it shrunk to nothing.  It was a small taco to begin with but it was stacked high with the garnish.  I would have like more meat on it.  Yah it is probably a cool place to go but next time I would rather go somewhere where the taco's are more substantial.  For what we got it was pricey.

Good Cheese and Pepperoni Pizza (7 out of 10) but don't try to get too fancy anything beyond basic hasn't been very good. Service is hit and miss, our family has been to eat at this location at least 6 times and it has declined in the last 6 months.

In my book this place gets NO STARS! I had a rough night tending to my dog wheezy who is fairly old and having trouble with her pregnancy. These people straight up told me and my family that wheezy would die if she gave birth naturally. So they told us the only option of a C section. They brought us a quote of how much it would be, $3,800 dollars!!! Plus the initial fee for being seen that day! While me and my family are racking our brains to find out how we're going to pay this to save wheezies life, the staff kept coming in the room bothering us if we've made up our minds because "we don't have much time left for wheezy" so after 6 people in my family applied for credit care and all got denied they gave us another option to get a title loan so we drive to the title loan center and find out we can't because we're from florida and just moved here a week ago and have to have proof of residency. So we get back to the hospital thinking wheezy is going to die cause the staff told us she doesn't have much time left. Then when they found out  we couldn't pay the money they gave us our bill and sent us on our way with a card of another animal clinic, they told us the only way to save wheezy was to abort her babies. They staff told us that the card of the other animal clinic will do this for us but they don't open until 7am. It was already 3am so we just all went home with wheezy and stayed up and got to the other animal clinic at 6:15am. They showed up at 7 and tell them whats going on and they tell us they have no idea why they referred us to them because they don't do those kinds of surgery!!!!! This company only wants MONEY!! They don't care what happens to you or your pet! My story has a happy ending though! Finally after hours of no sleep and searching we found an amazing Animal Clinic on 400 college Dr. Its called black mountain! They took wheezy in with extraordinary care and let us stay with her! They also worked with us on payment, they allowed us to pay in payments instead of all upfront and wheezy had her c section for only $1,600! Now we have 5 new baby boy puppies in the family and wheezy is struggling a little but they are keeping her there with them and giving her all the care she needs! When we picked up the puppies black mountain went through the steps of how to take care of them and the supplies we need! If you want great care and great prices BLACK MOUNTAIN ON 400 COLLEGE DR.! Never again will I step foot in las vegas animal emergency hospital!!!

Clean friendly fast and good seating are hallmarks of this chain. Even the beggarsbeggars ant ruin thethe ambiance here. 
Food is great. Always something new to try & none of the fare ever looks tired. 
I had the King Paolo chicken and my friend had the mushroom chicken. Pics to follow.

INVENTIVE APPEALING VEGAN

Hi All!

Working the side job as a world renown photographer ...note SLIGHT sarcasm...I finished some work on a shoot in town and decided I wanted something healthy, filling and different.

I Yelp searched and decided to head to Larryville for a late lunch. And I have to admit I was starving so I quickly ordered a falafel wrap and a chocolate muffin. Both were very tasty. I love the homemade pickled veggies in the wrap and I have to admit it was a giant portion so I had plenty to take home.

Chocolate muffin was very rich and delicious. Such a treat with way less guilt.

I fully intend to return and try more items on their menu!

Love you! 
Bye!

I called TheLens after finding a scorpion shortly after moving into my home. Clay was an hour late for our appointment, but called ahead of time to let me know. He was very accommodating to my schedule and even offered to come the same day I called. He was very thorough and spent two hours inspecting the outside of my home and applying the treatment inside and out. He went over everything with me afterward and gave me tips for things I could do to prevent bugs from entering my home. I would definitely recommend this company to everyone.

This place had so much to offer that it took my girlfriend and I a while to pick. Eventually we got some cookies and some other pastries. Honestly, for the hype of this place I was expecting everything to be a bit better. I was expecting buttery, flavorful, melt-in-your-mouth flavors but it kind of felt like something I could get at Smith's. I only went once so maybe the next time I stop by I'll have a better review : )

I would give more stars if it was an option! Spent our anniversary weekend at places with awful service, just wanting one single person to give us decent service. Little did we know what we were getting into with our final stop at the Windsor. The staff went above and beyond to give some of the friendliest, but still unobtrusive service I have ever seen. Anthony made sure all our food and drinks were tasting great and gave us space to relax but somehow was always there exactly when we needed something. The drinks are delicious and the staff is extremely knowledgeable in the flavor profiles of everything so you can be confident they'll steer you in the right direction no matter what you're looking for. We will be back, with the utmost confidence that no matter who is on staff, both the service and staff will be only of the highest quality.

I had the tandoori mixed grill 20.50 and the tandoori prawns 23.50.  burned naan 2.00 (see pic). butter sauce 3.00. Very expensive. Nice flavors. Lots of food. All the meats in the grill were dry and tough. I used a certificate. I would have been very upset if I paid full price for this. It's sitting in the fridge. Not even sure that I'll reheat it. Trying to think of a way to repurpose it.  May go straight to trash.... Be careful if ordering by phone. I ordered the 13.50 prawns and he made the more expensive ones,  and I thought he said the sauce and bread were free but he was saying three. He didn't charge me for the mistakes. that was awesome! The sauce was like a tomato sauce, not very tasty. Def won't go back

We had the garage floors at our new home coated a few weeks ago and could not be happier. I shopped the job around quite a bit and comparing feature to feature found IronDrive to be the lowest cost. What really sold me was the the responsiveness and patience of Shane, the sales contact. I asked countless questions and he responded to each one with complete answers and his responses were always professional and quick, even when I asked a question after hours.
The crew that did the coatings did an amazing job. The work area was kept spotless and they were both pleasant to speak with and clearly took pride in their work. The floors look amazing!
In the end we paid a fair price, got great upfront sales service, and a professional/high quality floor installed by a great crew. What more could we ask for? We are very happy with the entire process.

Very pleased with my visit, stopping here after picking up a college student from downtown Pittsburgh on our way to Slippery Rock University for breakfast.  
Our server was very pleasant and efficient.  I ordered a hot chocolate because I was chilled from the weather.  I was sooo very pleased to see what she brought back for me -- a huge cup topped with whipped cream and chocolate syrup.  
There were plenty breakfast options.  I selected the banana foster french toast with bacon and my comrade chose chocolate chip pancakes.  I didn't hear any complaints out of him and the plate was bare so, I'd say he enjoyed his dish.  Mine?  Very good, and, again, the plate was left bare.

Since this location has opened up.... it's prolly the closest one to me & I can get a quick pick me up for the best burgers in the east coast since in n out is hands down the best one on the west coast lol Depending on my mood I'll pick my burger... bacon, mushroom, onion rings.. etc.... but the main item I usually almost ALWAYS order is the double down fries (fully loaded) are a MUST try for everyone!!!! My always ordered item with my burger & shake. They have seasonal shakes so make sure u try which ever one is in season before they change it. Last time I got the grasshopper (mint chocolate) & the most recent time when I went last week it was coffee. & there shakes do not disappoint... so indulge & make sure u grab ur meal here. great spot for burgers!

Saturday night, 7/5/14, 7:00PM.

I never got around to eating at Daniel Boulud's brasserie at the Wynn before it closed so I was excited to try his new restaurant at the Venetian.  It is an inviting open restaurant with a large bar area and dark wood furnishings all around.  

We arrived before our other guests and sat down for a pre-dinner drink at the bar.  We had boulevardier ($17) and a maitresse ($13).  The brasserie's version of the boulevardier is a mixture of Bulleit rye whiskey instead of bourbon, Aperol instead of Campari and sweet vermouth with a slice of orange rind.  It was a really good pour with no ice to mask the taste and the heavy cut crystal glass it was served in was a nice touch.  The maitresse, served in a martini glass, was a sweet concoction of rum, lime and coconut liqueur that perhaps would make a good drink if you were sitting by the pool but it didn't work well before dinner.

When the rest of the group arrived, we started with the Terrine of foie gras ($24), burrata ($14), and the crab timbale ($20).  All three tasted ok but the delicate crab flavor was overwhelmed by the taste of the overlying fruit and the foie gras terrine didn't have the punch or flavor of the seared version that you could get upstairs at Bouchon.

For dinner we has the Tunisian lamb with merguez sausage ($45), the sea scallops ($29), the oven roasted halibut ($40) and the swordfish ($42).  The scallops had a good sear on them and were served on a bed of sweet corn and shitake mushrooms.  They were delicious. The halibut was also cooked just right and was moist and flavorful. On the other hand, the swordfish was on the dry side and kind of bland.  Perhaps they had two different chefs cooking the fish that night?  The lamb and spicy sausage tasted fine on its own but seemed heavy in comparison to the first two seafood dishes.

For desert, the standout of the night was the grand marnier soufflé with vanilla anglaise sauce ($15). I don't know how he got it to be so light and airy or how it came out so fast but it was one of the best I have ever had. Roy Yamaguchi could learn a thing or two about cooking soufflé's from this place. We also split the pistachio-cherry Sunday ($14). This tasted great while you were eating the overlying flavorful pistachio ice cream but it lost its charm when you got down to the sour cherry ice cream underneath.

Overall, it was a good dining experience. The place was kind of empty for dinner time on a Saturday night but perhaps that is because it is still new. I also notice with trepidation that some of the dish prices at the restaurant are already a dollar or two higher than what is advertised on the online menu. As it is still kind of early to be raising prices, I hope it doesn't mean the new restaurant is already in trouble.  I would recommend it and I know I would go back, especially for more soufflé.

WOW !   This is the company you want. Professional, courteous, knowledgeable and honest.  Have you ever bought something and everything just felt right when it was done.  That is how I felt with Legacy Air.  Dont hesitate, call them, use them, they are great!  

I called and they said they were full and would be out in a couple days, they would also call if there were any cancellations, they called to say they could be out a few hours earlier, but I had already committed to my work schedule and couldnt change to the earlier appt, they understood and were fine with that.  Even waiting a couple days for service, OMG, it was WORTH THE WAIT!  Dean was my service tech, what a great guy.  Answered all my curious questions, fixed my A/C, gave me suggestions (which I will do) and within 20 minutes of completion my house was much cooler. As I spoke to Dean, I found out they also do plumbing.  Wow, an honest a/c business and plumbing too, Jackpot (sorry bad Vegas pun)!   So happy that someone is actually being honest with me.  Look forward to doing more business with this company and will share them with all my closest friends, well and now everyone who visits on Yelp. 

Thank you very much Dean, office staff, and Legacy Air, you are amazing !

The pizza is the best pizza I've had in a long time. I wanna drive back out there and have more.  
Every time someone mentions pizza I crave godfathers

The wait times are about 25 minutes. They were really busy but it was worth the wait for us!!
I wish they had more in town because this location is far from our house outside of Vegas.
Disgusting.  Tomatoes in the noodles, even the eggs in soup were rancid.  $30 food straight in the trash.

A large store stocked with nothing but Beer, Wine, and party supplies and fine foods....add free beer and wine tastings on Friday nights, a bar with well priced beers, wines, and tapas - and you have an awesome evening!  You spend the majority of your money on stocking your Fridge and wine shelf versus at the bar though...

Did I mention they also have a tinder box stocked walk-in humidor?

I am so satisfied,  leaving the restaurant with a smile on my face.  The Rojak is the best. .. It tastes so good.   The Hanan chicken rice is so tasty.  The chicken is tender and juicy while the rice is piping hot and very flavorful.   The beef satay is very tasteful by itself and the belachan orkra is superb.  Definitely will come Asian when I visit Toronto again in October.

By far my favorite Panang Curry dish in all of Arizona. It is awesome! My wife loves the Pad Thai as well.

I flippin LOVE this place!!

Granted, most resale stores are 'hit or miss' but I never seem to 'miss' with MSC!! They have TONS of name brand clothing, shoes, purses, and accessories! True Religion, Se7en, Juicy, Coach, D&G, the list goes on and on! Of course, you'll have to search for what you're looking for but even with the store being 'picked over' today (70% off sale making room for their fall apparel debut tomorrow!!), I was able to find a pair of Aldo sandals for $4.89!! I also found some Lucky jeans, a JunkFood Tshirt, and a pair of D&G sunglasses!!

The eatery is very well put together and comfortable. The design and decoration make this place so cute. He staff was friendly and helpful. The outside area was amazing. The view was relaxing and the shaded patio gave us a place to sit and relax. 
The food, on the other hand, was not great. I got a "blackened broccoli salad" which was not blackened, it was browned and soggy. My husband got a pepperoni pizza which was extremely greasy. The cheese was so strange, it had absolutely zero flavor. The pepperoni was tasty though. He whole thing was thin and soggy as well. 
It's a bummer, I was really hoping the food would be as good as the cafe looks, but not so much. I won't return soon.
Darn good Pho!

Finally got to try this place and it was a really great first experience. 

This restaurant serves up some yummy Japanese dishes that are different than your usual sushi place. 

We started with the baby octopus which was served cold in a sweet sauce, this dish was flavorful and unique and we really enjoyed this. We also shared the edamame and karaage, both were delicious and generously portioned to share. For mains we tried the beef gyu bowl and the chicken curry bowl. Both of these were packed with flavour, the chicken didn't have much actual chicken but the potatoes, carrots and the curry sauce were delicious and hearty, it felt like Japanese comfort food. The beef bowl had a generous portion of beef and rice, there was also egg, some edamame, ginger and a couple of slices of cantaloupe in the bowl which was nice and refreshing. We also ordered the iced genmaicha tea which had little pieces of coconut jelly in the bottom, we really enjoyed this drink. 

For dessert we had the matcha green tea with Oreo pieces and this was really yummy and a nice way to finish the meal. 

All of this food came to about $50 with tax and tip which is reasonable for all the items we ordered. 

The restaurant itself is really modern and trendy looking, lots of intentional mismatched furniture, light fixtures and other features give a sort of hipster vibe to it. It offered a nice dining environment.

The crowd is mostly younger people but we saw families and all sorts of people filling the tables. 

The service was pretty good, we got our orders in and our food pretty quickly and our servers were courteous however they seemed a bit overwhelmed with the volume of customers they had. 

Overall a cute place with some good, inexpensive bites to eat. I can't wait to come back and try more items on this menu!

Wow, what a great restaurant! I had never had Bulgarian or pretty much any Eastern European foods, but thanks to Forte, I now know that I love it! Started with bread dipped in olive oil mixed with wonderful spices (what is this called? Where can I buy more of these spices??). Friend tried the octopus appetizer, it was cooked perfectly and the bed of rice had a lovely flavor. Tried both the Bulgarian and Serbian mixed grill platters. Both were incredible, with uniquely spiced meats with unusual, but pleasing flavors. I don't know what the names of things were, or which platter was which, but it didn't matter, because everything was excellent. Even the side of "ketchup" which was wonderful on its own. The Bulgarian Biscuit cake was one of the best things I've ever eaten: soft layers of thin dough with cream in between. Even the Bulgarian house wine was outstanding. All this (and several other delicious drinks) for a very reasonable price. I can't wait for the next time I'm in town to eat here again!

This is my third trip here. I have always found the owner and staff friendly and helpful. I prefer my hot dog well done and loved that my first was done so. Second I was less impressed with as I would have preferred it more well done; however when given a special request for a well done dog they delivered. Would recommend to all. Great establishment
Great service, the family that owns this place are very friendly and personal. They get to know you, learn your orders and it's very clean.

It was our first visit here and we had a small issue with our food. However, the manager came to our table right away, fixed the issue and gave us some delicious dessert. Great customer service! Will definitely be back. Especially for the crispy mac and cheese bites.

I LOVE Liege waffles, so I can appreciate what Waffle Bar is trying to achieve. It's a nice little cafe with friendly service. Unfortunately, the food was a swing and miss. 

My husband and I each ordered the chicken and waffles, which is chicken strips and a waffle. The chicken strips are on par with frozen Tyson strips, as in mechanically separated chicken formed into the shape of the tenderloin of a chicken, and covered in a ton of cajun seasoning. It was served with fries also covered in too much of the same seasoning. My waffle was cooked well; warm, soft, a little crunch from the caramelized sugar. My husbands was pretty dry and a bit overdone. 

My daughter had the waffle with berries which was beautiful to look at, but her waffle was rock hard with a slightly stale taste to it. When I say "hard" I mean in the way a super hard crouton bounces off your plate when you try to stick your fork in it. Very disappointing. 

I did, however, purchase the Groupon for this meal so I'm not terribly upset. Sometimes businesses give Groupon customers sub par service/product, so it's possible we just didn't get the best of what they have to offer.

Although, I stay loyal to Alternate Reality comics, I have to give this location credit for cleanliness, organization, staff support, and overall ambiance of it all. Is it me? or are the Maximum Comics completely obsessed with DC comics? I'm a Dark Horse/Marvel kind of girl :) 

What I enjoyed: Vast selection and variety, seating area, refreshments, posters, t-shirts, Kidrobot accessories 

Not a bad place to check out :)

After a meal with some friends, we were looking for a place to chill that wasn't very noisy to catch up. We wandered into Station and knew it was the perfect place! 

Staff was friendly and the atmosphere was a exactly what we needed. I was actually surprised how laid back it was for a Saturday night in Bloomfield (me, two friends and Ankur three or four people at the bar). The place itself have a very modern and rustic look that you see a lot of these, but it makes the place more comforting and warm. 

We didn't order food, just drinks. Glass of wine was around $8 which is average. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking to hang out for an hour or so without a crazy crowd and noise.

Well the quality of the Instruments is high caliber. We have purchased a guitar and clarinet all with no issues. 

However the issues comes into play with scheduling practice lessons and follow follow-ups from having your instrument repaired. No one calls to advise when your instrument is ready, almost lost our daughters clarinet however thank God we had a receipt. 

Scheduled for lessons driving 45 min for the appointment, with no one to show up or call. When speaking with management the they still had no clue where the instructor was. 

Word to the wise, keep your receipts and don't expect a phone call from them even if they say they will. Discombobulation at it's finest.

These portion sizes! It's a surprise that they are making a profit for practically giving food away. The best part is it's right down the street for me. Another plus is that I waited for 10 min for them to cook it fresh. Will have to visit again soon.

Superb service! Found them on Yelp, called late in order to ask about repairing door as something snapped and the door wouldn't pull. Great price and came the very next day. Highly recommend! Thank you!!

Bizarre meats is a memorable experience indeed. I have two buddies who work here and so I went in for dinner. We started off with a couple of cocktails including a gin and tonic and my wife had a smoked cocktail of some sort. Both were elevated and worth the price. Next we had some appetizers. Clams with tigers milk were okay. Not great. The foie cotton candy is exceptional. One of the best bites I've had. The salmon cones are great and all of the sandwiches are creative modern takes on classics. This place is super pricey but worth it in many aspects. This place does meat with an incredible amount of skill and respect. Do yourself a favor and try it out.

Came here on an online deal. The restaurant is small like 8 booths maybe. It was real quiet when I came in. (No customers) My food was delicious! I got the baba ganoush, stuffed grape leaves, and a gyro. My food was awesome! The Grape leaves were really one of the best I had. The price was a little much but like I said I came in with an online coupon. I would probably come back if someone else was buying!

We just ate here.  The service by Kate and staff was awesome, loved the Hana hou special burger.  We are here for spring training and American Airlines lost our luggage throwing our trip into a tailspin.  Kate cared about us and took care of us including a free dessert, too!  Great place!

Dining Area: 4/5
Food Quality: 4/5
Parking: 3/5
Service: 2/5
Value: 3/5

The food is actually decent at Ricky's. The major problem has to do with the inconsistency of service.  Some visits you get a great server who's quick and friendly, sometimes you get the angry lady who wants you to go away so she can go back to watching one of the many TVs.  If they could just get the service staff a little more engaged, this would easily be a 4 or 5 star place for families.  Side note: the parking lot is close by but kind of cramped and always overrun by the patrons of Woody's down the block.

Busy on the weekends, so don't show up at 1pm on a Saturday expecting no wait. The service is great! I never even had my eyebrows done until I tried this for my wedding. Now I am hooked! My eyes are my best feature, and the threading here makes my brows the perfect frame! My brows always look natural and groomed. I have even had compliments from my prettiest fashion savvy friends. It's not very painful, but my eyes always tear up a lot during the threading, so I recommend showing up without eye makeup if you can help it. Totally worth $11! (You need to tip, too!)
If there is no wait, expect about 15 minutes for the whole process.

The food was ok but the service was slow and rude.

I never understand when management is rude to the customers. After paying and waiting a half hour for my food, it finally three orders came out.  
Asked for the person to pass me my order, no need to have to wait for customers that came in after me to pay. She wouldn't give me my order.

The rude woman was the manager.  Instead of saying sure and passing me the order, she decided that she was going to look after the male customers that came in after me.  She wanted to teach me a lesson.  However the lesson is you might have won the battle, and thought you looked a big shot. 

Sarcastically said "have a nice evening".

The manager created a very bad vibe in the restaurant, lost a loyal customer. She was in the back and didn't even know what was going on at the front of the house.
Also what kind of Thai Restaurant has also an Italian menu!!!

My wife and I booked 7nights here and within 3days we had 4 different rooms due to deadbolt not working, electric outlets not working, and a dresser being broken. The manager even tried to put us in the casino wing which I heard had bedbugs and when I told her that she agreed that they had complaints about them. The housekeeping is awful they came in and didn't even make the beds they threw blankets still bagged on the bed. Even at the pools it's awful life guards just sit there and half the time they don't pay attention neither do kids parents. I had to grab a kid who lost her grip on the wall and went under and couldn't swim. I had kids jump on me kick me got hit with balls even in the hot tub kids running and jumping in over and over with parents doing nothing 15ppl sitting in the hot tub doesn't leave enough room for kids to be fooling around. If the airline didn't want such a high fee to switch our flights to a earlier day I would've flown home. This hotel made our vacation stressful, and the enjoyment went away every time we re-entered the hotel. I personally will never stay here again
This is worth your money to try out, very delicious.  The sushi is great and the service is fast.   I enjoyed eating here

I typically love 'speakeasy' type bars, but really didn't like the vibe at Acacia. A group of friends and I went around 11pm on a Friday night and the place was decently busy, but not so crowded that we couldn't snag seats at the bar. I immediately noticed that the clientele at Acacia was VERY diverse. One guy was wearing pajama pants (literally), while others were wearing suits and bow ties. The drink menu was decent, with many different beer, wine and cocktail options to choose from, but at premium prices. Because Acacia is the type of place to go for a well-made cocktail, I ordered a tequila-based one that sounded good. I was disappointed that most of the cocktails were whisky or gin heavy since I am more of a vodka/tequila drinker. It took quite a while for the bartender to come over to take my group's order (we were sitting at the bar) and it was about ten minutes after that before I got my drink. I know cocktails take longer to make, but I was watching the bartender and he was just essentially twiddling his thumbs instead of making our drinks. Once I finally got it, I was impressed with the cocktail-- the flavors were balanced nicely and it had just the right amount of 'kick'. 

Even though I wasn't having a super good time, I was down to have one more drink before moving on to somewhere else and spent 20 minutes trying to order another drink by doing that awkward stare at the bartender (My group was still sitting at the bar and we all had empty drinks). After witnessing the bartender (a different guy than the original one who served me) speak rudely to other customers (statements such as 'Don't you know it is rude to close your tab then order another drink fifteen minutes later?'), it became clear that Acacia is full of pretentious staff members who think they are doing you a favor by serving you. I was fed up with the terrible service and generally obnoxious atmosphere and decided that despite wanting another cocktail that I would settle for beer at a bar down the road. If I'm paying $12+ per drink, bad service is just something I refuse to tolerate.

Friendly helpful staff.
They helped me plan and design complex patterns, find where the equipment is, gave me advice when asked.
Light to dark rule, three coats, pencil marks burn off in the kiln.
Professional.
Pickup always ready by promise time, never lost or damaged my pieces.
I trust them to handle my carefully painted pieces.
Can take a painting break and go to coldstone nextdoor.
Bathroom is clean and adorably decorated with tiles.

I wish I could be their in house artist!! If only.

The food is beyond exceptional! The steak & sea bass are what we ordered this time, both mouth watering/melt in your mouth awesome! My teenage son who typically just grunts his acceptance of food that is edible, actually rolled his eyes and said, "oh my god". I was scared at first and asked "what?!" Then he said with his mouth full "this is outstanding... So good..." I'm not sure if there are different staff on the days some of these bad reviews were written, but I'm shocked to read that some people actually feel the food is "inedible". The same thing with the service (which was also exceptional). They're probably the people who complain about everything and nothing is ever good enough for them - we all have one of those relatives. I will say that when compared to other higher quality restaurants, it is still priced about 25 to 30 percent higher than it needs to be, but then again so is everything else in Vegas. At least with food this good, you're not kicking yourself afterward. You pay $50 for a buffet of just regular food, you tend to be grumpy or even regretful. You pay $50 for a steak that is mind blowing, and suddenly it's not that bad. Especially when the staff are SOOOO friendly and totally go above and beyond. I never had to look for our server once! He was all over it, every step of the meal. He sensed my son was struggling with the menu and came over to explain what things were. My son was almost finished with his soda and our server was at the table with a refill before my son took his last sip. My son actually said "woah!" I've never seen a server anticipate every need of a diner before, quite impressive.  It was an excellent experience that I thoroughly enjoyed and will go again when back in town.

My husband recently got his wisdom tooth removed. The office staff and Dr. Loud were very friendly and answered all of his concerns. This office was recommended by our dental office, North Scottsdale Dental. After we finish up there, my husband will be coming back to have his other wisdom teeth removed. Thanks for the great service guys!

The hours say that this store opens at 7:30. It is now 8 o'clock and still the gates are all locked up and lights are off. I called their phone number and I got an answering machine. They should change their posted hours or make sure they have employees that come in on time.
The food and service were great, if you want a good breakfast with thick bacon this is the place.
If you love people hanging around entrance smoking and blocking the door than this is the place for you. Dirty and dingy inside and out with a broken stucco wall by front door. Friendly staff though.

Great place for lunch specials. Prices range from 7.95-10.95 depending on meat of choice. 

On this lunch occasion, we ordered the Spicy Basil dish with chicken and the Red curry with chicken - both medium spicy level. Lunch special comes with soup, egg roll, and some crunch thing (sorry, no clue what it's called- check out my pic for actual item). Both dishes were tasty & spiciness just right. Entire order was just under $20.00

This location is on rainbow & warm springs. Warning - they can get pretty bush during lunch. However, our wait staff for this visit was quite attentive. Overall great lunch date & for sure we will be making a repeat visit! :)
I love this place but you'll most likely need to call ahead a reserve a table. It's busy. Probably my favorite sushi in town.

Got Sick

Just like Daniela A, two in our group on 04/12 got really sick. 

I know another group of people that went on 04/16 and one of their party got sick.

This kitchen might be dishing out food poisoning on a regular basis.

Butters Pancakes? Instantly, I pulled up my Cardiologist's phone number just in case! Now this was a classic bookmarked place on Yelp that I finally got around to visiting. We had a slight wait of 15 minutes, which isn't bad at all with the amount of people waiting. Things I loved:

1. Orange Juice - Very fresh and would be even better with some Kettle One
2. Food - Had the breakfast burrito w/ chorizo (checked again to make sure my doc was on speed dial) Very good with the somewhat crispy butter potato hashbrowns. 
3. Service - This place would have totally gotten 5 stars if it wasn't for the odd service. One of the people we went with received his order, but there was an extra egg (he didn't even notice until she came over). She had the cojones to take his plate away well after he started eating because it was meant for another table. She didn't apologize and actually made him feel like it was his fault. He stopped her saying he had already started eating and it was too late. Very odd to say the least.

Overall, we had a good experience and will possibly try it again when we're in the area. Maybe sneak in some Kettle One! Shit, why do I always show my hand! Catholic guilt.

Such a great spot! My boyfriend does not like vegan food but I was able to convince him to come eat with me here and he fell in LOVE! He told me that he's been craving a good taco for weeks and was so surprised that a vegan taco from here more than satisfied he's craving! Gotta say that the sopes are heaven! Haven't had sopes in so long and I finally got the chance to enjoy delicious vegan Mexican food:) Cant wait to be back!

So after over a year this place is back on my go to spot for amazing drinks in the cozy lounge area,"! This place went thru a management and team chance and it improved a lot! Service was outstanding, the food, drinks and desserts were delicious! Had the steak wrap with sweet potato fries and side salad and everything was cooked to perfection and pipping hot! We did not wait at all to be seated as it happened in the past! Will definitely return!!

Great food. We've been to a bunch of Cuban restaurants in the past from Colorado to Florida and I would say that this one rates up there with the Miami Cuban places. Food was delicious and the price was great. I had the Sample Plate and it did not disappoint. My wife had the Carne con Papas and the meat was so moist and tasty. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for good meal off the strip.

I'm in town to visit family and my 3-year-old really needed a haircut. I was lucky to find this salon nearby. I usually take my son to another kiddie salon back home, but this one definitely invested in its perks for their little customers. My son loves that his station had its own TV (as each one does) and that he could pick out a movie to watch from a current collection. This allowed his stylist to take her time since he was so distracted by the movie. The stylist was fantastic and really understood what I wanted for his hair.

But this salon really gets 5 stars for what I witnessed as they interacted with another customer. A boy came in with his father. He seemed nervous. But the staff greeted him so warmly and by name, so I realized he was a regular customer. As two stylists spoke to him and reassured him, I soon realized he was a special needs child. His father sat back in a chair next to him as the stylists worked to make the boy feel comfortable, safe and loved. They sought consent from him, they were affectionate and incredibly patient as he squirmed around. I was so touched by the attention they gave to him to ensure he had a great haircut and a pleasant experience. I will return to this salon every time I come back into town for this level of service alone.

Yesterday, I was planning on meeting a friend at the AMC Theater to see the 12:30 showing of Spider-Man.  I was looking for some place nearby to meet for lunch that offered some healthy menu selections.  After looking at the Planet Sub menu online, I knew this was the place.  Being the miser that I am, I looked online for coupons and ended up purchasing a GroupOn deal for $9 to get $15 worth of food.  I ordered the Greek Chicken Wrap and asked that they serve that as a Romaine Wrap.  My friend ordered a half sub; we both got regular sized drinks.  Our total bill came to about $18 so we had to pay just $3.00.  The food was delicious!  The unsweetened iced tea was a bit weak but nonetheless good.  The service was exceptional . . . a very enthusiastic team who acknowledged us the moment we walked in and bid us a fond farewell. I definitely will go back.  In fact, if they were closer to my house I would have gone there for lunch today.

What a great find!  If you plan to travel to Las Vegas, do not miss visiting The Barrymore.  Without a doubt, it was the best meal we had in Las Vegas (after dining at numerous high end spots in The Palazzo and the Venician).  Service was attentive and friendly and the food absolutely delicious at 1/3 the cost of the fancier spots on the Strip.  The setting (a bit campy in the Royal Resort) only adds to the allure of the restaurant.  My husband had the burger and I had the short ribs and both were superb.

Excellent food, excellent service and nice ambience. We went there on a Thursday night and the restaurant was consistently full the time we are there. Definitely check out if you love Thai. Green curry is amazing!

Awesome, delicious food!  My favorite place to eat when I have the money.  Love the cajun popcorn and the dinner specials.  If they ever have the mahi-mahi as a special, get that! So good, I wanted to cry! Also ask your server about the ghost.  I heard some cool stories!

The food was mediocre. The shrimp in my cocktail was stiff and rubbery, and the margarita I ordered was more ice and salt than alcohol.I would have settled for fast food instead. The atmosphere is nice and inviting, and the staff are courteous, but take a while to get to you after initially ordering.

I really, really love this place. The food was superb and every single member of the staff was just so friendly and engaging.

Our bartender Bretton was attentive and very good looking (that never hurts). He made a perfect martini and a excellent wine recommendation.

We tried the hushpuppies they were delicious..so much so, we split (we were on our way to a catered party) the Pork Shoulder entree and it was wonderful. The owner was very personable and passionate about food and it shows.

I am not sure how this gem escaped me for 9 months. Don't be like me...go NOW.

Environment: The store is small with simple design, honestly I would not walk in if I didn't see the good review on yelp, I guess you can't judge the book by its cover.

The only thing I don't like was the cash only policy, I drove to ATM first before I went.

Donuts: the options are nice, you need to be there early enough to see the everything they have. The donut with cinnamon on top and the one with custard were bomb!

Prices: the prices are awesome, I ordered a dozen of donuts and it's only $12, my coworkers they loved it and asked me where I bought it.
Amazing! Extremely friendly staff. The chicken curry, naan, sweet red honey balls and bread pudding were incredible.
Outstanding tour, excellent food. Lots of history. Personable tour guide Darren who was born and raised here. Our 13 year old liked it as much as we did. Very well done.

The food is good and they serve big portions! Chicken is very flavorful. I didn't give it a 5 because of the bad service. Took 10 minutes for a server to even stop by our table to take our drink order.

Service is friendly and welcoming.  Food is great.  The rice is very traditional and yummy! 

Hubby and the kids had the fry bread and said it was great! I had the tacos and rice.  Super great.  Definitely stop by again.

Even though we had PRE-PAID rooms, when we arrived late they had sold out our rooms.  Not just a reserved room, but we had PAID for it.  So they basically collected twice.  Then sent us to some sketchy place in a terrible neighborhood instead.  After traveling all day, last thing we needed was another 1-2 hours of finding a place to sleep, or a crappy neighborhood to deal with.

Once we moved back here it was alright.  The place is reasonably clean and nice appointed.  Hot breakfast was good.

Best burger and beer in the area. On top of that everything on the menu is delicious and you can always try something new on their daily specials menu. The staff is incredibly friendly and they know their product forwards and backwards. With an awesome craft brew selection that accommodates all tastes, I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

It's been about 3yrs since we last came to Sushi-ko. Came here tonight for their teppanyaki. 5:25pm and the place is already getting crowded. The place looks the same, just like I remembered it. We were led into one of the teppanyaki tables by a very cheerful man named Sammy. He is an awesome server by the way. Our orders were taken and we waited for about 30mins for our other table mates. 

We started with fried calamari then the hubby and I ordered the NY steak and shrimps with fried rice, the kiddo asked for the NY steak with yakisoba. The meal came with a small salad, miso soup and a choice of either soda, sake or sake cocktail. The cocktail was refreshing. The salad was good and so was the miso soup. My steak was cooked a perfect medium rare. It was so tender. The shrimps were slightly over cooked but still pretty good, the veggies were yummy and the fried rice was supposedly "so much better than my version" according to my kiddo who ate most of my rice. She didn't like her yakisoba much,  it was a little too sweet for her taste. There was so much food we took our leftovers home. The calamari was good too, the batter not too thick.

Our chef tonight was chef Eric. We all loved  his cooking and his show. He was very easy to talk to as well.

I do not get the negative reviews about this place. Service was top notch even though they were busy, food was good, the place looked clean. We all decided to give them a 4.5. Deducted half a point because of the wait time.

We will be back to sample their sushi and sashimi.
Very relaxing and chill atmosphere. We came here for a birthday party (party of 12) ,and they were very accommodating. They serve chips and salsa before you order. Check in for a free Margarita!

Amazeballs!  This place definitely lives up to the hype!  The syrups aren't too sweet and although it can be a little overwhelming I appreciate the large variety of flavors.  I usually order a kid's size (get it stuffed with vanilla ice cream, yum!!) and they've never made me feel like a cheapskate.  We've been a few times now and each time the wait was short to moderate, even on a Saturday evening (though a long wait would be totally worth it).  They even have a rewards program so make sure to give them a phone number!

I only eat doughnuts maybe once a year, so I am not an expert on the subject. I do usually go to Dunkin Donuts though when I do get doughnuts and they are pretty damn good there IMO. That being said, I will go ahead with my review.

We arrived at ACE around 5:15am. The lady was fill the display cases from racks that had doughnuts on them and they were covered, as to suggest they were from the day prior. I also noticed when I walked in that it did not smell like anything was being baked at the moment. I was expecting to see fresh made doughnuts after reading all of the great reviews.

Anyway, we got the giant apple filled bear claw, apple fritter, blueberry fritter, chocolate cronut. And a few other. I only tried the fritters, bear claw, and cronut. I was not trying to gain 5 lbs and try everything there. The Apple bear claw was good, as well as the fritters. Like I said earlier, they did not taste like they were just made. I personally did not care for the cronut, but I don't really care for croissants. I'm sure it was good if you like them.

Bottom line: This place has good doughnuts, but I still like Dunkin Donuts better. I would recommend you stop by and judge for yourself.

Yum! Loved it! Veggie restaurants always run the risk being... boring? Not the case with Green. Stopped in for lunch with some friends and I was not disappointed.

There's a small parking lot shared with Nami. You can also park around the perimeter of the building in different marked spots. The restaurant is modern and simple and comfortable.

Lots of different wines and beers available, and I would have loved to have one, but I opted for one of many different healthy flavored water drinks in the fridge by the counter. I had the Thai peanut bowl with house tofu and noodles. Sauce was spicy and delish; noodles were cooked well, and there were nice big pieces of fresh broccoli and carrots alongside perfectly done tofu. It was filling and yummy, and I did not feel depressed (from grease and calories) after eating it.

The big wac really does taste like a big mac. It looks beautiful - the way you'd hope a big mac would look, and it tastes awesome. Calexico burger was pretty good. Cole slaw is really fresh, really good, and the fries are amazing. I could eat the fries all day, every day.

I will be back! Even if you're not huge on veggie only food, this place is worth a try. If you like tofu, definitely stop in. Faux meats taste really close to real meat so again, give it a go!
Sloooooooooow and rude - took over 20 minutes after I ordered to get my drink ... they should really look at improving their wait times and get more intelligent people working there.

What can I say amazing food and great service! Thank you Turmeric and staff for the most enjoyable evening! The spices were so authentic that it brought me to another place in my head! Loved it! The drinks menu looks fabulous I must try it soon! I'm a local so I will be back soon!

This was my first time going here and it was outstanding. The people were great Lauren was my waitress and she was so cool.  This lounge was very clean, and later back. It was a great experience and I the music was real nice they played all types of different music I will be back there when I come back to Las Vegas.

Four of us had Shoyu ramen,  Tonkotsu ramen, Udon and Shrimp Udon. The broth was all very good but on the strong side. Ive had better, but many worse in Tokyo.  I give their food 4 stars. Cleanliness is at 2 stars. Young workers tend not to care about that, i guess.  Ambience - perfect for college kids.

Got my very first tattoo done today! After extensive research I picked Chronic Ink as the place. And didn't regret my choice! They made me feel welcome, everybody was very friendly and the shop is clean and very welcoming! Tommy did my tattoo and he was amazing! Very attentive and made sure it was exactly as I pictured it. LOVE my tattoo!
If I'll ever do another one that's the place to go!
My favorite place for takeout! They always offer us free soup while we wait. Amazing staff. Food is delicious and fairly priced. Love this place!!!!

The food is pretty good, if not slightly bland. When it's busy, the service is slower than anything I've been subjected to recently. It took almost 55 minutes from the time we were seated to have our order taken.
Very friendly staff and quick service. Good prices. All-dressed pizza was delicious but I would have liked to see more toppings! Fries were crispy and mouth-watering. Excellent go-to place for pizza!
Great food! Quick and healthy! Always a good choice for taste and quality lunch or dinner!

Driving from Oshawa to Markham, the Mrs. and I were hungry. Found this cute little Italian deli on the way so we decided to stop. 

First impression was that the place is relatively new and super clean. Good design all around with a red and white theme throughout. 

Seat for approximately 12. Two counters. One featuring hot food and the other scrumptious looking desserts. 

Hot food includes lasagne, veggies, rice balls, sausage, Alfredo and a bunch of other yummy looking food. 

We ordered the lasagne and rice ball. The lasagne was excellent. Beef with about 12 layers of pasta, cheese and sauce. It really tasted homemade. The rice ball was also fantastic. Excellent texture served at the right temperature. 

The staff were friendly and helpful informing us that there was no soup on our visit and that pizza was only available in the evenings (just a heads up). 

All in all a great eating experience. 

Bon appetite.

What a pleasant surprise.   Today  STEVE came to my home on time He found the problem with the garbage disposal and replaced it quickly; leaving no mess.  Steve is very polite and will always be my go to person.  We highly  recommend him.  A great  REPRESENTATIVE of his trade..
Thank you Steve.

Excellent food in a relaxing casual environment. Staff is very friendly. 

They really do have some of the best food. Very flavorful and cooked right.

***WARNING*** - LIKELY SCAM ARTIST

Unfortunately, I received a coupon IN the mail for this dentist's office promising an exam, x-rays, and cleaning for $69.  That sounded like a good deal and I was due for a cleaning, so I made an appointment.  Upon entering the office, I was taken promptly to my exam area.  A staff member proceeded to take x-rays and pictures.  She seemed completely inexperienced.  The X-rays hurt quite bad, and I have never experienced pain from x rays before.  She then took high definition pictures of my teeth, and placed a monitor right in front of my face so that I could see the pictures.  As a I later realized, that was likely a marketing technique.  My teeth (and yours also most likely) do not look pretty that close up, and those images would provide an opportunity for Dr. Abedi to "improve" my smile.  

So, after shes done taking the pictures and x-rays, Dr. Abedi comes in.  He spend maybe 5-10 minutes examining my teeth.  He then says they cannot do a cleaning because I need a deep cleaning in my entire mouth.  He said he will give me a "discount" of 20% (what kind of dentist gives discounts?) so that the deep cleaning will "only" cost about $900.  I tell him that I want a normal cleaning in accordance with the coupon, but he says that the hygienist is out of the office (why the hell would you schedule an appointment for an exam, x rays, and cleaning when the hygienist is out of the office?).  

Remarkably, he then also claims that I have extremely receding gums and that I NEED about 15 gum grafts, and that, because I do not have insurance, he will lower the cost of EACH GRAFT from $1200 to $980.  So, yes, within 10 minutes of meeting me, he claimed that I needed approximately $15,000 in dental work.  

I was aware I had some gum recession, but had seen many other periodontists and dentists and believed that the recession was not as serious as this Doctor Abedi made it sound.  I made another appointment at a nearby dentist, Avalon Dentistry (I highly recommend them).  Dr. Peifer examined me and told me that I have some recession but am not at any risk of losing functional value of the teeth and that I only need a basic (not deep) cleaning every 6 months.  His office then set me up with a cleaning the very next day, and charged me only $100 for the exam and cleaning, saving me, in essence, $14,900.

The best sushi place in town. I've gone to several but Jjanga is my favorite by far. The prices aren't too expensive and all the sushi rolls taste amazing and looks perfect every single time. And there's more than just sushi too. Try the desserts; the mochi is very delicious.

I came here with my co-workers to celebrate an uneventful Black Friday. The interior looked inviting. I had a Rickard's Red ($6) and the shepherd's pie ($12). I was quite disappointed. The shepherd's pie was essentially hamburger helper underneath baked potato scraps. The price is too high for the quality.

This local tapas bar, emphasis on bar, is located near the South Point on Southern Highlands Parkway.  We were started off with a plate of grilled bread, hummus and an addictive, though spicy, garlic cream cheese spread (2.5 Forks).  Our first order was pan fried dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon with a wine reduction sauce and blue cheese (3.5) and quesa fundido, baked cheese in a roasted pepper and tomato sauce (2.5).  We then shared an entrée of paella which was mediocre due to the absence of saffron, a good seafood broth and chorizo (2).  We concluded the meal by sharing a delicious flan (4).

I just recently started to go here and the staff is very friendly and are always very helpful and nice. The doctors are top notch and always do a great job I have felt much better since starting there my lower back pain is gone down significantly and I'm back to running and exercising. Thanks for all you do you are a great clinic and worth every cent and there cash plans are very reasonable.

I'm sorry to hear that Norma (the reviewer below) had a negative experience. I also found Carefree Moving online and read some reviews before making up my mind. They moved me yesterday (Aug 28) without any issues whatsoever.

2 guys arrived at 4pm as promised. I signed the contract and they promptly started loading stuff into the truck after doing the initial inspection to determine the quantity of stuff and what needs to go first in the truck. The guys spoke Russian and because I also speak Russian, there was zero language barrier for me personally. I can't vouch for their English language skills, so your experience might be different than mine. They had plenty of blankets in which they wrapped a painting, a glass table and a mirror. The move from 1 bedroom to another 1 bedroom within a 2KM radius took 2 hours and 30 minutes. They offer a very competitive rate of $55/hour and they charge a fixed $95 fee for transportation, meaning you pay for the time and gas they spend to get to your place and from your place back to the office/warehouse. So, I was charged $55 x 2.5 + $95 (fixed transportation fee). The guys had a spacious truck, no more than 5 years old.

Most other moving companies either have a 4-hour minimum at $70+/hr or charge a lot per hour. These guys are priced very competitively with no minimums. Most other companies I called (and I called over 10 companies in Toronto) were quoting me anywhere from $250 to $600 for just 2 hours of work, due to 3-4 hour minimums, compounded by rather high initial fixed fees that cover transportation expenses.

I cannot guarantee that your experience will be smooth. Some people are really picky, sometimes unreasonably so, but if you want people will do the job at a reasonable rate, Carefree Moving is a good option to consider.

I looooveee shuseki!    The variety is ample.  The atmosphere is casual.  My daughter loves coming here.  She loves the tamago omelet, and chicken karaage, and ume musubi (onigiri).  I love the grilled onigiri, the spicy tuna sushi, the pickled veggies, asparagus bacon.
Great spot.  And open late.
Delicious!  Best phillysteak EVER!  Good was easy to order and quick with great service as well. Will definitely be coming back!

The food is wonderful and I feel good eating it. It is also fast and affordable! I've had them heat food for me to enjoy immediately and also carried out food straight from the cooler to serve at home.

Why do I keep coming back to the place? Probably because it's open late and it's in close proximity to the strip. My friend asked our Uber driver to drop us off at the address we listed, he guessed it was Pho Kim Long because that's where everyone goes after a night of clubbing. We were there at 3am with a group of six and it took us a while to get seated. The broth is A-Okay, noodles and meat were standard. I feel like the pho here is just average, but it's the perfect way to end a long night of clubbing on the strip.

I've been wanting to pay a visit to Verde for a long while now, and I finally had the opportunity to do so for a (pre-) Valentine's dinner last night, when CM and I were in the vicinity for a make-it-now event across the street at the Pittsburgh Glass Center. Never having tried "modern American Mexican" before, I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but I was quite favorably impressed with the flavors and preparation.

Because I'd heard so much about the tequila selection, CM and I started off by ordering the featured tequila sampler of the week--tres generaciones ($8)--which consisted of shots of blanco, reposado, and anejo tequilas, as well as sangria.  Despite that these were tequila shots, CM and I split them, and I'm glad that we did, given their strength!  Even the first one (blanco) was stronger than I expected, and CM felt quite tipsy after downing the remainder of the second one (reposado) after I took a sip.  While all of them were good, my favorite was the third (anejo), due to the complexity and depth of its flavor.  Even the sangria was delicious and well-balanced, making for a great palate cleanser.

As our appetizer, CM and I split an order of chips and salsa with the trio of salsas, which consisted of salsa roja, salsa verde, and pico de gallo ($8).  The red and green salsas were addictive, to the point that I kept munching on them throughout--and after--the meal.  While the pico was fresh, it wasn't as flavorful or complex as the other salsas, but it certainly wasn't bad, either.  The chips were quite good in their own right, too.  This would definitely make a great appetizer to munch on for people just coming for a drink, as well.

For our entree, CM and I split the family style tacos ($29), which comes with ingredients for six tacos. We chose pescado and carnitas as our proteins and a mix of corn and flour tortillas.  All of the ingredients were fresh and delicious, with a great blend of flavors.  I preferred the fish slightly due to its crisp exterior and light and flaky interior, but the carnitas were pretty good, as well.  I was also pleased with the veggies and beans and rice that came with it, which were cooked well.  The only thing that surprised me was that some of the usual accoutrements for tacos (cheese, sour cream, guac, salsa, etc.) were missing.  This wasn't too much of a problem, though, since the ingredients of the tacos stood on their own, and I was able to add some of the salsas that came with the chips to them.  The only thing that struck me as strange was the spiciness of my first taco, but this turned out to be my own fault, due to having added too much Tabasco sauce (my other tacos, which I didn't add Tabasco to, didn't have this problem!).

My only substantive criticism is that the service wasn't very attentive, esp. after our food was delivered.  Our waitress didn't come by for at least half an hour after that to ask how the food was or fill our waters.  Several more parties did come in around that time, so she was likely busy attending to them, but it certainly would have been nice not to have to refill my own water glass (luckily, the pitcher was located right next to our table).

Overall, I was quite pleased with my (pre-) Valentine's Day meal at Verde.  Sure, it's not the most "authentic" Mexican food in PGH (if you're seeking authentic, I'd recommend Casa Reyna or La Palapa), but it's excellent fusion cuisine.  I'd definitely return for the delicious, creative food and classy atmosphere--and to try some of their other drinks, such as a margarita, my favorite tequila-based cocktail!
