She recommended him and said he did her friend's hair amazingly crazy and cool.  I decided to give it a try, considering I didn't have a normal stylist of my own.

I was pleasantly surprised!  Immediately upon coming in I noticed the stellar artwork on the walls (they used to participate in First Fridays), the vibin' music, and the offering of beer or wine to drink!  WHAT!?  

Michael was super friendly, listened to my wants and needs, and is easy to get a long with.  He is worldly as a person and has a crazy story for everything.  He also enjoys good music similar in taste to my own, so it made for nice conversation throughout the appointment.

Michael is amazing at cutting hair, especially if you like short, layered, or textured hairdos.  He does an awesome job with funky color combos as well.  

Overall, 5 star rating for this place.  It may be slightly expensive compared to other salons, but the service, quality, and overall experience are well worth the price.

One of the best Happy Hour locations in Las Vegas! They begin your visit with some of the most delicious bread appetizer which I loved and I'm not a bread eater! 
We sampled most of the menu, which was quite extensive. The meatballs were juicy and perfectly cooked. The mussels were sweet and tender. The steak quesadilla was super tasty and extra cheesy; exactly how I like it! The nachos were good, but I didn't like the bbq sauce idea on the nachos but my husband really loved that flavor blend. The calamari had a great spicy tang and tasted really fresh. The firecracker shrimp were tasty, but the sauce became overwhelming; I'd prefer the sauce as a dip! The jalapeño crunch burger was super tasty  and perfectly executed flavors and appearance!

The food is delicious and authentic Taiwan styles.  Black paper Sauteed Beef Steak was amazing and comes with salad and garlic bread. Seafood & Tofu pot is one of my favorite and with 10 choices and selections in hot pots.

This past weekend I was in Peoria for an event and decided to check out the Hobby Lobby. As usual, I went crazy and bought a ton of cool stuff.  My receipt seemed a bit high but I had too many things to audit my purchase at the time.  Once I got home and went through my items I realized I was overcharged by $15.  I called the store and was told I would have to bag all my items up and come back to the store and they would "review the cameras".  One of my Christmas items (supposed to be 50% off) was labeled "Sewing", so it was not discounted. And the other error was that I bought Two $5 items and was charged for THREE. Since I'm unable to gather all the items (which are now wrapped or displayed) and I don't have time to drive 30 min. each way I am out $15. (She also told me I could NOT go to a closer Hobby Lobby to get a refund).  REVIEW YOUR RECEPT BEFORE LEAVING THE STORE!
If you are in to organic food or a vegetarian this will be your new spot.

Je suis du genre à laisser la chance au coureur, un nouveau restaurant ne peut pas être parfait, n'est-ce pas ? 

Nous nous sommes installés à l'intérieur et avons regardé le menu qui comportait peu d'options, donc quelques unes qui n'étaient pas disponibles. Nous avons donc opté pour 2 bières en bouteille et 2 soupes au porc. Le bouillon était bon, mais peu '' onctueux '' comme on peut retrouver ailleurs. En général, j'aime la différence, mais malheureusement, le goût était plutôt absent. Les nouilles étaient comme je l'aime, c'est-à-dire pas trop molles. Le porc était bien cuit et pas trop gras.

Le prix était.. correct pour un ramen, soit une quinzaine de dollars.
Excellent staff and the dentist was a real cool guy. Have been to other dentists that try to sell you services you don't need and got none of that here. Will be back.
Came here for a birthday party. Good vibe. Food was okay. I had duck and pineapple and it was good but portions are smaller. I don't think I would go out of my way to go there.
This place is awesome, fast service, great seafood and family friendly! The wait is sometimes longer then expected but worth it. Oysters and shrimp are a must

My partner and I had heard about FEZ from all our queer friends in Phoenix, and so we jumped at the chance to check it out when our friends wanted to go there.

Despite getting there around 7pm on a Saturday evening, they were able to put us on the heated patio with only a short wait.  It was fine with a coat, but I wouldn't suggest it otherwise. I'm guessing in the summer they have misters.

It started off well.  Most of us got iced teas, and some of us ordered starters.  My partner and I got a half/half basket of sweet potato fries/garlic rosemary fries.  The garlic ones were good, as were the sweet potatoes ones, but they were a bit too sugary to start the meal out with.

From there, the food stayed tasty, but the service went down hill.  It took a while for the extra ketchup to come out, and when it finally did, 3 main courses were brought out (for a table of 7).  Another seven minute later, 3 more courses came out.  People were polite, but after another five minutes, I told everyone to dig in. I desperately tried to find out server, but to no avail.  When I finally did (when the rest of the table was half way done -- she never even came back for a "how is everything" check to note that my veggie burger hadn't come out). When I finally caught her, she told me it was right there on the counter, and she just needed to grab it.  However, it took another 5-7 minutes for it to come out.

Then, she never did a taste check.  She filled someone's water glass with iced tea, took it and the tea pitcher away to fix it, and left 3 of us with empty iced tea glasses till the end of the meal.  She brought one less box then asked for, and it took another 10 minutes to get the extra box.

Of course, since we were a group, the 20% gratuity was included. I don't know if she was new, or just knew she didn't have to worry about the tip, but I was far under impressed.

However, the excellent food, rocking tunes and cool decor will be enough to get me back in the door again to give it a second chance.

I found this wonderful little restaurant a few months ago and enjoy stopping in when I'm in the area. Their peanut curry is delicious and so are their egg rolls. Service is fast and you can be in and out on a lunch break.

This is such a great place to grab a drink and a bite to eat whilst downtown. The staff couldn't be more friendly and the food has never disappointed. They have great happy hour specials ... My fave is the fish and chips and the pineapple mule drink is delish!
This place is very fast and all the nail techs are very polite.  The place can get very busy, but they have a lot of magazines and the wait is never long.  Very clean.
Really fun time kind of like and I show and dinner and drinks kids dancing on the piano awesome singers recommend this place for a different party
if you miss the fry bread at the az state fair, this is as good if not better

I have always loved this place! It is still delicious as always. Sommas has always been one of my favorite places to eat. I loveee their burgers they are the best. The cheese fries, wings, and pizza are really good as well. Definitely would recommend a stop to sommas!

Sex and Cirque!  What a great idea right! Well the show is very solid. I don't really like stage setup though or the facility that New York New York holds it in. For it be such a small venue the seats feel far back. The performance were good but not amazing like the ones I have seen in other shows. The Hula hoop girl is pretty good though.

Went to get bubble tea at 4pm for its buy one get one free deal. DAMN, i ordered the mango ice cream with tapioca and did they full it to the brim. For bubble tea, its around $6. Its probably worth it with the deal.

I wish I could give less than 1 star to this hotel. When we checked in we were given the room that was not even cleaned by housekeeping and was in the same condition as the last guest checked out. We requested for an upgraded room and according to them it was remodeled and non smoking but it smelled of cigarettes. Not just the room the whole lobby on the floor was smelling the same. We decided to checkout the next day; cancelling our reservation for the rest of the days. We were told by the hotel staff that our reservation money would be refunded but later they disagreed to refund it. I would highly recommend paying more money and staying at some other place. Very disappointed with the service and rooms.

This place is a typical HK style noodle restaurant, they give you a sheet to choose your soup, noodle type and toppings, great for customization! Soup bases are pretty good, and there's a large variety of toppings, which are all quite decent. It's similar to Deer Garden.

They also have this "submarine rice" which is a huge platter of rice inside a piece of bread. It's a great deal if you want to load up on carbs. It's good, but I don't think I'd ever eat that one again.

They also have "old school" milk tea which is unique, but I wouldn't say it's overly special.

I just happened on this place. It has the best hummus and the owners are really nice and down to earth. The eggplant and other salads were also great (they also have red and green spicy sauces that are tasty).

Hand down, the best food I've had in Canada (other than Tim Hortons of course).

The service was incredible. The wine selection was great and well priced. The food was tremendous. This was a fine dining experience that should cost a lot more than it does. We loved everything single thing we ate.

GREAT breakfast!

Not that far from the Rio Casino where I was staying.

Well worth the trip.

Lindsey was a good server, very attentive and quick.
They have very inexpensive food however sometimes the produce doesn't look as fresh as it should.

I went here today, because I really didn't feel like driving far to get some Japanese food. I haven't been here, until today's visit and was pleasantly surprised.
It's located in a strip mall, at the north end and a liquor Depot is located adjacent. It's also behind the Esso gas station in Lake Chapparel.
The location itself I believe is a converted pub/sports bar which closed. It's obvious by looking at all the existing televisions in the establishment not reminiscent to a Japanese sushi/restaurant.
My family and I were pleasantly surprised at how inexpensive most things on the menu were. I find when things appear inexpensive, you tend to order more and as a result find the bill a little on the expensive side. (For lunch that is).
We started with a shared appetizer of ginger beef. Not very Japanese, but tasty none the less. We also ordered the beef yakisoba, mango roll, yam tempura, beef yakitori, a bowl of rice, and also a California roll and 4 pieces of Tamago sushi. All of this with green tea for four people came to around $53.00 including tip.
The girl that was waiting on us was very nice, and also good with our children. I know people who have kids, like when wait staff are especially attentive to your kids.
This lunch time was not at all busy. Only one other table was being occupied when we arrived. There was one othe table, a party of 4 that was seated prior to our departure.
They must have been regulars, as the waitress asked where the dad was who showed up a couple minutes later.

I like this place and will definitley come back. The only thing lacking on the menu, may be the fact they haven't got any Ramen noodle dishes. They do have udon noodles though.

Walked in for my friends 30th birthday with a group of 6. We were told a 30 min wait. We got some drinks at the bar and an hour and 45 minutes passes by and we still don't have a table. It was busy. But multiple tables were "reserved"  yet no one came. The table was open the whole time. So we left,  this place is amateur. Go to the local down the street.
Really nice place, lots of seats. Prefer spot to read， wifi is extremely fast. The people are really nice, they give me punch card. Anyway, I definitely gonna go visit again. :)

Originally from San Francisco, came out to Las Vegas needing extensions, a root job and a balayage that had to be done in less than 3 days. I found an add by Arend called him and because of his schedule he couldn't get me in for 3 weeks. I told him my situation and that I was here for an award event and he did his magic and made time for me early the next morning. My hair is so soft and shiny. It's full and textured I truly truly could not be more happy! I booked an appointment with him for every 8 weeks for the next year. Thanks Arend you're a hair GENIUS! -Dr.V
Spectacular Jaeger Schnitzel; we started with a potato (Kartoffel) soup and finished dinner with an apple strudel! Food is superb and there is music on Saturdays. Highly recommended!
Great location and very clean! My nephews hair was made to look so fresh and so clean, I'm so happy with it!

We retired to Phoenix in July 2016 and agreed to a 24 month contract for television and internet at a guaranteed designated price.  In August 2017 our bill went up 10%.  When we contacted Cox we were told that although we signed a 24 month contract, the agreement on internet was only for a 12 month promotion.  We made it clear that such was not communicated to us by the sales staff, and the response was basically "that's not my problem."  We are stuck for the next 12 months, but will be changing service the day our contract ends.  Please DO NOT trust the Cox sales staff and read EVERY line of any contract before you sign.  There are too many options available today to stick with a company that practices deceptive sales tactics.

It's such a great place to walk around and window shop! The stores are varied and I hear Forever 21 will be coming soon!
I enjoy the little grass area and food kiosks in the middle of the square.
Rave is not AMC so know that now and if you have a problem with it, just don't go. But they have better deals that Rave did and I prefer it. It isn't perfect, but what is?
Check their site out for community events such as the Wine Walk and holiday parades!

Great place for a get-together with friends, love the vibe in here.

You really can't go wrong with any of the dishes, but some of my favourite are the sashimi salad, oyster and bibimbap.

Caramel EXPERTS! !! !!!  Hawaiian Salted Caramel!  Before eating the Caramels here I never knew how good Caramel could be! 

How about a Bottle of Wine Dipped in Chocolate! !! !!!

Chocolate in Ballantyne!  As I was walking in I saw Greeting Cards and for a second wondered if I was in the right place!  Then I see the cases of Chocolates and Cookies and cake bites covered in Chocolate and now they have Wine Bottles cover Chocolate!  That is a real bottle of Wine wrapped, dipped in Chocolate and wrapped again. 

My first visit I had a Chai Tea Truffle! This one was very good!  Dark Chocolate Truffle with a Super Dark (bitter maybe 85%) shell and a "Yes I would get it again" delicious filling!  I did not get the names of all of these, though could tell many seasonal flavors like "Spiked Egg Nog" and "Gingerbread".  They will continue to add flavors for different seasons.  Hot Pepper infused Chocolate Truffles, last week was Hot Tamale, this week Habenero, both Fantastic!

The Staff are very friendly, a pleasure to talk with.  They are serious about Chocolates and service and very open to ideas.  The Owner works here and is committed to making everything as excellent as they can!  

Cookies dipped in Chocolate, Cake Bites (one called Wedding Cake), Coffee, Hot Chocolate includes House made Marshmallows, Coffee, and Truffles all made in House!  The Greeting Cards are the more unique variety and made locally!

Though this is not a coffee shop the Owner has some great ideas for a unique cup of coffee!

2-14-2013

Best Red Velvet Cake!!!  Cake Bite wrapped in White "Chocolate" and the Macaroon Version!!!  Until now I never knew how Fantastic Red Velvet could taste!

Update: went to nektar again the other day (hoping they'd prove me wrong about their customer service skills) and I probably stood in front of the register for about 10 minutes while 2 girls behind the counter talked and completely ignored me. Not even so much as a "we'll be with you in a moment." Just pretended I wasn't there.

First of all, I do not like gelato. I've even had it straight from Italy, still wasn't a fan. But OMG, this place was YUMMMMMMMY! 

1. It's on a stick. Food on a stick is always better.
2. It has toppings. Toppings I like.
3. Chocolate and toppings designs were classy. Better to eat you with my dear.

Gelato is so much healthier than regular ice cream they say. Well for the first time in forever, I believe it. Now you should believe me and check this place out.

Finally! Our search for great, fast, authentic Greek is over! We had the hummus with gyros & chicken with more than enough soft, warm pita bread; not over salted, and just enough bite to clear your sinus'. You won't regret it!

Great food for both lunch and dinner! The buffet they have for lunch has something for everyone, while the dinner menu has some great choices. The staff and owners are super friendly, which is a bonus! The food tastes great...try the mango shake...beautiful color and tastes delicious! I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Being the curious person, always asking why, why and why, I've had over hundred readings in the past 16 years with many many psychics all over the nation.  I will say Kim Reichardt is the best ever!!!!

She can see clearly what is going on right now, project far far into the future, see all the possible outcomes and will help you find the best solution pulled from source.

She has helped me see negative situations in my life from a higher perspective, helping me really understand why these things were happening and that these situations were actually opportunities and gifts.

Kim helped me see clearly that I am a blessed person rather than a victim.

She is straight forward and has never sugar coated anything but has always been so so so compassionate and caring.

I feel truly so blessed to have Kim in my life.

I debated on reviewing this place after my initial visit and thought it wasn't worth it. About 7 months later I had an experience with them again and realized my initial suspicions about them were correct. 

Last year I was diagnosed with cancer in my neck & the surgeon who did my biopsy referred me to this place kind of out of nowhere. I had gone to see him on a Thursday for a follow-up (for what was most likely going to be the last time for awhile) & that Monday I was set to start chemotherapy. He thought it was a good idea to see an ENT thinking maybe they could add something to my diagnosis and/or treatment. I thought it was odd to do this so last minute (If I wasn't able to see the ENT the next day...which I was, I even asked my surgeon if he thought I should delay chemo until after I saw the ENT, but he didn't think that was necessary). He was pretty insistent that I go to THIS ENT office. My dad had just got done seeing an ENT for a throat condition, which he (and I) really liked, but my surgeon said he "never heard of him" and REALLY wanted me to go to this office (I looked up info on then ENT my dad saw and he has a very good reputation).

I saw Dr. Bailey the following morning. Honestly, I thought he was a good doctor based on the initial exam I had with him. He was thorough & very personable. Since my appointment was scheduled so quickly he didn't have a whole lot of information going in and said he would consult my surgeon and get back to me. I never heard from his office again, but honestly, I didn't think much of it. I was starting chemo and was focused on that. Unless one of my doctors felt it was absolutely necessary to have an ENT involved with my treatment I was fine with never dealing with this office again (not because of Dr. Bailey, like I said, he seemed good) but I already had enough going on with chemo & eventually radiation. 

That being said, I thought the manner in which I was scheduled to come into this office in the first place (and then never hearing from them again) was kind of tacky & it came across like they were just looking for any reason out there to bring in patients (I also understand that my surgeon also shares some responsibility here).

Well, with chemo & radiation complete I recently had a follow-up with my oncologist and he asked about all the doctors I had seen throughout this whole ordeal. He brought up Dr. Bailey (along with my other doctors), and at first I couldn't even remember who that was since I had only seen him the one time. When I said I only saw him once and that was before I started chemo, my oncologist said since technically I DID see him the one time during this whole process he would fax him my latest report (along with all my other doctors). 

Yesterday I get a phone call from Entegrity saying my oncologist wanted me to come into their office for a follow-up. I thought this was odd since he never mentioned this to me at my last visit (or called me afterwards to tell me this) so I told them I wanted to contact my oncologist's office before scheduling anything (and find out WHY he would want me to schedule something with an ENT). It turns out that he simply faxed them my report (like he said he was going to do), but never mentioned anything about coming back to them for a follow-up. My oncologist's assistant also seemed confused as to why this office wanted me to come back in after 7 months. If the ENT thought there was a reason to come back in based on my oncologist's report that's one thing, but to say my oncologist asked them to schedule me when he didn't is tacky.

All this just confirmed my initial thoughts that this office comes across desperate for patients. Like I said, I thought Dr. Bailey was good based on my brief encounter with him (which is why I'm willing to give this place a 2nd star). However, I would never come back here...

Horrible, Horrible, Horrible. Did I say Horrible? Here's my experience ... my wife lost her father and brother a year ago ... their voicemails and pictures were all on my wife's cell phone. We told the repair technician what was happening, and the concern with the data we really needed that was on her IPhone 6. The technician ran a quick test on it and said "I'm sorry to say it's not the battery, the motherboard is fried and there's nothing that can be done." She proceeded to say she could help us get the phone to a data recovery company in California that Apple partners with, but the cost would range from $500-$1,000 for the data recovery. Ultimately, she said the only option with walking out of the store with a working phone is to purchase a new IPhone 8, which we did for $800.00. The girl who sold us the phone was very friendly, and none of this was her fault. Just to take a chance ... I took the old IPhone to a cell phone repair shop in Chandler. Immediately, upon looking at the phone the person said it's the battery. He never hooked it up or anything, but immediately stated the battery was no good, but I was apprehensive to believe him based on what Apple told me. He said "I'll test a new battery in it and if it doesn't work, there will be no charge." He was testing it for free. The girl at Apple said they could try a new battery, but she was 100% sure it wasn't the battery and we would be charged the new battery price of $100.00 whether it worked or not. And we would basically be throwing $100 away. Well low and behold the new battery fired the phone right up. I was in and out of the cell phone repair shop in less than 10 minutes and the cost was $60. It's two months later and the phone still works like new. Needless to say I took the new phone back to Apple for the refund. Apple is there for one thing and that's to sell new phones .. they have no care to fix your phone if they can sell you a new phone. I decided to give 2 stars because the manager was very friendly when we returned the phone, and the sales girl was nice. I believe this just comes down to Apple technicians being pressured to tell customer their old phones can't be repaired so they can get you for $800-$1000 on a new phone .. it's disappointing.

I currently live here and wish I had never gotten into a lease with these people.  Our water gets shut off probably around every couple of months and that's being generous.  They're constantly turning the water off for the entire complex because some of the apartments are not getting hot water.  The water has been shut off probably around 4-5 times since I have lived here, and I moved in, in May 2011.

During the summer when they shut the water off, there was also no A/C because it's all connected.  There is no running water as I'm writing this review!  I've had to call maintenance 4 times that I can remember since I have lived here.  Once because the doorknob came off the linen closet, twice because the garbage disposal wasn't doing its job and once because the shower head was so rusted that no water would come through it.  Once the lease is up, I'm out of here.

First, this place has a lot of reviews and you may want to just skip this one. Over all this place sucks in my humble opinion. I came here for one thing - seafood! I ended up eating more as I will write about. 

The crab is served all cold. They slice everything in half the long way. To be honest I miss the stone age feeling of ripping the limbs apart and hearing that perfect snap and having the joy of a perfect piece of crab coming out in one piece. Do you know how that perfect crab tastes? You know the natural salty sweetness I am talking about!! The same with those perfect shrimps! Well you won't find them here!!! Oh the horror of it! The crabs were so salty that I even went as far as opening up my Netflix app on my iPhone and was going to cancel taping anymore Deadliest Catch episodes! This seams to be done on purpose. I have NEVER had crab that salty before. Not even at those cheap Chinese restaurants that want you to stop eating were that salty!! What about the shrimp you ask?? Well you should have forgotten about that! It was quite the opposite! No taste at all! Why bother getting cholesterol when there is no taste?!?!?!?

So now out of desperation I decided to try other food. At first glance this place truly has nice food sex appeal. You food lovers know what I mean! When I decided to delve a little more into what there was and how it tasted - ugh! 

They have chicken soup here. If your mama made soup like that - well my advice would be to get a new mama! Next was deep fried chicken which was battered with Matzo of all things. It was not too bad. Then again even Old Country Buffet can make a half way decent piece of deep fried chicken. The seaweed salad was a little on the sweet side but ok. The vegetable rolls were sort of crunchy, oily mush - yuck!!!

Someone wrote nice things about the Black Angus Burger?? Really?? REALLY?? R E A L L Y!!??!!?? You need to come to Buffalo and I can send you to a nice pub that would rock your world if that is how you think! That poor cow died for this! I am guessing it may of had Alzheimers and Mad Cow disease and did not even know it was cattle in the first place.  In case there is a lawyer reading this I AM JOKING! Jeez! 

I just spent $43.23 (w/tax) and am starving! So I went to the salad bar to have Caesar Salad - at least that is what they call it on the name tag. I think I wrote enough for now. Just go somewhere else and spend the money. Either that or put it all on #24 and wish for the best!!!
I love that I can use my favorite gym bag and still be prepared for any diaper changes my daughter may need with the diapees & wipees!

I'm so glad to finally have a Five Guys in my neighborhood!  The employees are always friendly and greet me when I order, and it doesn't usually take long to receive my food.  And, the finally product is fantastic!  Two thumbs up!

I always forget how much more classy Sak' is compared to the other department stores that are in most malls until I step inside a Saks. We don't have a Saks in Utah, so it's always a treat when I go out of town and can browse and shop inside one. Any designer you are looking for, they have a good selection for you to choose from. I was looking at evening gowns for a very high-end gala I'll be attending next month, and the woman who was working in the evening gown section on Saturday morning was extremely helpful and very pleasant. I explained that I needed something very modest because most attendees would be Muslim at the event and I didn't want to offend anyone, as I would already not be wearing a hijab. She showed me all the very flashy dresses that were floor-length and showed me some lovely shrugs that I could pair with them to look stylish and still be modest enough for the crowd I will be around. She chatted with me the phone at her desk rang and we had a lovely time chatting. Great store. Great staff. Great selection.

Look, this place may not have fancy wine that's going to make some snooty wine folks have heart palpitations. If you come here looking for that, you're going to be disappointed...but that'll just mean more for the rest of us!

This place isn't trying to be a winery that makes wines that'll make sommeliers from France and Napa Valley hop on the next plane to Cleveland to see what's in the soil and water on Walker Road. Thank God for that--I've been to those places and they make the wine tasting experience about as fun as legal research! However, their wines have won awards here, and the best part of it is that they've done so without the pretentiousness that often accompanies fine winemaking that can drive down-to-earth folks away from learning more about wine. Instead, this place is trying to be a place that serves up delicious, unique wines in a fun, relaxed environment in which people can come to have fun, kick back, enjoy the beautiful scenery, and relax after a hard week of work...and it does THAT at an award-winning level.

They have a beautiful patio and backyard area that is delightful in the summertime--we had my wife's law school graduation party out there and every single guest had a great time. Like everyone else said, you can bring your own food and enjoy it out in the patio or in the main dining area. Best of all, their prices for just about everything are quite reasonable, and they also have Ladies Night and stuff like that too. If you're looking to have a quiet conversation with someone, it's best to come in the afternoons--the evenings can be pretty jumpin' there!

My BIL (Cyrus N.) in the D.C. area loves their wine and requests that we bring down a few bottles whenever we come to visit, and we gladly do so, because all things Cleveland rock and we're happy to share the goodness all around America. 

If you're looking for recommendations, the best "red' wine is the Blackberry and the best "white" wine is the Niagara. Whenever we bring their wine to a social event, it disappears extremely quickly, even amongst friends who have had their wine before. (It also tends to disappear very quickly when my wife and I purchase it for our own consumption!)

When you're looking to grab a drink after work, give John Christ a try. The wine is so good that you'll come for a glass and leave with a bottle...or maybe even a case!
Not sure I get the negative comments about Brewsters. Staff was friendly and attentive and the food was great.

We have shopped around a lot for a Spa and feel blessed to have found this place!  The owner and and Nick were so pleasant and easy to work with.  We felt so great about the purchase!  We ended up purchasing the Dimension One Amore Bay.  The process was easy and they accommodated us with delivery and set up.  Very down to earth people.  If you want a hot tub / spa this is the place to go if you want a high end product at a reasonable price and great customer service!  

We had went to Desert Springs Hot Tubs in Chandler in the past to look and almost bought there; however they were really rude to my wife, sarcastic, and incredibly pushy.  I would suggest not even giving them thought.  I would go straight to Southwest Spas on Val Vista / Williamsfield.

Soooooo happy we purchased from Southwest Spas!!!!

My partner and I have had breakfast and lunch at El Sol at least 20 times since moving to Arizona two years ago. We typically have Mexican once each weekend, and El Sol gets more of our business than any other place in the valley.

The chips and salsa are almost always excellent, the latter being refreshing with just the right amount of kick. Their shredded beef / machaca is great in any form: burritos, enchiladas, crispy tacos. All great. My partner likes to order shredded beef or carne asada chimichangas made enchilada style, and their red sauce is delicious. I've had the breakfast burrito a couple times, and the other reviews are spot on with their compliments.

The bakery is not to be overlooked. We've tried the empanadas, Bavarian Cream Cones, various cookies and rolls, and everything is fairly good, but the Mexican Wedding Cookies are to die for. When we order a bag to go after lunch, they are usually gone before we get home. By usually I mean always.

Service is friendly and very prompt. The food is the best of its kind in the East Valley and can hold its own against any of the more widely yelped places in Phoenix.

The rooms were appropriate sized and fairly clean.  Room service was slow.  The hotel/casino are not half as fancy as some of the others on the strip but the price was also half that of the other casinos.  Location is easy/convenient.  Would stay there again.

This place was fast and terrible! We as customers don't want to be rushed...
Krystina was very rude. They said it was last call at 10:30pm but closed at 11:00pm

We got to-go boxes and left just to find better service. 
Unfortunate cause the place has potential, management has to get serious with their employees.

Absolutely terrible experience in so many ways 

Fuck you guys

SORRY cOX..But after being told that we have no contracts.. Guess what.. Just went to downgrade my services and was told my a rude representative to read my BILL.. Its in the fine print.. Sure I can cancel for 300.00.. Can they lower my bill NOPE you GOT a CONTRACT..
So whats the difference between DISH and CABLE.. The reps at DISH are professionals..
Universal Pharmacy is not much of a pharmacy. You're more likely to find pharmaceutical products at a convenient store. Their stock looks like it's been there for a few years.

Not our best pizza experience in Madison.  We ordered two large regular crust (which turned out to be thin crust) pizzas; one supreme (or deluxe or combo, whatever they call it) and one half pepperoni/half pepperoni and sausage.  The pepperoni/pepperoni and sausage pizza was OK.  Toppings tasted good, though I wish there was more cheese.  It was also greasy.

As for the supreme, the first thing that I noticed was that the mushrooms they used were canned mushrooms.  I mean, seriously, Why?  Fresh mushrooms are easy to get all year round, so why get them canned?   Later on, I saw their available toppings list and they have both canned AND fresh mushrooms.  I mean, seriously, AGAIN?!  Why give the option?  Just put fresh mushrooms whenever mushrooms are requested (OK, one last time: mushrooms).  Moving on... the supreme was a little better than OK.  One big problem is that with so many toppings on this pizza, lots of grease, and with a thin, but non-cracker, and crust, the pizza just kinda goes... limp.  It was hard to eat without having the toppings fall off.

However, the pizza is actually pretty good the next day cold.  This was one of the better pizzas I've had leftover.  Strangely enough, I probably enjoyed this pizza the next day more than the day we bought it.

My wife and I went in to the dealership about 6pm tonight, looking at a 2016 Honda Pilot, immediately greeted by a friendly salesman who showed us the car as well as helped us take a test drive. Meanwhile before the test drive I had advised to the salesperson that since my wife was pregnant and due any day that we were not going to be purchasing a vehicle till at least December or January time frame. The salesman stated that it was fine that he still wanted to show us the vehicle and take the time with us. When we got back from the test drive. The salesman stated that he wanted to review numbers which sounded great so we proceeded inside to review numbers. As we proceeded in we were followed by a manger of the dealership, as we sat down the salesman started asked some questions and the manager interrupted him and said "when are you looking to purchase" I stated December or January. He states to the salesman in front of us "don't waste your time with these jokes they don't even want to buy a car tonight". So my pregnant wife stands up and walks out. I stated to the manager I came inside to get a price on the vehicle the manager states back to me rudely by saying " well what's the sticker say, 42,000 so that's what you will be paying" no if and or but about it I just stormed out of the building. I will never go back never recommend anyone to go there they were the rudest people I have ever dealt with. This place is the worst. I will buy my Honda somewhere else and never from them.

Since we were staying at the Palazzo, we decided on the Grand Lux for our first dinner stop. The location is very close to the elevators to the rooms, making it a great spot for guests looking for food close by. Grand Lux is the sister restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory except with a fancier interior and ambience. Similarly, expect huge portions.

I ordered the pasta with chicken, mushrooms, and sundried tomatoes. It was decent, but not one of the best pasta dish I've had. It was made a bit too salty, a remark shared by my friend who felt her pasta dish was too salty as well. Nevertheless, it was still a filling meal and  the portions I took to-go became a yummy midnight snack. 

Our waitress was very friendly and energetic. She provided great service as well and definitely made our dining experience better.

I love this place a friend of mine turned me onto laserperfection by Jill about a year ago. I started with under arms and now I am hooked.  She does all of my laser hair removal. She is very friendly and made me feel very comfortable from day one. Prices are affordable and has always worked with my schedule. I definitely recommend her.

Great place! The interior decoration is upscale and classy, they have great portions for lunch and they have very friendly wait staff!

Went here for lunch and the prices are reasonable.  Had the coconut curry mussels which came with bread.  Delicious! great portion as well, enough to let someone taste some, without feeling as if you didn't have a full lunch.  Also tasted the cod and chips which was $16.95 for two pieces.  There was a lot of batter so I'd give that a 3.5 stars.  The chips/fries was awesome though because they were homestyle cut fries.

Overall, great experience for lunch.  Would definitely go back.

I cannot get enough of this place! I'm so happy that there's a New Orleans themed restaurant in the city. I visited with a bunch of my friends for my birthday, and though getting a table for 10 was a bit rough (not a place for big parties) the food was excellent. There were no complaints from anyone and I loved the choices for both food and drink.  I am a hush puppy freak and theirs are delicious accompanied by their special sauce. The "hot rocks" as well as the crunchy shrimp were probably my favorite food. I will be going back just to have drinks and dessert because I was too full to get dessert last time!

I am a business traveler monthly to the Phoenix area and like to explore new restaurants if not too tired. I missed having my husband with me for this gem. Comfortable, casual but upscale. Nice selection of wines by the glass. Perfect if you want to sample a variety of flavors for a meal but not too heavy. I chose a garden salad and half order of bruschetta.  I did the fig & apple and sweet & spicy pepper jam which was excellent. I will be more adventurous next time.  The background music was enjoyable. Inside and patio seating. Definitely worth another visit. Parking was easy, especially compared to Tempe the night before.

Rob came back to our house for the 2nd time and did a really great job.  He is the best.  He was able to get the smell out of a rug that another company had already cleaned and failed at.  He really gets the dirt out.   He also did an extremely thorough job on our large sectional, beat up by 2 dogs (one is a puppy).  We love the sofa and now it looks brand new again. I can see why he has so many positive reviews.
After waiting 40 minutes for delivery, I GET STALE BREAD AND BROWNING LETTUCE?!    This location is ruining Jimmy John's reputation.

...this is my second review of Broadstone after living here 6 months! I must say, no matter the concern, property management always addresses the issues head on! My family loves this place - it's our home away from home. As a hobby/pass-time,  I spend a lot of time shopping apartments and sightseeing, and simply stated, Broadstone is the best! I've traveled throughout the best areas of Europe, Africa, Asia, and of course America, and Broadstone is definitely offering Chandler residents a taste of luxury and convenience that exceeds most others! I'm glad to be here and will definitely be renewing my lease soon! And I must say, nearby apartments can't begin to compare to the lavish amenities here at Broadstone! The pool area is plush and always clean, the waterfalls are relaxing, the landscaping is breathtaking, the cabanas are resort-like, the 2-level gym with outdoor yoga areas definitely exceeds any residential standard, the club house is huge and cozy at the same time, and the outdoor recreational spaces for cooking, games, and dog park are all strategically placed! The property has onsite security, and to top it off its non-smoking! Like is said, come see for yourself, Broadstone is the place to be!

Really wanted sushi and this was the closest place. Seemed like it has just opened, both by the lack of people inside and no reviews. Lots of seating, but only 5 people there when I arrived. Sushi was good, fresh, but nothing to rave about. Service was a bit slow, despite the lack of customers.

Frank... It's not a bar if there is no poker machines... (The Dive Bar excluded.

Barcelona is a great hidden spot in Vegas. It's relaxed, and the sangria is great. Once in after a couple times, the staff knows you by name, and  the food is nothing but amazing. It's great to have such quality in the neighborhood.

Be aware they will take appointments for times in the very near future so as you're sitting there waiting in line they will take an appointment over the phone for someone and basically allow them to cut the line.
My husband and I love their sushi rolls and their atmosphere is great to sit outside! My dad loves their shrimp fried rice :-)

Normally this place is good but unfortunately this time we ordered online it was a bad idea when I come to pick up my food this women told me she male a mistake an give my food to a wrong guest so I said it's ok I'll wait for my food I thought they ware going to remake it but as little I did know there driver go to deliver the food to the right person and it was trying to get my food from them... so when he come back and the girl ask him where the other food was he said to her that the guest was already eating it so by then 20 minutes pass by and they told me we are really sorry we will remake it just give us 10 minutes... so I just told them no thanks and I left . Is unacceptable they are trying to do this... I been in the restaurant bussines for many years  and is no way any restaurant try to get the food back in to the restaurant to give it to an other guest after they already take it home. Very disappointed.
Me and my friend come here all the time Vi and he boyfriend are so amazing at what they do,,, they have very good customer service and they listen to what we want.. I'm so happy with my nails!!!

A 72 year old Las Vegan that has eaten in many casino restaurants.  This was by far the worst food and service I ever experienced.  Five of use visited Du Par's at the Suncoast Casino.

First, service very bad.  We ordered bar drinks and after 15 minutes asked what the problem was.  Response was "they are on the way".  After another ten minutes we asked staff to check in the drinks and waited about 10 more minutes before he brought them.  Oh, the place was not busy.  

Second, the table setting was with the cheapest paper napkins made.  And, when drinks finely arrived they were simply put on the hard table which let wet water from the glasses run on the table.  No coasters.  We had to ask for extra for soak up the water and no help offered.

Third,  the food was worst then the service.  Only one person would rate a 2 star and the rest a 1 (only because you can't leave the rating blank.  We were not asked if we wanted a salad with the meal.  Anyway, I had halibut that was very dry but I ate it because I was hungry.  My baked potato was probably the best food four of us had.  I usually like the potato skin but it was so incrusted in salt I couldn't eat one piece.  Speaking of salt, all the food was very salty.  Also, I like pepper on my potato (I never salt anything) but the shaker was encrusted with dried pepper and whatever I had to retrieve shakers from other tables.  My wife and two others had salmon which was tasteless and drenched in some sort of sauce.  The menu should have stated "served with ??? sauce".  With the salmon was mashed potatoes with a horrible gravy.  The gravy had looked like jell on top of a canned ham.  It was also very salty.  The veggies were way over cooked and simply dumped on the plate.  Back to my potato.  I came with sour cream and three foil wrapped butter patties.  The sour cream was in a small plastic cup which was okay.  The butter patties was laying alongside my hot potato.  By the time it reached the table the butter was beyond soft.  One hell of a job unwrapping liquid butter and getting it on the potato.  Even McDonalds serves butter in small cups like the sour cream.

The bottom line is worst eating experience ever in Vegas.  I can't believe the Suncoast would have such a poor quality restaurant.   Maybe a good manager would help. If I can't get a okay meal at a casino I simply will not visit casino.

If you look past the specious claim that it is Toronto's #1 roti shop, I will concede that Coconut Grove is A-OK. It's tucked between a strip of similarly pocket-sized eateries along Dundas west of Bay street. Inside you'll find a sassy lady shelling out loads of curried meats: oxtail, beef, goat, chicken and stewfish and you can them with rice or roti'd. All the meat is Halal.

I went with the stewfish roti and asked for it spicy. It definitely packed a punch. I thought it was pretty good, though I probably wouldn't go fish again. Prices are pretty reasonable but note there is a $0.25 charge for debit, so you might want to bring cash.

Obligatory Title Pun: They've got a GROVEY thing going on.

Menu Readability: I don't even remember one.

Need to mention: Or 10 rotis and get your 11th free.

What this place teaches me about myself: I'm not even remotely sassy.

Received a call from the manager. Apparently there was a mix up and he was never notified by his regional office about the complaint. He explained and we had a nice chat, he offered a partial refund (which I did not take), but he did offer. After our talk, I would be willing to give them another try and you probably should also.

Stopped by this morning on our way to the opposite side of town. This is a great place for an amazing cup of coffee! We got the "Spicy White Chick". It is a spicy cold brew with white chocolate. It was amazing! We also purchased a regular cold brew with coconut milk and caramel. It was delicious as well. The apple fritters were huge and delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

Giving review based solely on ambiance. 
We walked through Luxor to go see Blue Man Group and get another chip for our casino collection. 
I was amazed at all the Egyptian decor and thought hey this is pretty cool.
I was then horrified to see that the hotel rooms literally open to the casino. No light sleepers allowed here! t
There is also an issue with way finding. We were looking everywhere for signs to point us in the direction of the Blue man Group, after walking the other side of the pyramid, we asked a concierge who said, oh its where the blue light is. Like yea that seems obvious but when there are purple and pink lights going everywhere, it didn't really click. 
The good thing is that the height of the hotel/casino made it seem less smokey, but it just seemed kind of grungy. We were lucky enough to win some money on our first and only spin on the Iron man slot, so I am grateful.

Wow!  Local moms you have to get here ASAP!  The food offerings look amazing. I saw some grab and go that needs to be in my fridge- now. 

However, I only came in for a quick cup of coffee. The cashier encouraged me to try the lavender infused honey latte. Amazing. Great recommendation. 

Both the owners were in there- wow!  What inspiring, kind and fantastic women. 

Give this place a try!

Definately won't go out of my way to go back here.  Average place.  I absolutely cannot stand when I go somewhere, ESPECIALLY in the middle of the day when there was ONE other person in the whole place, and they start doing my nails at the same time my feet are getting done.  How relaxing is that?!  NOT!!!  Please ASK if I'm in a rush and want to be double-teamed!  

Complementary cocktails?  I got a shot of wine.  Which was cheap and nasty.  Which is hard to drink when they hijack your hands during your pedicure.  Again, so not relaxing.

As for the color, I asked for a SIMPLE design on my ring finger.  Even showed them a picture of what I wanted.  Turned out looking like something I could of done myself.  With my eyes closed.

Totally disappointed this place didn't work out.  If you can't even pamper your customers when the business is super quiet, why would anyone go back during busier times?

This part of town is growing. It wasn't a difficult drive and was basically all freeway for me from 7th/McDowell area. 10 to the 51 to the 101 and then Tatum is right there.

I need two more visits to see everything here and by then the exhibits will have changed.

I feel like the musical clips at each exhibit could be a little longer.

I am really happy that the MIM is in Phoenix. I can think of a lot of other cities that could have gotten it. Very cool.

Wear good shoes and don't bring in a big purse or bag. I got achy from walking and standing with a totes small um, tote.

We stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased.  Everyone seemed very courteous, especially Merlin at check in (shout out.)  Here are some pros and cons I've found:
PROS
Beautiful,  clean nice sized room and bath
Generally quiet, not a crazy party crowd
Good service
No casino to wade through
Keurig and cups in room
Mini fridge and microwave- NOT prestocked and weighted!  Just a fridge, yay!

CONS
Nighttime train noise (yes it's real, as per other reviews) it's not constant, but once in awhile they blare the horns as they come through
5 minute walk to strip- which is good for noise, but we did a lot of walking (although there is a shuttle to Caesars)

Overall we were very happy with our stay and would come again.  The pros outweigh the cons, imo.

Not all robertos are created equally...this one is horrible. Staff is rude, asked for no meat got meat...lucky asked for no cheese and they actually did give me any, but skimped on the fries and the drink...horrible. The one next to my work is so much better

We didn't want to deal with going to a club for Halloween so we went here instead. GREAT DECISION! Music was great, the vibe was fun and the ambiance was pleasant as it always is in Cosmo. I usually go to Chandelier, but this place is also great. The only down side was the shots we ordered (raspberry vodka) tasted like water and didn't really have a high alcohol content (especially for $16 a pop). They also have dancers up in these boxes facing the strip - very cool. Highly recommend!

Great food!  Such great ambiance and I am a total India food foodie.  If you are looking for a great place to eat Indian food in Vegas...  THIS is your SPOT, because it hits the SPOT trust me!  You will be glad you ate here.  :-)

Cj used  to be a radio host in Atlanta. Where I had the pleasure of hearing his down syndrome like voice constantly. As you can imagine I was less than happy to hear that he was in Charlotte. Now every time I go to Charlotte I must have my Ipod freshly updated with songs. Just the mere thought of scanning the radio and hearing his voice is enough for me to keep the AUX button on my entire trip. Good job Atlanta for letting him go. I'm sorry city of Charlotte.

My issues with lower back have virtually all disappeared after visting Ling. She is truly amazing at what she does and is very professional, always giving me advice and stretches which i can do at home to prevent reoccurring injuries. Now i visit her on a regular basis for stress reduction and peace of mind.
She has made a difference in my life.
Thank you Ling.

The food and atmosphere are great.  I look forward to coming back again and again.  The plates come out hot so don't touch with your bare hands.  We ordered a la carte so we could try a few things.  The parking is challenging so be careful when you enter the lot and think about how you are going to get out before parking too close to the front door.  But don't let that deter you - the food is worth the challenge.

Great food with lots of selection for a fair price.

Initially when I arrived at Fergus & Bix, I didn't know what to make of it. It was still pretty early in the day, so when my friends suggested it I thought it was more of a breakfast place. Walking into a pub when I was expecting breakfast was kind of surprising. We were quickly informed that we may sit wherever we liked and were given menus. The menus have a crazy number of different items. From wonton soup to noodle bowls to tuna salads to beef dips and steaks. You're sure to find something you want to eat. I wasn't convinced that it was a good place when looking at the prices as they seemed quite steep. After tasting the food though, I knew that the price was worth it. I had the first bite of my beef dip and was amazed at how fresh and delicious the bun and the beef were. Great food paired with good service has made me like this place, but I can't give it 5 stars for those prices.

Plenty of beers (20 on tap) and even more food choices available.

LOVE!

They have the softest bread! Great quality meats, and awesome specials. 

The crew here is fast and friendly. Love this place.

Went here for restaurant week.  The salad with green goddess dressing was amazing and the risotto was decent but the melon sorbet was terrible. I usually love sorbet and have had a lot of different kinds but not only was their flavor off, it had the texture of a freezer burned Italian ice more than a smooth sorbet. Not only that but i sent it back and didn't even get a discount or something to make up for it.

We tired to book the same day dining for Saturday but they did not have availability until 945pm but told us we could come back when we were ready to eat dinner to see if the bar area had seating available. We came back at 7pm and there was seating. We were seating promptly. Service was excellent. Very attentive, our water glass was always full! The food was delicious.
Waygu carpaccio - delicious, the flavors and toppings paired perfectly
Wagyu sukiyaki - 3oz wagyu beef with veggies and noodles. make sure to use the egg dip or you will taste the sweet broth. We also had a side of rice
Toro Tartare - was okay. The toro was a little fishy. They had few different sauce choices. Nori paste, Wasabi, sour cream, chives, Morimoto guac, and rice cracker balls and a light soyu 
Tofu mousse - delicious. Get all the flavors in one bite. 
We will definitely be back. But have to make sure we make reservations beforehand.

The Beef Hot Dog was the best thing but it was to salty. The burgers really didn't have much flavor and wasn't big enough for the buns. The buns were really good as they were buttered and grilled perfectly. Very busy during weekday lunch. almost impossible to find a place to sit. Wasn't worth the trouble to us.

Great stone oven pizza. delicious tomato sauce, perfect mozz cheese, we added proscuitto ontop which just made it that much better.  Small personal pies, but worth the price.  Best Pizza ive had in the burgh so far.

I think i might expected too much from friend's and people's comment, the food is good, but not like 5 star great. The ambiance is great! Love to dine surrounded by 165million worth of Picasso Art.....

had another situation in which the AC was not good for the room. The hotel sent up a portable fan for the room, but what gets me is that when they sent a technician he feels the air and is like, "this is cold air. Its fine." Uh, no, its not, thats why we're calling for you. It only took 8 phone calls to finally have someone come check the air, and then say, "you are wrong, and I am right." Great customer service Luxor. Oh and the bathroom knob fell off when trying to turn on the bath. Mind you, this is in the newer tower rooms, not the pyramid.

Quick friendly service with yummy food! I got the yellow Thai curry with chicken and was completely satisfied with it! My fiancé got the Rama Noodle and loved it! He wouldn't even let me try it at his last bite! And when other customers came in the hostess remembered their orders! It was a really great experience

Attempted to come get a car wash here. Guy said it would be 30 minutes before they start, and an hour and a half before finish, but I could not drive my car to go get food within that 30 minutes even though there was a car in front of mine waiting to go in. I was very disappointed as I was excited about coming to this car wash. Drove 10 miles but they could not even offer me the "luxury" of being able to go eat while o had to wait.

I went to the AAA on Smithfield street first and had an issue as i did not get a vin # check first.
The other office said to go to the Baum Blvd location as they do the vin # checks themselves.
I walked in and AAA is down stairs so I went down the elevator and there were virtually no customers????
There were two customers being helped and one other sitting and waiting for help.
I waited maybe 5 minutes and it was my turn.
The woman I got was extremely friendly and helpful.
I registered two cars with custom plates and joined the AAA as well.
I was there about 30 minutes or so and the woman was extremely helpful.
I walked out of there with two sets of plates and two new registrations.
The building is also huge and is really beautiful inside It has a big open area with a beautiful cathedral ceiling.
Overal definitely 5 stars for service and help.
I also forgot to mention when you pull in the lot you need a token to get out.
When you go down stairs to AAA they give you a token immediately to get out.
So if your going to AAA do not worry about parking in the lot as it is free.

The real deal,  fine dinning @ its finest.  Julian Serrano really  knocked this one out of the park.  French technique with a Spanish influence,  beautiful food.  Very delicious,  Service was spot on,  & the decor is very cool.  They have a bunch of original Picasso pieces hanging everywhere.  Sort of a museum feel,  totally worth every penny.  Special occasion in Vegas,  this is your place.  You can see the Bellagio water show from the dinning room.  Need I say more?
Pretty happy with my experience! Sales team was nice and answered all my patio questions. I appreciated the work ethic of all staff and will be venturing here for all my home needs

I found my dentist!  My perfect minimalist dentist.  This is exactly what I was looking for.  They did not require an initial 2 hr meet your dentist appointment.  They recommended but let me opt out of bite wing xrays. My hygienist did a superb job cleaning my teeth and the dentist did not recommend a bunch of unnecessary costly procedures. Just to add to the awesomeness- I scheduled and was seen on the same day. Worth the drive out of Madison.
Absolutely love it here. 22 oz craft beers $2.50 can't beat that. Also the food is amazing, watch out for the karaoke lol. Going to come back here every time I'm in Vegas now.

Fantastic!  I've been all "I want to go to there" for a few months now in anticipation of my partner-in-crime's birthday and we finally made it this past weekend.  

Food: We had the hot crab dip to start and it was completely delicious, creamy, lemony, and the crab still took centre stage.

I got the salmon special, which featured (memory's a little fuzzy here so I apologize) a root vegetable puree and a deep-fried crumble of breadcrumbs, capers, and some other deliciousness I've sadly forgotten.  The salmon was prepared I think with a brine or something like it and was soft and melted down in my mouth like seafood cotton candy. 

The boyfraand got the scallops, which I'd definitely order next time because they were outstanding.  

The restaurant is dimly lit; a simple decor with modern furniture and cute east-coast details, like stacked cans of evaporated milk.  The service was attentive and knowledgeable.  

Overall, this was a memorably delicious dinner.  

There have been a few comments about portion sizes, and I must say I disagree. Both my boyfriend and I (average sized humans with very healthy appetites) left stuffed after an appetizer and our entrees.

I've been to the New Dumpling House several times in the past and recently went with a friend on a Sunday early evening. The restaurant was completely empty other than those working there and one guy who came in to pick up take-out as we were on our way out.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is underwhelming and actually makes the overall experience a bit unappetizing as does the fact that there are bowls of crispy wonton strips and uncovered containers of duck sauce and hot mustard out on every every table which made me question how fresh and sanitary that is.  My friend ordered green beans with brown sauce which was tasty but she ordered it medium spicy and it had no kick to it whatsoever.  I ordered vegetable pad thai but asked if I could also add tofu and the server said yes.  I also ordered it medium spicy.  My dish was bland and the noodles were undercooked.  The only "vegetables" in it were some shredded carrots and a small handful of what appeared to be canned mushrooms, which I picked out.  Overall the experience was just okay.  I would return if I was in the neighborhood and someone suggested it but will not make a special trip to eat there again.  My rating is actually more like 2.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous.

Drink are free at the bar when you play the slots! 
Bowling was fun and cheap. after 10pm its 1.50/game. 
nice place for family fun or a competitive couple's night out

Terrible, rude, unethical.  I tried contacting this company and was messaged back with obscenities and cuss words. 

Here's Susie's response to my friendly email:  

Susan Minor susiesestateaz@yahoo.com Sunday, October 22, 2017 5:59 PM

OMG, here we go. 

I was speaking nicely. The only "curse" word I used was Shitty...

Like I stated, you can believe what you want - Social Media like Yelp is horrible to most. And I was speaking of Yelp. You have to dig for the positive reviews. My mother was at the Mesa sale. I was the one with the signage. 

And yes, she DID approve me sending emails like that - because it was truthful. 

Anything else you want to gripe about?

We had the tempura green beans to start, outstanding. My wife had the farmers salad and I had the frittata, both were delicious. Our server was  attentive and friendly. The staff overall was great. I would highly recommend Flying Fig and definitely return next time I'm in town.

This restraunt provided a less than mediocre expereience on New Year Eve.

There were long hairs in the noodles and the desert smelt like 10days old.

Donot get there and be cheated.

I'm not aware of better Indian restaurant's ,but certainly this one is hopeless
This place is the best for middle eastern.  The pita bread is too for and all their salads are amazing.

I just wanted to write another review about this fun fun fun place. Been here for the past four weeks with a great friend of mines. Who knows will next weekend be the fifth week in a row that I have been at this place? Only time will tell.

PS Some of the songs that I enjoyed singing at this place are Wiz Khalifa See You Again (from the Furious 7 soundtrack), Carly Rae Jepsen Good Time, Calvin Harris Summer and a bunch of other songs. I would love to Serenade you with all of my songs on my list especially you ladies out there
Every time I have ordered pizza from their website. It has been exactly how I wanted it. The delivery people have been polite an friendly.

The staff is very knowledgeable of the menu and very friendly. The chicken is very juicy and well cooked. Me and my mom got 2 bowls. Mine was a black bean bowl with no pico and no cotjia cheese add jack cheese, and hers was a grande avocado bowl with no pico, no cabbage. The meal tasted amazing! Can't wait to go back!

Soken Chea was amazing today, and I can't say enough about him. He made the task of purchasing new phones/plans/tablets a joy, literally. He is extremely knowledgeable, helpful, friendly, and he explained the confusing deals and marketing clearly so I could make informed decisions. He added value without any of the typical sales pressure. He was wonderful, and I highly recommend Soken and this AT&T store.
Kind of inconsistent when it comes to bringing in good DJs. Still a nice place to chill once and a while though.
She is definitely still the one. Like that she connects with audience but campfire could be changed.  Bit too much in the saloon scenes. Love her music, the opening, wedding dress & the horse scenes.

I had a wonderful 90 minute massage with Annalise.  She worked on the address I requested and mid-way through she asked if I wanted her to spend additional time in a terrible spot.  No one had ever asked that question before and I really appreciated it.   

Everyone is so nice and accommodating.   When I arrived I heard that they had a groupon special.  I loved it up an they offered to honor that price (50%off). Wow.   

When I am back in Phoenix I will definitely go back.   In fact I am here for another 2 weeks and will try to return before I leave.

Erin was a cheerful fantastic enthusiastic server!

Sonny the milkshake man also enjoyed his job and made awesome milkshakes!

The chicken tenders were juicy and flavorful.  I like my fried chicken a bit crispier, but these were good.

Order your fries with cheese and bacon!

I love a good jambalaya, and this place really came through. The rice, chicken, and sausage were all delicious. Perfect amount of spiciness, and an amazing flavor.

The dinner came with a small salad, and some good garlic bread. I'll definitely be back to try some gumbo and one of their desserts, maybe the bread pudding which is supposed to be amazing.

I just went to the Green Valley Car Wash and had my car waxed and detailed for $69. I immediately took a clean white cloth over my car and this is what I found. The clean white cloth is covered in black on both sides . I wish I could figure out how to attach pictures to show you ! Shame on them!!

My first (and only) visit was surprisingly awful.  After being treated by a number of chiropractors in HI, NY and NC, I wanted to try this doctor because we attend the same church. Although I scheduled an appointment for an adjustment, I did not receive one and no staff member told me until I was finished. I DID receive an abundance of paperwork to complete (on paper and a computer), a tour of the office (?!), x-rays and an overall examination in my underwear with another staff member present. This visit took 2 1/2 hours without receiving any relief (an adjustment). Based on my previous experience with chiropractors, this was a complete waste of my time and money!  Would never ever return.

This review is for the gym on the Venetian side.  This gym is very good if you are wanting to do a serious workout with weights.  I was surprised to see barbells in a hotel gym, they have bench, incline, and military, plus a rack for barbell.  Also, there is a smith.  Machines are good and can work almost your entire body.  The place is well maintained and the staff went out of their way to welcome me when I walked in.  If you are staying at Palazzo, li,e me, it takes no more than 5 minutes to get here, just make sure you walk to the Venetian side.
